description.hltext_display: На Эйфелевой башне открылся каток
Keksrezepte aus dem "Aktuellen Thema"
description.content: Last-Minute-Keksebäcker finden im Magazin Rezepte und Tipps rund um die Weihnachtsbäckerei, vorgestellt im "Aktuellen Thema".

description.hltext_display: Medea kann das!
description.content:
. In der FR verteidigt Micha Brumlik den Begriff der Islamophobie und macht gleich mehrere Treitschkes der Jetztzeit ausfindig. Die Welt kritisiert die Schüchternheit der FDP bei der Verteidigung säkularer Werte. Die SZ findet nun auch, dass Wikileaks für einen Paradigmenwechsel im Verhältnis des Staates zu seiner Öffentlichkeit stehe. Ähnlich sieht es Julian Nida-Rümelin in der Zeit. Aber nicht Bernd Ulrich in der Zeit. Der Perlentaucher fragt: Leistungsschutzrechte? Wofür denn?? Alle Zeitungen besprechen höchst beeindruckt Xavier Beauvois' Film "Von Menschen und Göttern". Mehr lesen
15.12.2010. CNN erklärt, warum die Cyberkrieger von Anonymous gegen den Weihnachtsmann keine Chance haben. In den Digitalen Notizen wendet sich der Medienwissenschaftler Stefan Münker gegen die Vermutung, früher sei für Inhalt bezahlt worden. In der FAZ erklärt Frank Rieger vom Chaos Computer Club, warum er das Prinzip Wikileaks für segensreich hält. Die taz wirbt für die Sharjah Art Foundation. Für die SZ ist Xavier Beauvois' Film "Von Menschen und Göttern" ein Wunder. Die NZZ fühlt mit Norwegens totem König Olav. Mehr lesen
14.12.2010. Die NZZ ist entgeistert über die Stillhaltepolitik deutscher Politiker und Medien im Fall der beiden im Iran inhaftierten Journalisten Marcus Hellwig und Jens Koch. Die Blogs erklären einen Tag nach der Gründung des "Igels" gegen das Leistungsschutzrecht, was es mit diesem Spezialpolster für Verleger auf sich hat. Die SZ erklärt die Grundlagen des Cyberkriegs. Die FR beleuchtet die keineswegs vorteilhafte Rolle Pius' XII. und Ernst von Weizsäckers bei der Rettung der Juden von Rom. Mehr lesen
13.12.2010. Im Journal du dimanche erzählt Bernard-Henri Levy, wie er die neuesten Wirren im Fall Sakineh Ashtiani erlebte. Die Diskussion um Wikileaks geht weiter: Auch in den Medien häufen sich die Stimmen für die Enthüllungen. Nachdem Frits Bolkesteins den Juden der Niederlande empfohlen hat zu emigrieren, bringt Trouw eine Reportage über die jüdische Gemeinde im Land. Im Perlentaucher kritisiert Pascal Bruckner die "Erfindung der Islamophobie". In der SZ erzählt Dogan Akhanli, wie er seine Inhaftierung in der Türkei erlebte. Die FAZ diagnostiziert eine Verschwörung zwischen Rechtspopulisten aus Israel und Europa. Inszenierung des Wochenendes: ganz klar Volker Löschs Wedekind-Montage nach "Lulu" mit original Berliner Prostituierten. Und ein Igel ist geboren: gegen das Leistungsschutzrecht. Mehr lesen
11.12.2010. Wikileaks treibt die Zeitungen immer noch stark um. Leiden Journalisten an dem Umstand, dass nicht sie die Dokumente lancierten? Sie sind erstaunlich schlechte Verlierer, schreibt Hans-Martin Tillack in seinem Stern-Blog. Wikileaks ist totales Denunziantentum, meint James Carinsson in der Welt. Im digitalen Zeitalter lassen sich Daten nicht mehr schützen, informiert Tim Renner mit der Erfahrung der Musikindustrie in Carta. Hans Leyendecker stellt sich in der SZ die bange Frage, ob er Teil des Systems sei. Taz und Tagesspiegel staunen über die Linke auf dem Kunstmarkt. Mehr lesen
10.12.2010. In der NZZ verteidigt der der kolumbianische Autor Hector Abad seinen Kollegen Mario Vargas Llosa gegen europäische Lateinamerikaromantiker. In der Welt plädiert Gerhard Schulze gegen totale Transparenz im Internet, auf das er übrigens gern verzichtet hätte. Das Feuilleton der Welt feiert die Freilassung Dogan Akhanli, die sich möglicherweise der Angst vor einer Aktion Günter Wallraffs verdankt. In der FR erklärt der Sinologe Heiner Roetz, warum der Konfuzianismus nicht im Widerspruch zu Menschenrechten steht. SZ und FAZ bringen großformatige Verteidigungen des Buchs "Das Amt". Mehr lesen
09.12.2010. Im Freitag kritisiert der Wikileaks-Dissident Daniel Domscheit-Berg die jüngste Veröffentlichungspolitik seines jüngsten Arbeitgebers. In der Zeit stellt er klar, dass ihm zwar Transparenz in der Organisation, aber mehr noch überall sonst fehlt. Würde ein Medium spo angegriffen wie Wikileaks, dann würden die Medien aber laut schreien, meint Neunetz. Mario Vargas-Llosas Nobelpreisrede spaltet die Feuilletons: Der SZ ist sie zu phrasenhaft und nicht links genug. Die FAZ lobt ihre politische Weitsicht. In der Zeit outet die des Zickenkriegs bezichtigte Alice Schwarzer die wahren Meister des Genres. In der taz lässt Ai Weiwei kein gutes Haar an Liu Xiaobo. Mehr lesen
08.12.2010. Der Tagesspiegel wundert sich: Ausgerechnet die UN-Menschenrechtskommissarin Navi Pillay bleibt der Nobelpreiszeremonie für Liu Xiaobo fern. Der Guardian zählt außerdem alle Länder auf, die aus Angst vor China niemanden nach Oslo schicken. Es gab Zeiten und Gegenden, wo die aggressive Genvariante von Vorteil gewesen sein mag, schreibt der Biologe Gottfried Schatz in der NZZ. Die FR stellt (wie fast alle Zeitungen) die diesjährige Turner-Preisträgerin Susan Philipsz vor. Die FAZ sagt: danke, Julian Assange. Mehr lesen
07.12.2010. Clay Shirky stürzt sich in den Zwiespalt von Transparenz und Geheimnis. In der FR vergleichen Geert Lovink und Patrice Riemens Hacker und Agenten. Die vier Kritiker der Berliner Zeitung sind sich uneins über Thielemanns Beethoven-Zyklus. Der eine in der FAZ auch. Aber dann der langsame Satz! Netzpolitik ist entsetzt über Rot und Grün in NRW. Die taz erscheint heute mit Migrationshintergrund. Die Welt schwärmt von den "Trojanern" an der Deutschen Oper Berlin und vor allem vom Zottelschotten Runnicles. In der SZ wehrt sich der Historiker Gregor Schöllgen gegen den Vorwurf, erst durch den Band "Das Amt" sei die deutsche Außenpolitik der Nazizeit angemessen ausgeleuchtet worden. Mehr lesen
06.12.2010. In der taz fürchtet der britische Diplomat Hugh Mortimer, dass die jüngsten Wikileaks der Transparenz eher schaden als nützen. Im Perlentaucher problematisiert Matthias Küntzel die weiche Linie der Regierung und des Bundestags gegenüber dem Iran - besonders im Fall der Journalisten Marcus Hellwig und Jens Koch. Die NZZ ist verstört: Die Brücke-Künstler haben Kinderakte gemalt. Und das Sprengel-Museum stellt sie aus. Die SZ macht sich Sorgen um die künftige Architektur der letzten Baulücken in Berlin: Ist und bleibt die Stadt eine begehbare Grabplatte? Mehr lesen
04.12.2010. In der FR erzählt der chinesische Verleger Bao Pu von seiner Zusammenarbeit mit Whistleblowern. In der Welt attackiert Theodore Dalrymple die "Lumpenintelligentsia" Großbritanniens. Die NZZ bewundert die spezifischen Schönheiten der von Kees van Dongen porträtierten Damen. In der SZ lehnt Peter Glaser den Internet-Kulturpessimismus von Frank Schirrmacher bis Klaus Staeck rundweg ab. Spiegel-Online berichtet über Versuche, Wikileaks aus dem Netz zu kicken. Mehr lesen

description.hltext_display: Ouverture au Caire du 16è festival des médias arabes avec la participation du Maroc

description.hltext_display: Les jouets plus chers en 2011
description.content:
La hausse des salaires chinois va jouer sur les prix des jouets.
Une petite toupie au nom de Bay Bled pour les garçons et un drôle de hamster nommé Zhu-Zhu Pet pour les filles. Derrière ces deux noms imprononçables, les succès de la saison au rayon jouets de l'hypermarché Auchan. « Ils s'arrachent déjà dans les cours de récréation, d'autant que les fabricants s'arrangent pour créer une pénurie », précise Cyril Ternois, le chef du rayon.
L'autre point commun de ces deux jouets, c'est leur origine chinoise. Comme 95 % des jouets vendus chez Auchan, d'ailleurs, puisque la plupart des fabricants ont délocalisé leur production en Asie en raison des faibles coûts de production.
« Branché sur une chaîne de dessins animés »
Mais ce qui est bon marché aujourd'hui le sera peut-être un peu moins demain. Cet été, le gouvernement chinois a consenti une hausse des salaires de 20 % après une série de mouvements sociaux. Conséquence, les produits en rayon en 2011 devraient être légèrement plus chers.
Pour une enseigne comme Auchan Amiens, qui a consacré 2,7 millions d'euros à l'achat de jouets, le détail a son importance. Aussi, pour ne pas se tromper dans ses commandes, Cyril Ternois fera encore confiance à son flair, mais surtout à celui de ses enfants. « Je suis régulièrement branché sur une chaîne de dessins animés, c'est excellent pour suivre les tendances », admet le spécialiste.

description.hltext_display: 17:02 Cámara acuerda declarar a las Farc como una "organización terrorista"
description.content:
VALPARAÍSO.- Por primera vez en Chile, una entidad oficial del país decidió calificar a las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Colombia (FARC) como una "organización terrorista".
Así se estableció esta tarde en la Cámara de Diputados, luego que la mayoría de los parlamentarios decidiera respaldar el proyecto de acuerdo presentado por los diputados Mónica Zalaquett (UDI) y José Manuel Edwards (RN), en el que, además, se repudia "todo tipo de nexos, de cualquier índole, que dicha organización tenga con partidos u otros grupos sociales o de cualquier naturaleza que existan en nuestro país".
"Las FARC han sembrado el terror en Colombia durante décadas, asesinando, secuestrando y violentando a personas y comunidades enteras. Sólo en 2009 se calcula que las FARC asesinaron a cerca de 17 mil personas y, en los últimos 10 años, ha secuestrado a más de 300 personas, privándolas de sus derechos más esenciales", sostuvieron.
Los legisladores enfatizaron, además, que "el método central de las FARC es el terror, una realidad que ha impulsado a 33 estados a declararlas como una organización terrorista".
Esto, a juicio de los diputados, conduce a que "Chile no quede al margen de esta grave situación que traspasa fronteras y atenta contra la dignidad y la seguridad de América Latina, como comunidad regional".
La iniciativa de los parlamentarios de la Alianza surgió luego que la Fiscalía colombiana -en junio de este año- enviara un dossier a su par chilena donde supuestamente se confirmaba la presencia activistas pro-violencia en La Araucanía en campamentos de la guerrilla colombiana, lo que llevó a la detención del chileno Manuel Olate.
Por esta razón, los diputados hicieron un llamado a sus pares a "no cerrar los ojos frente a la amenaza que constituye esta organización para nuestro país".
En su argumentación, los aliancistas precisaron que "tanto nuestra Constitución Política, como los tratados internacionales que hemos ratificado, así como organizaciones de derechos humanos -como Human Rights Watch y Amnistía Internacional- han reconocido explícitamente que las FARC se fundan en la violación de los derechos humanos y en la violencia contra civiles".
"En el futuro, quienes participaren con las FARC lo tendrán que pensar dos veces, ya que dicha organización será considerada como lisa y llanamente terrorista", finalizaron.

description.hltext_display: Delhi firm has role in bowl game
description.content:
DELHI -- When the Syracuse and Kansas universities football teams take the field for the inaugural New Era Pinstripe Bowl at Yankee Stadium at 3 p.m. Dec. 30, they will be using equipment provided by Sportsfield Specialties of Delhi.
Sportsfield Specialties President Wayne Oliver said Tuesday the equipment includes the football goal posts, flags, end-zone pylons, sideline yardage markers, weather tarp, first-down chain set, down indicators, television camera crew vests, replay review crew vests and network television vests.
As part of the payment for the equipment and installation, Sportsfield Specialties received 20 tickets to the game and advertising on the game program, the scoreboard and the LED board in the Great Hall.
Oliver said regional sales Manager Sean Clark and national sales Manager David Moxley will take 18 Sportsfield Specialties customers to the game, which will be televised on ESPN.
"It's great because Syracuse is going to be in the game, so a lot of local people will be watching," Oliver said. "We might be lucky enough that our advertising near the scoreboard may be seen nationally when the cameras are on the scores.
"We have 50-plus employees locally and a lot of them are Syracuse fans, so it will be nice for them to see equipment they helped manufacture in use on the field."
Clark said the company got the contract to refit Yankee Stadium for college football games because they had ties to the Yankee organization from work done when the stadium was constructed.
"Another plus was that one of the decision makers on the project was a graduate of West Point, and West Point is a long-term customer of Sportsfield Specialties," Clark said. "That connection resonated with him as well."
Clark said work on the conversion began during the Major League Baseball All-Star break in mid-July. He said the concrete for three goalpost foundations was poured in center field and then the field was readied for the rest of the baseball season.
"As soon as the Yankees were eliminated from postseason play, we resumed work and installed the foundations for the other goalposts near home plate," Clark said.
Clark said the first football game played in Yankee Stadium was Nov. 20 when Notre Dame and Army squared off. The New Era Pinstripe Bowl is the second game scheduled in the stadium.
"We are all Yankee fans at Sportsfield," Clark said. "So it's a lot of fun to work for their organization."
Clark said there is another local tie because Rodney Frazier, owner of Track & Field Installers/Frazier's Landscaping of Oneonta, handled the installation work.
Oliver said Sportsfield's sister company, Promats Athletics, provided the padding for Yankee stadium at the time of its construction in 2009.
Oliver said he plans to be glued to the television when the New Era Pinstripe Bowl airs.
"We're pleased to have this opportunity to be a key contributor to the future of Yankee Stadium in college football," Oliver said. "The exposure is terrific for our products, but we're also New Yorkers, and we're fans, and working with the Yankees organization is an honor."

description.hltext_display: Elsner-Berufungsverhandlung hat begonnen
description.content:
Es ist Helmut Elsners erster öffentlicher Auftritt seit der Verurteilung im Juli 2008: Im Justizpalast hat das Berufungsverfahren zur BAWAG-Causa begonnen. Teilweise aufgehoben werden könnte das von Claudia Bandion-Ortner gefällte Urteil.
Ruth Elsner erwartet sich ein "weises Urteil".
Sicherheitsbeamte versuchten, den mittlerweile 75-jährigen ehemaligen Generaldirektor der BAWAG, Helmut Elsner, abzuschirmen. "Kein Interview", riefen sie den zahlreichen Journalisten zu, die sich um Elsner drängten. Im Verhandlungssaal nimmt Elsner sofort am Tisch für den Angeklagten Platz.
Elsners Frau Ruth äußerte sich zuversichtlich, dass der OGH "ein weises Urteil" sprechen werde. Sie habe Hochachtung vor ihrem Mann, dass er eine vierjährige Untersuchungshaft und "Betrug, Lüge und Verrat" überlebt habe. Ihr Mann wolle unbedingt ein Schlusswort sprechen, obwohl er gesundheitlich schwer angeschlagen sei. Er sei "weiterhin kämpferisch".
Elsner: Von der Unperson zum bemitleideten Justiz-Exempel.
Ex-Bankdirektor wird Schlusswort halten
Die Erwartungen an Elsners Schlusswort sind hoch. Bisher nahm sich der Ex-BAWAG-Generaldirektor kein Blatt vor dem Mund.
Sein Schicksal bewegt jedenfalls seit Jahren die Öffentlichkeit, wobei sich das Bild im Laufe der Jahre gewandelt hat. Nachgesagt wurde Elsner ein "aufbrausender, egozentrischer und unnahbarer Führungsstil", der keinen Widerspruch duldete. Zum Auftakt des BAWAG-Prozesses galt er als "Unperson".
Vor allem sein luxuriöser Lebensstil wurde dem Chef einer Gewerkschaftsbank im Lichte der Öffentlichkeit durch den Prozess dann zum Image-Verhängnis: Das von der BAWAG zum Schnäppchenpreis erworbene Penthouse in der Innenstadt, seine Villa in Südfrankreich, sein ganzes Privatleben wurde jahrelang thematisiert.
Imagewandel während der U-Haft
Mit zunehmender Dauer der U-Haft für den herzkranken Elsner stieg aber auch die Sympathie für ihn. Immer mehr Stimmen melden sich mit der Forderung nach Enthaftung, während die Justiz beim 75-Jährigen weiterhin Fluchtgefahr gegeben sieht und auch keine Enthaftung gegen Fußfessel zulässt.
Im Vergleich mit anderen Bankern und Managern, deren Milliardenverluste mit hohen Abfertigungen "belohnt" worden seien, werde mit Elsner übermäßig hart umgegangen, so der Tenor nun. Auch die globale Finanzkrise rückte viele Dinge in ein anderes Licht.
Wären die Spekulationsverluste etwas später bekannt geworden, hätte es gar keinen Prozess gegeben, wird gemutmaßt.
Gefechte vor Gericht
Elsner lieferte sich als Hauptangeklagter jedenfalls immer wieder heftige Wortwechsel mit dem Gericht. "Während Sie abgetanzt haben, habe ich hart gearbeitet", so lautete einer der Vorwürfe des pensionierten Bankers gegen Richterin Claudia Bandion-Ortner.
Der späteren Justizministerin sprach Elsner durchwegs die Kompetenz ab, die verhandelten Vorgänge zu verstehen.
Die Vorwürfe der Anklage, er habe gegenüber der BAWAG Untreue in Milliardenhöhe begangen, versuchte Elsner oft unter Verweis auf die Praxis in einer Großbank zu entkräften. Die Spekulationsgeschäfte der BAWAG seien nicht riskant, sondern auch bei anderen Banken üblich gewesen.
Obwohl Justizexperten das BAWAG-Urteil nach den Empfehlungen der Generalprokuratur für mangelhaft halten, verteidigte Bandion-Ortner zuletzt gegenüber Ö1 ihre Verfahrensführung. "Ich sehe das überhaupt nicht als Misserfolg", so Bandion-Ortner.
Ministerin weist Vorwürfe zurück
In erster Instanz zu neuneinhalb Jahren Haft verurteilt.
Zu neuneinhalb Jahren Haft verurteilt
Ob und wann Elsner das Gefängnis verlassen kann, hängt nun unmittelbar von der OGH-Entscheidung ab. Elsner wurde jedenfalls in erster Instanz zu neuneinhalb Jahre Haft verurteilt. Der 75-jährige Elsner befindet sich seit fast vier Jahren in Untersuchungshaft.
Sollte sich der Oberste Gerichtshof (OGH) dem "Gutachten" der Generalprokuratur anschließen, wären bei Elsner 14 Untreuefakten mit einer Schadenssumme von 1,4 Mrd. Euro zu bestätigen.
Teile des Urteiles gegen ihn könnten aber aufgehoben werden. Dabei geht es vor allem um die Vorwürfe wegen Betruges und Bilanzfälschung. Auf die Strafhöhe für Elsner würde das keinen sehr großen Einfluss haben, weil sich der Schaden von 1,7 Milliarden Euro nur geringfügig verringern würde.

description.hltext_display: Президент уволил губернаторов Львовской и Тернопольской областей
State board to review regulations on wood boilers
description.content:
The state's Environmental Board will meet today to consider regulations on new outdoor wood boilers, according to Lori Severino, spokeswoman for the state Department of Environmental Conservation.
Used to heat buildings, homes and hot water, outdoor wood boilers are fairly common in the countryside where wood is plentiful. Regulations proposed by the DEC are meant to curb pollution and minimize its effects on neighbors, she said.
The regulations under review today pertain only to new units, but the DEC is working on regulations that would apply to existing boilers, Severino said.
"That's going to require more public outreach," she said.
The proposal for new outdoor wood boilers mandates that they have smokestacks that reach 18 feet off the ground and meet emissions standards.
The DEC limits what can be burned, noting: "Seasoned clean wood may be burned in an OWB. 'Clean wood' is defined as … wood that has not been painted, stained or treated with a coating, glue or preservative.
"In addition, natural gas and heating oil that meets the sulfur content limits … and non-glossy, non-colored papers, including newspaper, may be used as starter fuels. The Department may approve additional fuels for specific models of new OWBs, provided that the models have been tested via United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)."
Prohibited fuels include "garbage, yard waste, household chemicals and animal carcasses."
Residential wood boilers have to be situated at least 100 feet from property borders. The rules for commercial boilers are stricter. They will have to be at least 1,000 feet from schools, 300 feet from the nearest property line and 200 feet from the nearest neighbor.
After April 15, new boilers sold in the state will be limited to models certified by the DEC, the regulation states. It may be viewed at www.dec.ny.gov/chemical/70990.html.
The new rules appear five years after the state's Environmental Protection Bureau, overseen by then-Attorney General Eliot Spitzer, published a damning report on OWBs: "Smoke Gets In Your Lungs." At the time researchers found, "Even when properly used, OWBs emit on an average per-hour basis about four times as much fine particulate matter pollution as conventional wood stoves, 12 times more than EPA certified stoves, 1,000 times more than an oil furnace and 1,800 times more than a gas furnace."
Still, new OWBs may be cleaner. According to Central Boiler, a large manufacturer with a dealer network, its new models are clean burning, "The E-Classic uses a three-stage combustion process to burn wood so completely that combustion efficiencies approach 100 percent."
The unit costs range from $5,640 to $12,040 at Myheatingoptions.com.
Chenango County Farm Bureau President Bradd Vickers said rural New Yorkers can't afford to pay for these new furnaces.
"They've already invested in furnaces, and by and large they've generated few complaints," Vickers said.
`The DEC is singling out a segment of the population, and the regulations don't recognize that the vast majority of OWB units operate in areas where there are no neighbor complaints and no human or environmental impacts," he said.
With only 100 or so complaints about 40,000 units, Vickers said, "this appears to be a knee-jerk reaction -- especially when DEC doesn't have adequate staff to handle its other missions, like monitoring natural gas drilling."
Alvin Edmonds of South Brookfield Road, Columbus, owner of Edmunds Lumber, said that if the DEC proceeds with plans to regulate existing units, he won't invest in a new one.
"The state's always after you," said Edmunds, 65, who uses his OWB to heat his kiln and dry his lumber.
"I can tell you this," he said. "I can't afford to heat that kiln with oil or gas. It's got to be heated with wood."

I can tell you this; I can't afford to heat that kiln with oil or gas. It's got to be heated with wood.

description.hltext_display: ACS en Alemania dice que la oferta por Hochtief se mantiene sin cambios
description.content:
La portavoz de ACS en Alemania ha asegurado hoy que el la oferta de la empresa por la alemana Hochtief y su estrategia se mantiene sin cambios.
Esta mañana, ACS informó que a 21 de diciembre posee el 27,26% de los derechos de voto de Hochtief y que hasta la misma fecha habían acudido 5.825 acciones de la alemana a la opa.

description.hltext_display: Les centres commerciaux, cibles privilégiées des voleurs
description.content:
Les gendarmes sillonnent le site à longueur de journée.
Les clients se sont demandé ce qu'il se passait. Certains regards étaient médusés. Dans la galerie du centre commercial Auchan à Fayet, dans l'agglomération saint-quentinoise, trois gendarmes déambulent avec leur berger allemand. La présence des forces de l'ordre est avant tout dissuasive. La période des fêtes de fin d'année, et c'est bien connu, est propice aux vols à la ruse ou à la tire. Personne n'est à l'abri d'une mauvaise surprise.
Le préfet de l'Aisne, Pierre Bayle, s'est déplacé sur le site pour son opération anti-hold-up, comme ce fut le cas, il y a deux semaines, à Chauny. Bien entouré des gendarmes de Saint-Quentin, il a sillonné les allées de la galerie marchande, rencontré les commerçants. Eux aussi ont été étonnés. C'est vrai qu'un préfet, ça ne se déplace pas tous les jours. « La délinquance générale est en baisse de 3,61 % dans l'Aisne par rapport à la même période en 2009 », a-t-il rappelé. 22 384 faits ont été constatés entre le 1er janvier et le 30 novembre 2010.
Le lieu n'a pas non plus été choisi par hasard. Le centre commercial est situé à un endroit stratégique : deux autoroutes (A26 et A29) ne sont qu'à quelques kilomètres. C'est aussi une position idéale. Les personnes malintentionnées ont le loisir de déguerpir en quelques minutes. « Nous patrouillons le matin et l'après-midi. Pendant les périodes de Noël, nous avons rappelé des réservistes », assure le commandant de la compagnie de Saint-Quentin.
Le chef de la sécurité d'Auchan est lui aussi sur les dents. Avec lui, quinze personnes travaillent quotidiennement dans le magasin, ce qui en fait l'un des staffs les plus importants du département. « Les gens de passage sont des spécialistes du vol. À chaque prise, ce sont des quantités importantes. » En moyenne, 20 000 personnes déambulent dans les allées du centre commercial chaque samedi. Les tentations sont grandes.
Le centre commercial est également équipé en vidéosurveillance : 90 caméras filment sans interruption l'intérieur et l'extérieur du site. Le lieu dans lequel sont visionnées les images a été tenu à l'écart des yeux indiscrets de la presse, seules des personnes triées sur le volet peuvent y avoir accès. Et pourtant, si elles paraissent une arme absolue aux yeux de certains, les caméras n'ont pas permis de résoudre le casse de l'année dans le centre commercial.
Dans la nuit du 12 au 13 juin dernier, neuf hommes cagoulés et gantés, avaient pénétré à l'intérieur de la galerie marchande en fracturant le rideau métallique du restaurant Flunch. Ils se sont ensuite attaqués à deux bijouteries. En l'espace de quelques minutes, les malfrats ont fait main basse sur 500 000 euros de bijoux en or. L'enquête de la brigade de recherche de Saint-Quentin n'a toujours pas été élucidée, près de sept mois après les faits.

description.hltext_display: SUCO not among 'druggiest' schools, locals say
description.content:
ONEONTA -- An online magazine recently ranked State University College at Oneonta as one of the "50 Druggiest Colleges" in the United States. Several people who talked about the designation disagreed with the findings.
The college was ranked sixth in a Dec. 13 gallery that accompanied the article in The Daily Beast. State University College at Purchase was ranked fourth and the University of New Hampshire had the top post. It was an effort to find out which campuses have environments that permit drug use, as well as a student body that partakes of illegal drugs, according to the story.
The college declined to comment on the ranking, Director of Communications Hal Legg said in an e-mail Monday. He did not return a call on the subject Tuesday. A Monday call to campus University Police was also referred to Legg.
"I think the whole thing is preposterous," Oneonta Mayor Dick Miller said about the findings.
According to the article, colleges and universities were ranked giving equal weight to three criteria.
It used the College Prowler, a college ranking by students for students, to see how students grade their campus regarding drugs and alcohol. A ranking of A+ indicates that drugs and alcohol are not noticeable on campus, and there is no pressure to use drugs. Oneonta received a C ranking, according to the article.
The surrounding environment is considered, using the most recent statistics on illicit drug, marijuana and cocaine use by state for 18- to 25-year-olds, according to the U.S. Department of
Health and Human Service's 2009 National Survey on Drug Abuse. The number of 2009 arrests for on-campus drug law violations is also a factor. The arrest total for SUNY Oneonta was listed as 38 out of a student population of 5,893.
The Daily Beast editorial department did not respond to two e-mails for comments on the findings.
Miller said he has no reason to think the designation as one of the "druggiest" colleges was credible.
For instance, the number of arrests is an indication of diligence by University Police, he said. The type of survey about student usage is historically not valid, he said.
Oneonta police Lt. Dennis Nayor said when asked about the issue, "Whatever we deal with is right on par with any college -- no more or less." SUNY Oneonta is "a well-respected college that has tightened its admission standards and is always trying to improve," he said.
It was unfair for the hard work of University Police to bias the statistics, he said. The college should be credited with having a system that can take action against students arrested off-campus, he said. It helps send a message about what is tolerated.
Two students and a college services employee also said the ranking is unjustified.
Senior Brian Strozinsky, 22, said he has heard from '70s graduates that the college had a reputation as a "party school."
"There is a completely different atmosphere today," he said.
It's a dry campus now, with more active law enforcement, Strozinsky said.
"It's a lot harder for someone to use alcohol or drugs," he said.
In the five years that he has been a student, the college has raised its standards, he said, and the quality of the students has improved.
Senior Kristen Tomanocy said she also disagreed with the findings. She does not see problems with illegal drug usage among students.
"It's something you can easily avoid," she said.
While drinking can be a problem for some, that is more of a societal issue, she said. The college does a good job in providing alternatives to drinking and drugs, through such things as programs at Hunt Union.
Oneonta Auxiliary Services employee Valery Worden said that the college has a much higher standard for students than it did a decade ago. With the caliber of students that she sees, she said, the school ranking is wrong.
"I just don't see it."

description.hltext_display: Your views: Letters to the editor (Dec. 22)
description.content:
Mondays paper full
of bizarre stories
After reading Mondays DAY, I came away thinking the whole world has gone mad.
New Mexicos governor is thinking of pardoning Billy the Kid, a known killer, 130 years after his death.
Another story was about a young woman who was beaten to death by her lover, whom she refused to press charges against. Our new governor is having an inaugural ball funded by people he spoke against during his campaign, while Floridians are going without heat during cold spells.
A woman has a closet full of dead and dying cats but doesnt know how they got there. Sarah Palin is compared to Mother Teresa as models for all women. South Korea is on the brink of war with North Korea and the U.N. Security Council stands silent.
A murderer who savagely killed several people is fighting for his life. Millions of people have no idea what Christmas is about and as many dont care. Nurses were given licenses using phony records.
The more I read in Mondays edition, the more bizarre it got.
I honestly thought that after Florida elected a governor responsible for the biggest Medicare fraud in history that the news would lighten up. Instead, we find that Mr. Scott had more surprises, as evidenced by his extravagant inaugural.
The good news is I know what Christmas is about and my days on Earth are getting short.
Gary P. Guido
Merritt Island Transition ex-shuttle
workers to green jobs
While reading this weekends special report about how the end of the shuttle program will affect Titusville residents from all walks of life, I began to think about what solutions there could be for this highly trained, technically skilled workforce that soon will be out of work.
Many have worked or been involved in a career that has placed them at the forefront of science, technology and expertise. What about transitioning this workforce into green jobs and the renewable energy economy?
Many possess the skills and expertise necessary for working in the development of solar technology. Others will have construction experience important in solar installation and assembly and green building production. Many more possess the skills to improve energy efficiency and weatherization standards.(2 of 3)Green industries have potential for growth and will be around for a long time. As our knowledge and understanding of solar energy improve, the industry is likely to grow. At a time when whole sectors of our economy are struggling, many states have seen solar businesses expand.
Working in the green economy will help reduce our dependence on foreign oil, and decreasing our use of dirty sources of energy, such as oil and coal, will be better for our health and environment.
Its past time we embarked down the road toward a cleaner energy future.
Jenna Stern
State associate, Environment Florida
Miami Beach
Story on group aiding
homeless vets buried
I am unhappy about the placement of the article, Group helps homeless vets, in DAY on Dec. 13.The article was buried inside the newspaper. I was appalled that anything regarding our veterans be pushed to the back. These men and women have earned and deserve the right to be in the front of the paper. It is because of them that we have the right to our freedom of speech.
As a member and officer of S.A.L. Squadron 1, American Legion Post 1, Titusville, and American Legion Riders, I was just one of many who worked with pride on this event to help homeless vets. We were thrilled with the amount of support we received from the community.
Our purpose was to raise funds to help the homeless veterans and bring awareness that they are out there.
Placing this article so far back in the newspaper diminished the awareness of these veterans Its just sad.
Louis Napolitano
Titusville
Columnist sheds needed
light on social workers
Deep, heartfelt thanks to Norris Burkes for his lovely column in Sundays paper about the children he and his wife adopted and the role the social worker played.
He gave clarity to a very misunderstood occupation. Social workers are often seen as child protective service workers who take children from their homes when there is suspicion of abuse and neglect.(3 of 3)In truth, they are some of the most compassionate and caring people I have ever met, and I am proud to call this my profession. Social workers have an education that is equivalent to a counseling degree with many psychology classes. Their schooling addresses a persons emotional, spiritual, physical well-being as well as community environment. We work in positions that are more than just protective services.
Many social workers are in nursing homes, where the expectations on them are tremendous. They must nurture patients, their family members and often the staff. The record-keeping is overwhelming.
In law enforcement agencies, they are skilled at crisis intervention and victim services. In hospitals, they are often the people on whom the complicated problems are dumped. Social workers must be negotiators, problem solvers, strategists, counselors, drug and alcohol therapists and, oftentimes, ministers as they help individuals who are struggling with deep depression and anxiety.
As Norris jokingly quipped, social workers had best be like the wise men to survive in their fields of choice.
Rose Roach
Titusville
Blue Cross, Blue Shield
helps fund inaugural
Regarding Mondays article, Donations fund governors inaugurals:
Really! Our newly elected governor, Rick Scott, just got a $25,000 donation from Blue Cross and Blue Shield (BCBS) of aid in throwing his big inaugural celebration.
Guess what I, and Im sure many others, got from BCBS in November? A notice increasing my health insurance premiums by $30.63 monthly. So whos really paying for this party?
And I didnt even get an invitation. BCBS just lost a patient.
Paul Barton
Melbourne

description.hltext_display: King of Kwaito to relax in the festive
description.content:
King of Kwaito Arthur Mafokate will be taking it easy during the festive season – as he is only booked for three performances.
The Triple 9 founder says he has been too busy over the past 15 years of being in the entertainment industry and it is time for him to relax
YFM News caught up with Mafokate who says he will be spending time with his family on Chritmas day unlike Chomee who will be performing throughout the country. description.hltext_display: 一粒石子引发的“血案”，玻璃险能买就买了吧
description.content: 郁闷！杯具！上周在高速上，被一块小石头把前挡风玻璃击中了！还好宝马的玻璃比较结实，没有穿洞。我都搞不清楚是哪里来的小石子，吓了一大跳，幸亏驾驶经验比较丰富，否则要出大事。真是一粒石子引发的“血案”，飞来横祸啊！ 还好我当时在平安的官网买车险的时候，随手把玻璃单独破损险也买了，否则不知道要自己掏多少大洋，平安的“资料齐全，万元以内，一天赔付”还不是徒有虚名，这个小case一天时间就把钱打到我账户了。 有车的同志们，不要以为玻璃险上不上无所谓，现在高速路上神马都有，小石子碎玻璃大石块是常有的事情，一旦遇上就是一场杯具，万事都要未雨绸缪，有条件的话就上一个玻璃险，也没多少钱，用平安网上的车险报价器看一下，普通家用轿车的玻璃险也就一百多，当然玻璃也分国产还是进口，看自己车子定吧。比起原厂玻璃动辄几百上千的价格，哪个合算，一看便知。

description.hltext_display: Congress OKs dual-source warship purchase
description.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Congress cleared the Navy to split a roughly $10 billion purchase of the first 20 in a new class of coastal warships between teams led by Lockheed Martin Corp and Australia's Austal Ltd, instead of picking just one of the two rival designs as previously planned.
The split would save $2.9 billion through 2016, and yield 20 "littoral combat ships" for the price of 19, Navy Secretary Ray Mabus said last week in urging Congress to approve the revamped purchase plan.
The vote to buy both types of coastal combat ships is likely to fuel controversies over proposed dual purchases of other major military systems.
Among these are engines for Lockheed Martin's F-35 Joint Strike Fighter aircraft.
Separately the Air Force is preparing to start buying a new fleet of mid-air refueling aircraft either from Boeing Co or Europe's EADS. In these two cases, the Pentagon is seeking to rely on one model only.
President Barack Obama is expected to sign into law this week the so-called "continuing resolution" that funds the government through March and that contains the split-buy provision for the new ships.
The highly automated vessels are designed to operate close to shore and feature equipment modules that may be swapped out for missions such as combating enemy surface vessels or sweeping for mines.
They will be built by Austal USA, which has a shipyard in Mobile, Alabama, and Lockheed Martin, which has partnered with a shipyard in Marinette, Wisconsin, just across the border from Michigan.
The Lockheed Martin ship has a steel hull; Austal's is an aluminum trimaran. Each shipyard is now building its second vessel on contract, and the Navy hopes to buy 55 of the ships overall. When complete, the LCS fleet would make up about one-sixth of the entire U.S. Navy fleet.
"This is a unique and valuable opportunity to lock in the benefits of competition and provide needed ships to our fleet in a timely and extraordinarily cost effective manner," Mabus, the Navy secretary, said in a statement.
Senate Armed Services Committee chairman Carl Levin, a Michigan Democrat, said the deal was expected to fund 500 direct jobs in Michigan's upper peninsula, and support up to an additional 2,500 jobs in Michigan.
Senator Richard Shelby, an Alabama Republican, said Austal would add nearly 2,000 jobs in south Alabama for the program.
Without the legislation, the Navy would have to pick one contractor for the next phase of the ship's construction. In revamping its acquisition strategy, the Navy said last month that the prices offered by the rivals were so good that it made sense to buy from both and preserve competition.
The measure passed the House of Representatives by a vote of 193 to 165 after clearing the Senate earlier in the day, 79 to 16. In opposing the new approach, Senator John McCain of Arizona, the top Republican on the Armed Services Committee, argued that it constituted "an abrogation of our constitutional oversight responsibility."
"I suggest that, having made key decisions on the program hastily and ill-informed, we in Congress are partly to blame" for what he called a program that has been plagued by instability.
He cited questions raised by congressional experts about the cost of operating and maintaining two versions of the ship rather than reaping economies of scale from just one.
Separately, Senator Sherrod Brown, an Ohio Democrat, said he had received confirmation from the White House's Office of Management and Budget director Jacob Lew that the continuing resolution would maintain funding for the alternate F-35 engine.
The interchangeable engine is being developed by the team of General Electric- Rolls Royce despite President Barack Obama's contention that it is wasteful. He has vowed to veto any spending measure that funds it.
United Technologies Corp's Pratt & Whitney unit builds the engine being used in early F-35 production. Its backers had hoped that the White House would cut off funds for the rival engine in the absence of a specific appropriation for it.
The Defense Department has sought to end the second engine program for the past five years as a belt-tightening measure.
Sen. Joseph Lieberman, an Independent of Connecticut, where United Technologies is headquartered, said he would continue to fight to kill the alternate engine during the term of the continuing resolution and when the Senate considers a measure to fund the government for the rest of 2011.
Obama, in a May 28 statement, said the military did not want or need the second engine nor more Boeing C-17 cargo planes "and should Congress ignore this fact, I will veto any such legislation so that it can be returned to me without those provisions."
Congress has not sought to fund any more C-17s for fiscal 2011, which began October 1. The House on Friday approved a defense authorization bill that ducked a decision on the alternate engine. Senate action on its version of the defense spending bill may come this week.
(Reporting by Jim Wolf; editing by Carol Bishopric)
(c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2010. Check for restrictions at: http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

description.hltext_display: Lotería de Navidad: Zapatero juega poco y Rajoy apuesta por el 6
description.content:
(09.29) El jefe del Gobierno, José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero, ha asegurado hoy que ha apostado "poco" para el sorteo de la Lotería de Navidad de hoy, mientras que el líder del PP, Mariano Rajoy, ha comprado décimos en Galicia y Madrid, y ha confiado en que el 'Gordo' termine en 6, el número que lleva.
A la misma hora que comenzaba el sorteo extraordinario de Navidad, los miembros del Gobierno y los diputados comenzaban en el Congreso el último pleno del año, en el que Zapatero va a explicar las conclusiones del Consejo Europeo celebrado la pasada semana.
Zapatero ha dicho al entrar en el hemiciclo que no sabe exactamente cuántos décimos de lotería ha comprado este año y se ha limitado a decir que "pocos". Tampoco la ministra de Asuntos Exteriores, Trinidad Jiménez, ha gastado mucho, ya que sólo ha comprado el número del ministerio.
Por su parte, Rajoy ha afirmado que tiene décimos comprados en Madrid y en Galicia, y ha apostado por que el 'Gordo' termine en 6, antes de desear suerte a los informadores que se encontraban en el pasillo del Congreso.

description.hltext_display: 19:18 Diputado Hales defiende interpelación a la ministra Matte
description.content:
SANTIAGO.- El diputado del Partido por la Democracia (PPD), Patricio Hales, justificó este martes la interpelación realizada a la ministra de Vivienda, Magdalena Matte, en la Cámara Baja, asegurando que "permitió develar un poco más de transparencia", respecto al proceso de reconstrucción de las zonas afectadas por el terremoto y tsunami del 27 de febrero.
Hales afirmó que "la interpelación nos ha reafirmado que la decisión de los 48 diputados de hacer una interpelación era seria, real, verdadera y necesaria para una materia que está haciendo sufrir a los chilenos y el Gobierno ha pecado de sobrepolitización y politiquería al transformar la interpelación en un show de ministros que vinieron a la Cámara de Diputados a ser comparsa de un festival de transformismo en materia de noticias y de cifras que son muy serias y representan el dolor de los chilenos".
Asimismo, el legislador sostuvo que pasadas 24 horas de la interpelación "comprobé con los datos del MINVU que definitivamente aquí ha habido transformismo comunicacional y se ha hecho un abuso con las cifras".
"Les puedo decir a los chilenos que las 100 mil casas prometidas, que el Presidente anunció que van a estar construidas o en construcción para junio del 2011 no van a existir. Estudiando el listado oficial que entregó la ministra en la interpelación descubrimos que de las 100 mil viviendas prometidas sólo 40 mil serán viviendas compradas o construidas y el resto, es decir 60 mil, solo serán reparaciones menores, de 55 UF, incluido IVA y utilidades de las constructoras. Casi el 60 por ciento (61.800) corresponden al programa PPPF (patrimonio familiar) que inició (la ex presidenta Michelle) Bachelet y solo 41 mil de construcción, lo anterior, muy lejos de la reconstrucción de las 190 mil viviendas indicadas en la página oficial del MINVU", detalló el diputado.
Hales manifestó que "a raíz de estos antecedentes, podemos decir que la interpelación permitió develar un poco mas de transparencia, porque la información de viviendas construidas no se quiso entregar durante todo el año y sólo gracias al anuncio de la interpelación, en noviembre comenzaron a aparecer las primeras cifras de construcción en la web del MINVU", recalcando que "durante 9 meses, ésta había sido ocultada".

description.hltext_display: Watson to leave Business Link
description.content:
Peter Watson, the managing director of Business Link Northwest, is to leave his post at the end of the year, it has been announced. He will be replaced by Donna Edwards, who takes over on 1 January 2011.
It comes as Business Link Northwest says it is "very much open for business" despite planned redundancies due to budget cuts.
Watson, who is to step down on 31 December 2010, said: "I have thoroughly enjoyed my time with Business Link Northwest (BLNW) and am pleased that the excellent services we provide are recognised by our customers and key partners in the region.
"However, as Business Link enters its next phase, I feel it is appropriate for me to pursue other opportunities in the private sector and will leave at the end of the year."
Vanda Murray, BLNW chairman, paid tribute to Watson's work, adding: "Looking to the future there is still much work to be done in delivering support to North West businesses, as well as the transition to whatever the future business support landscape might be and the changes this will involve.
"I am therefore pleased to announce the appointment of Donna Edwards as managing director of Business Link Northwest from 1 January 2011."
Business Link, which has been forced to cut 194 staff due to budget cuts, said it is still "very much open for business".
It has telephone and face-to-face advisers which provide businesses with support and advice.

description.hltext_display: Börsen-Bericht: Dax startet mit geringem Plus in den Handelstag
description.content:
Dax startet mit geringem Plus in den Handelstag
Der Leitindex rangiert knapp unter seinem Jahreshoch. Der Nikkei gibt nach, nachdem Tokio die Geschäftsklimaprognose zurücknahm.
Der deutsche Aktienmarkt ist am Mittwoch kaum verändert gestartet. Der Dax stieg in den ersten Minuten um 0,05 Prozent auf 7082 Punkte. Der deutsche Leitindex hatte am Vortag bei mehr als 7087 Punkten den höchsten Stand seit Anfang Juni 2008 erreicht und seine Bestmarke vom Wochenbeginn um rund 20 Punkte nach oben geschraubt. Der MDax rückte um 0,27 Prozent auf 10 101 Punkte vor, nachdem der Index mittelgroßer Werte am Vortag erstmals seit gut zweieinhalb Jahren über die Marke von 10 000 Punkten geklettert war. Der Technologiewerteindex TecDax gab dagegen um 0,05 Prozent auf 843 Punkte nach.
Die Aktienbörsen in Fernost haben am Mittwoch uneinheitlich notiert. Der Markt in Tokio gab leicht nach, nachdem die japanische Regierung ihre Export- und Geschäftsklima-Prognosen heruntergeschraubt hatte. Der Nikkei-Index war jedoch im Handelsverlauf auf ein neues Sieben-Monatshoch gestiegen, was nach Meinung einiger Marktteilnehmer eine positive Grundstimmung signalisiert. Zudem seien die Anleger vorsichtig, weil die Finanzmärkte in Tokio am Donnerstag geschlossen sind.
Der 225 Werte umfassende Nikkei-Index beendete den Handel mit einem Minus von 0,2 Prozent bei 10.346 Punkten. Der breiter gefasste Topix-Index blieb nahezu unverändert bei 905 Stellen. Angesichts der gestiegenen Rohstoff-Preise verzeichneten die Papiere von Handels-Häusern dennoch Gewinne. Die Aktien von Marubeni legten um 0,9 Prozent zu und die von Mitsui um 0,7 Prozent.
Der Markt in Südkorea schloss nahezu unverändert, nachdem er am im Handelsverlauf auf ein neues 38-Monatshoch gestiegen war. Zu den Gewinnern zählten Autowerte wie Kia Motors mit einem Plus von 4,5 Prozent. Der Markt in Hongkong tendierte den zweiten Tag infolge höher, während der Leitindex in Shanghai Verluste verzeichnete. Die Börsen in Taiwan und Singapur tendierten dagegen im Plus.

description.hltext_display: Alemania: los precios de importación suben un 1,2% en noviembre
description.content:
Los precios de las importaciones alemanas subieron un 1,2% en noviembre respecto a octubre, cuando se produjo un descenso del 0,2%.
En comparación con el mismo mes del año pasado, los precios subieron un 10,2%, por encima del alza del 9,2% de octubre.
Los analistas consultados por Bloomberg esperaban de media un aumento mensual del 0,5% y una tasa ineteranual del 9,3%.

description.hltext_display: Deutsche Bank muss Millionen zahlen
description.content:
New York/Frankfurt (dpa) - Die USA haben die Deutsche Bank für ihre Beteiligung an illegalen Steuersparmodellen zur Rechenschaft gezogen. Das Frankfurter Geldhaus willigte ein, knapp 554 Millionen Dollar an den amerikanischen Fiskus zu zahlen.
Im Gegenzug würde der Fall nicht weiter verfolgt, teilte die US-Bundesstaatsanwaltschaft in Manhattan am Dienstag mit. Die Deutsche Bank habe kriminelles Fehlverhalten eingestanden, hieß es in der gemeinsamen Mitteilung der Staatsanwaltschaft und der Steuerbehörde IRS. Die illegalen Steuersparmodelle für Kunden, in die das Kreditinstitut verwickelt gewesen sei, hätten zu milliardenschweren Ausfällen für den Staat beigetragen.
Die Fälle liegen nach Angaben der Deutschen Bank allerdings schon Jahre zurück - von 1996 bis 2002. Die Bank habe ihre Richtlinien und Verfahren seitdem wesentlich verschärft, teilte das Kreditinstitut mit. Im Rahmen der sogenannten Nichtverfolgungsvereinbarung muss sie ihre internen Mechanismen weiter verfeinern.
Ein unabhängiger Experte überwacht, dass sich die Deutsche Bank nichts mehr zuschulden kommen lässt. Zudem muss die Bank von Zeit zu Zeit Bericht an die US-Behörden erstatten. Steuersparmodelle, die den kritisierten ähnlich sind, sind für die Frankfurter künftig komplett tabu.
Finanziell hat die Deutsche Bank vorgesorgt. Sie bildete nach eigenen Angaben in der Vergangenheit ausreichende Rückstellungen, «so dass der zu zahlende Betrag keine Auswirkungen auf das laufende Ergebnis nach Steuern haben wird». Immer wieder hatte die Deutsche Bank in ihren Finanzberichten vage auf Steuerermittlungsverfahren in den USA hingewiesen.

description.hltext_display: 评论称iPhone让国内运营商画地为牢
description.author: cmsnews
description.content: 特约撰稿 马振贵 iPhone进入国内市场已经有些时日了，虽然中国联通获得了一定的高端用户的支持，但是由于水货市场的泛滥，中国联通渴望出现的高端用户大面积流入的现象并没有出现，相反中国移动借助水货的力量以及其他手段也获得了足够多iPhone拥有者的倒戈。这不能不说是一件令人尴尬的事情。更主要的是，两个运营商之间对iPhone的争夺几乎到了无所不能、不择手段的地步，联通在无奈之下的机卡分离政策也强横出场。 我们关注的是，... ... 原文地址:http://www.techweb.com.cn/column/2010-12-22/727642.shtml

description.hltext_display: Breaking News II: Royal Dutch Shell, Qatar Petroleum
description.author: financial.de
description.content: Royal Dutch Shell: Der Ölkonzern und Qatar Petroleum wollen nach eigenen Angaben für mehrere Mrd. USD ein Petrochemiewerk in Katar bauen. Beide Unternehmen haben eine entsprechende Absichtsvereinbarung zum Bau der Anlage für 6 Mrd. USD unterzeichnet. Das Werk soll eine Kapazität von 1,5 Mio. Tonnen/Jahr Mono-Ethylenglycol (MEG) haben. Das Projekt wurde beschleunigt, damit es vor den umfangreichen Arbeiten im Zuge der Fußballweltmeisterschaft 2022 in Betrieb gehen kann. Das Werk soll etwa 2016 bis 2017 fertig gestellt werden. MEG wird für die Herstellung von Frostschutz, Kunststoffflaschen oder Polyester verwendet.

description.hltext_display: Trampled and trounced by Twitter
description.content:
Gone are the days when sports stars were only available through traditional media platforms such as print, radio and television. Now your favourite athlete can be followed constantly through such social networks as Twitter and Facebook.
Sports stars initially flocked to these two sites, particularly Twitter, as it was seen to be a way to get their thoughts and point of view across without the risk of being misquoted or taken out of context.
But in more recent times, these high-profile sportsmen and women have come to realise that these social mediums may not be the answer they were looking for.
St Kilda captain Nick Riewoldt, like many others before him, will attest that such sites as Facebook and Twitter can do more harm than good, after a naked picture of Riewoldt was posted on both sites earlier this week.
Although Riewoldt was not involved in its publication and believed the photo no longer existed he will still learn a valuable lesson about the dangers of social media.
In light of the latest Facebook and Twitter controversy BPL felt that it was necessary to reminisce on some of the not so finer moments of sports stars and the technology revolution.
1. Nick Riewoldt
The Saint was caught with his pants down after having a happy snap taken with a team mate in a hotel room in Miami. Although there are conflicting statements about who took the picture there is no debating that the release of the photo has caused great embarrassment to Saints leader.
The story that revolves around the release of the picture appears to be far more interesting than the picture itself. In the days after the photo was first posted on her Facebook site, the teenager, who is the same girl who was romantically linked to two St Kilda footballers earlier in the year, has appeared on several radio stations and given countless interviews.
This story promises to continue to evolve as the female in question promises to release several other photos of St Kilda photos in the coming days.
2. Joel Monaghan
What happens when you combine alcohol, mad Monday celebrations, a mobile phone, Joel Monaghan and a dog? It sounds like a bad joke but for Joel Monaghan it was anything but as the former Canberra Raider found himself immersed in controversy and without an employer. Monaghan fronted the media looking like a man who had lost a close friend and he probably had as one of his team-mates posted the picture online via Twitter.
3. Stephanie Rice
Stephanie Rice (pictured, above) was left shattered after Australia’s golden girl of the pool posted a late night rant on Twitter in which she labelled the South African Springboks as “faggots”. A remorseful Rice fronted the media and apologised profusely for her comments but not before her sponsorship deal with Jaguar had driven off a cliff.
"Suck on that faggots. Probs the best game I've ever seen!! Well done boys."
4. Phillip Hughes
Phil Hughes let slip some pivotal information before the third Test during the last Ashes series in England. The Australian opening batsmen posted on his twitter account that he would not be playing in the Test match, a seemingly innocuous statement except for the fact that the Australian selectors wanted to keep the details “in-house”.
"Disappointed not to be on the field with the lads today. Will be supporting the guys, it's a BIG test match 4 us. Thanks 4 all the support."
5. Kevin Piertersen
Kevin Pietersen wears his heart on his sleeve and that’s one of the reasons why the Englishmen is both loved and loathed. However, his willingness to let the world know how he is feeling landed the right hander in a little trouble when he announced via Twitter, that he had been dumped from the one-day international squad for the tour of India. It seems Pietersen is as humble on Twitter as he is out in the middle.
"Done for rest of summer!! Man of the World Cup T20 and dropped from the T20 side too.. Its [sic] a f*** up!! Surrey have signed me.”
6. Shane Warne
Shane Warne would be right up at the top of the list for title of Twitter King when it comes to Australian sports personalities. Warne was never one to bite his tongue during his playing days and it seems this trait has followed him into retirement. During Australia’s tour of India earlier this year Warne criticised Ricky Ponting’s field placements for spinner Nathan Hauritz via his Twitter account.
''How the hell can hauritz bowl to this field?? Feeling for hauritz, terrible!! What are these tactics? Sorry Ricky but what are you doing.''
More recently Warne was caught romancing Liz Hurley via the social network sight which lead to some rather humerous headlines in the Brittish tabloids including; ‘Just get horny Warnie’ and ‘Liz takes Warne’s bails.’ Clearly this is not the first time Warne has had his pants pulled down and it promises not to be the last.
7. Chad Ochocinco
Chad Ochocinco loves his twitter account and uses it quite regularly as these comments would attest: "I tweet when the sun rises and sets because everything in between is interesting." Naturally the Cincinnati Bengals’ wide receiver would then tweet during games. This last action however cost him $25,000, roughly $500 for each word.
"Just talk with Kelly Washington, Desean Jackson, Geoff Pope, Hank Baskett and I caught a ball from Mike Vick, I love prw-game warm up."
"Man I’m sick of getting hit like that, it’s the damn preseason shit! 1day I'm gone jump up and start throwing hay makers."
It seems Ochocinco learnt his lesson.
"I've been fined by the league a substantial amount of money for tweeting, 1st time twitter hasn't made me money but cost me money."
8. Floyd Mayweather
Floyd ‘Pretty Boy’ Mayweather is in the business of shooting off his mouth and has made quite a successful career out of verbally abusing his opponents. It was a racial rant via Twitter however, that had the fighter out of his depth. Mayweather launched this disgraceful tirade at Manny Pacquiao before attempting to stuff the words back in as fast as they came out, obviously an impossible feat.
"Once I stomp the midget, I'll make that motherfucker make me a sushi roll and cook me some rice."
"We gonna cook that motherfucker with some cats and dogs. And rice with a little bit of cat, rice with a little bit of barbecued dog."
9. Dimitri Mascarenhas
The Hampshire captain Dimitri Mascarenhas was fined £1,000 by his county after he let rip at England selector Geoff Miller on Twitter. After reading the comments one wonders why Mascarenhas doesn’t go into greeting cards.
"Chairman of selectors came and didn't even come say hi.. What a prick ... Doesn't take much to say hello does it??"
"Geoff miller is a complete knob. He had no clue what he is doing. F***ing prick."
Like all good sportsman Mascarenhas blamed the booze for his tirade, obviously not subscribing to the theory that a drunk man’s actions are a sobre man’s thoghts.
"Unfortunately these are the things that happen when you have too much to drink.. I was out with a few mates, it got to the early hours and as you do you think you're invincible and I did something very stupid.
10. Jonathan Thomas
The Wales lock was forced to apologise after making a homophobic outburst via Twitter. Unfortunately for Thomas the timing could not have been worse considering that Wales team-mate Gareth Thomas recently became the first professional rugby player in Britain to reveal he was gay.
Ian Evans (Team-mate of Thomas): "Legs and ass are in bits, can't move."
Thomas posted in reply: "U gotta stop hanging round with Nigel Owens!" (A Welsh referee who came out in 2007).
11. Nathan Barker
Never heard of Nathan Baker? That’s all right check your Facebook inbox as there is a fair chance that the Aston Villa youth tried to sell you some tickets for the Carling Cup final between his side and Manchester United.
The England under 19 international was hawking the tickets for £200 apiece, an outrageous price considering Baker wasn’t even playing.
12. Mark Cuban
Cuban was a little frustrated after the officiating referees failed to call a technical foul on Denver Nuggets player J. R. Smith. The Dallas Mavericks owner then proceeded to comment via Twitter and vent his anger. The NBA responded by calling a tech on Cuban and in the process fined him $25,000. This ruling was history making as it is believed to be the first instance of a person being fined by a sports league for a tweet.
"How do they not call a tech on JR Smith for coming off the bench to taunt our player on the ground?"
"Scary part of that play: Same crew chief from game in Denver where they missed call - last play of the game & 1st JRSmith/Wright issue."
"Just found out got fined 25k by NBA. Nice"

event_or_fact.property: via Twitter, that he had been dumped from the one-day international squad for the tour of India

description.hltext_display: River Arts Invites Artists To Submit Works On Paper
description.content:
River Arts in Damariscotta is putting out a call to artists to submit Works on Paper for its show opening Fri., Jan. 14. The show's juror is Suzette McAvoy, the former chief curator at the Farnsworth Art Museum, in Rockland with more than 20 years of experience in the art field.
McAvoy has lectured and written extensively on the art and artists of Maine, and has organized national traveling exhibitions of the work of Louise Nevelson, Alex Katz, Kenneth Noland, Lois Dodd, Karl Schrag, and Alan Magee.
Formerly McAvoy wrote, "The Canvas," a monthly column on contemporary Maine art for Maine Home+Design magazine, and she served as an independent art consultant to artists, organizations, and collectors.
McAvoy also served as associate professor in museum studies for the University of Maine at Orono, and, prior to moving to Maine in 1988, she was the director of the University of Rhode Island Art Galleries.
She has also worked at the Herbert F. Johnson Museum of Art, Cornell University, and the Museum of American History, Smithsonian Institution.
McAvoy received a B.A. in art history from William Smith College and an M.A. in museum studies from the Cooperstown Graduate Program. She lives in Belfast with her husband and daughter.
This juried exhibition is open to all artists; artists may submit up to three works. The entrance fee is $15 for members, and $20 non-members.
Work should dropped off at River Arts, 170 Main St., Damariscotta, Fri.-Sat., Jan. 7 and 8 from 10 a.m. - 4 p.m. Only recent works (created in the last three years) may be submitted.
The mission of River Arts is to nurture appreciation, encourage participation and provide opportunity in the arts.
For more specs on submissions, and more information about this and other River Arts events, visit www.riverartsme.org or call 563-1507.
Related Links:
• River Arts

description.hltext_display: What More in New Zealand deal
description.content:
Padiham-based manufacturer What More has secured an export deal in New Zealand. The plastic houseware manufacturer has also won an award from the East Lancashire Chamber of Commerce.
What More, which also produces gardening and storage products under the WHAM brand name, says it has also recently invested 1m in new machinery.
Tony Grimshaw, director at What More UK, said: "In the last three years we have rapidly grown our international presence and we now export to 33 countries, virtually becoming a household name abroad.
"With help from our trade association, our local chamber of commerce and UKTI, we will continue our expansion year on year.
"Our new customer is one of the biggest retailers in New Zealand and has placed an order in excess of 40,000, which will be shipped out at the end of December. The company recently won a Outstanding Exporter Achievement commendation from the East Lancashire Chamber of Commerce.

event_or_fact.property: In the last three years we have rapidly grown our international presence and we now export to 33 countries, virtually becoming a household name abroad.

description.hltext_display: Our views: Crying for justice (Dec. 22)
description.content:
Dear Gov.-elect Rick Scott and Attorney General-elect Pam Bondi: You may have heard of Wilton Dedge, William Dillon and Juan Ramos.
But allow us to fully introduce to you the men and the grave injustice done them by Florida.
Dedge, Dillon and Ramos, all Brevard County residents in the 1980s, were victims of prosecutorial misconduct by the Brevard-Seminole State Attorneys Office during that decade. All three were convicted of criminal charges on trumped-up evidence and wrongfully incarcerated for years.
Wilton Dedge of Port St. John was convicted of rape in 1981 but exonerated and freed in 2004 after idence proved his innocence.
Juan Ramos was tried and sentenced to death for rape and murder in 1983 in Brevard, although no physical evidence linked him to the crime. Ramos was acquitted in 1987.
William Dillon, formerly of Satellite Beach, was convicted in 1981 of the murder of James Dvorak. He served 27 years before new DNA testing showed he was not linked to a bloody T-shirt, a key piece of evidence prosecutors said the killer wore. Rather than go to retrial, the state dropped its case against Dillon in 2008.
Evidence of crimes
In all three cases, there is overwhelming evidence of wrongdoing on the part of state prosecutors and possibly law enforcement agents.
That includes:
Use of fraudulent expert witness and dog handler John Preston, who testified against all three.
Former prosecutor and Titusville resident Sam Bardwell and retired Brevard Circuit Judge Gilbert Goshorn say the dog handler was used to trump up evidence to pin an unknown number of convictions on innocent men during the 1980s.
Possibly criminal reliance on untrustworthy jailhouse snitches.
Prosecutors used murderer and recently convicted child-
rapist Clarence Zacke to help keep Dedge behind bars.
Questions raised by Dedge attorney Sandy DAlemberte former dean of Florida State Universitys law school and past president of the American Bar Association and the Innocence Project are many.(2 of 2)They include whether someone in the state attorneys office withheld critical information about Zacke, such as allegations he had raped his adopted daughter, from the defense before Dedges 1984 retrial.
If prosecutors knew of the allegations, but allowed him to inform on Dedge, their actions are a possible breach of law.
Prosecutors in Dillons case relied on jailhouse snitch Roger Chapman, who said Dillon confessed to him in prison. Last year, Chapman testified before the Legislature he was coerced into making false statements.
Use of badly tainted wit||ýPage=098 Column=001 OK,0026.00þ||
nesses, such as Donna Parris, Dillons ex-girlfriend, who slept with an investigator on the case and later recanted her testimony saying shed been threatened with jail time if she didnt lie.
More innocents jailed?
More innocent men may still be wrongfully imprisoned because of the dishonest practices.
One is inmate Gary Bennett, convicted of the murder of Palm Bay resident Helen Nardi in 1984 and now fighting for a retrial.
With scant evidence tying Bennett to the crime, prosecutors fell back on Preston, who claimed that his dog linked Bennetts scent to the murder weapons. The items were preserved in strong-smelling chemicals, however, and the dog urinated on other blood-
stained crime-scene evidence, ruining it for court purposes.
Bennett deserves a new day in court.
But just as important, the miscarriages of justice that led to Dedges, Ramos and Dillons convictions require a full investigation, with anyone found guilty of criminal actions held fully accountable under the law.
Weve been calling for that from state leaders since 2005, but to no avail, raising suspicions the good-old boys in the justice system are circling the wagons.
Righting cruel wrongs
Many current and former state officials pledged while on the campaign trail to order a probe of the wrongful convictions but failed to act.
Among them are former Gov. Jeb Bush, Gov. Charlie Crist and Attorney General Bill McCollum.
Attorney General-elect Bondi, you also said before the elections youd look into the matter. You should act upon your promise as soon as you take office.
Gov.-elect Scott, you have a unique opportunity to act.
As a political outsider, you can and should start building a legacy as a crusader for justice in the Sunshine State by calling for a thorough probe of Preston-era abuses in the Brevard-Seminole State Attorneys Office.

description.hltext_display: San Jose Sharks hold off Edmonton
description.author: David Pollakdpollak@mercurynews.com
description.content:
The game that mattered? The Sharks won that 2-1 over the Edmonton Oilers at HP Pavilion on Tuesday night to string together a third consecutive victory for only the second time this season.
The game within that game? That would be the "Battle of the Prized Rookies," and the Sharks won it, too, as a four-minute stretch in the second period alone gave Logan Couture the edge over Oiler forwards Taylor Hall and Jordan Eberle.
Couture got his team-high 18th goal of the season in that span to break a scoreless tie at 13:15. A little more than three minutes later with the Sharks on a power play, Dan Boyle beat Oilers goalie Nikolai Khabibulin, and the sellout crowd of 17,562 could breathe a little easier.
Goalie Antero Niittymaki made 26 saves in improving to 12-3-3, but Dustin Penner's goal at 18:01 of the third period ruined Niittymaki's bid for his first shutout as a Shark.
The contest featured three of the NHL's top-scoring rookies, and it wasn't as if Hall and Eberle didn't have their moments. But Couture -- less noticed than the two Oilers in the preseason buzz over Calder Trophy candidates -- made the greater impact.
First, the Sharks had just finished killing a five-on-three but were still a man short when Couture stole the puck from Hall at the San Jose blue line. Couture raced ahead of Hall, drawing a holding penalty at 9:25 against the No. 1 pick of the 2010 NHL entry draft.
The Sharks didn't score on the power play that followed, but on his next shift, Couture again stole the puck, this time from rookie Linus Ormak, and headed down the ice with Ryane Clowe on an odd-man rush.
After defenseman Kurtis Foster dropped to the ice while trying to break up the play, Clowe feathered the pass to Couture, who was driving the slot and chipped the puck over Khabibulin for a 1-0 lead at 13:15.
"He went down pretty quick," Clowe said of Foster in a TV interview from the bench. "I had a pretty long stick and could get it around him."
A holding-the-stick penalty on Oilers defenseman Ryan Whitney less than two minutes later put the Sharks on the power play, and Boyle showed patience, skating laterally after taking a pass from Patrick Marleau, finding a lane and firing the puck past Khabibulin, who had Dany Heatley parked in front of his face.
Neither team generated many scoring chances in the first period as each was limited to five shots on net, two by Eberle.
Niittymaki was tested early in the second period, however, as the Sharks had difficulty clearing the puck out of their own zone and Edmonton got off four shots in a 55-second sequence capped by pinching defenseman Tom Gilbert's quick wrist shot from the slot.
The game came with built-in excuses if San Jose lost to the Oilers, who were on a 6-3-1 run but remained at the bottom of the Western Conference.
"It's all there for us if we want to use it -- coming home from a long road trip, Christmas around the corner, families in town," coach Todd McLellan said after his team's morning skate. "Any type of distraction you want to come up with, and they're all there if we want to use them."
McLellan, of course, also made it clear he wouldn't be buying any of it.
"We can pull them out of a hat and use them as much as we want," the coach said. "But that's not what the plan is, and I'd be very disappointed if I hear anybody talk like that at the end of the night."
Nobody in his locker room, of course, needed to talk like that this time.
For more on the Sharks, see David Pollak's Working the Corners blog at blogs.mercurynews.com/sharks. Contact him at 408-920-5940.

description.hltext_display: Intrum Justitia: SEB sänker rekommendationen
description.content:
SEB Enskilda sänker rekommendationen för till sälj från tidigare behåll. Riktkursen höjs till 101 kronor från tidigare 95 kronor.
Det framgår av en analys daterad den 21 december. stängde på 103:25 kronor under föregående handelsdag.

Rendez-vous dans la salle polyvalente de l'hôpital à 20 heures 30.

description.hltext_display: El sorteo de Navidad reparte más de 2.320 millones de euros
description.author: gentedigital.es
description.content:
El Sorteo de Navidad llega como cada año cargado de premios y repartirá más de 2.320 millones de euros. Además, este año el tradicional sorteo trae importantes novedades como una nueva sede de ceremonias en el Palacio de Congresos de Madrid o la posibilidad de cobrar los 'premios mayores' al día siguiente.
Tu nombre Email destino
Enviado
gentedigital.es
A las ocho de la mañana, se ha formado la primera mesa que supervisará el llenado de los bombos con las bolas ya colgadas de las liras y el protocolo durante el que el público en general ha podido, desde ese momento y antes de que comience el sorteo, comprobar que la bolita del número que juega está entre las 85.000 que entrarán en el bombo de los números.
El total de la emisión asciende a 3.315 millones de euros --siendo Madrid la que cuenta con una cifra superior de consignación, 527 millones-- y un 70 por ciento de esta cantidad irá destinada a premios (2.320 millones de euros, en total). Cada serie distribuirá 11,9 millones en premios, hasta alcanzar una cifra total de 26 millones de euros.
Los premios se mantendrán igual que en anteriores ediciones, con el 'Gordo' de tres millones a la serie y un segundo y tercer premio de un millón y 500.000 euros a la serie respectivamente. Además, habrá dos cuartos premios de 200.000 euros a la serie y ocho quintos premios de 50.000 euros a la serie.
El sorteo de este año mantendrá el sistema tradicional de un bombo para el número y otro para premios. Asimismo, habrá 195 series, cada una de ellas de 85.000 billetes y a un precio del número completo de 39.000 euros (200 euros por cada billete, 20 el décimo).
NOVEDADES DEL SORTEO
La gran novedad de este año en el sorteo está relacionado no con los premios, sino con la manera de cobrarlos. Los participantes del sorteo del próximo miércoles con números premiados con más de 3.000 euros (conocidos como los 'premios grandes') podrán cobrarlos al día siguiente por primera vez desde la celebración de este evento. Hasta ahora, estos 'premios grandes' únicamente podían cobrarse nueves días después de la celebración del sorteo.
Otra novedad es el cambio de sede al Palacio de Congresos de Madrid tras 50 años de sorteos en el edificio de Guzmán el Bueno. El nuevo edificio tiene capacidad para 2.000 personas, mientras que el anterior sólo podía albergar a 500.
Asimismo, LAE estrena este año una web específica que incluirá noticias sobre el sorteo, además de una opción que permitirá a los usuarios consultar los números premiados. Asimismo, habrá una comercialización del décimo a través de terminales distribuidos en distintos puntos de venta.
COMIENZA EL SORTEO
Esta operación se efectúa tanto con las bolas de números como con las de premios. Por último, los bombos son cerrados y a una señal del presidente se voltean simultáneamente. Un niño o niña del colegio de San Ildefonso extrae una bola del bombo de números y otro niño, a la vez, otra del de premios, con lo que comienza el sorteo, en torno a las nueve de la mañana.
Al finalizar el sorteo de Navidad, cuando en el bombo de premios no queda ninguna bola, un equipo de más de cuarenta personas se encarga de realizar la lista de premios del sorteo y de las poblaciones agraciadas con los premios mediante un proceso informático controlado en todos sus extremos.
De esta forma, aproximadamente a los 45 minutos de terminado el sorteo, y después de haber pasado por varias comprobaciones y punteos, está preparada la cinta y lista de premios para su entrega a la Fábrica Nacional de Moneda y Timbre, encargada de imprimir la lista oficial de premios. Dicha lista se edita y distribuye la misma tarde del día del sorteo a las Administraciones de Loterías y a los medios de comunicación.
Las tablas de los números premiados, quedan expuestas siete días al público. Transcurrido este tiempo son abiertas y las bolas contadas y examinadas nuevamente, para cualquier otro sorteo posterior a celebrar por este sistema.
