description.hltext_display: El Congreso tumba la 'ley Sinde'
description.author: gentedigital.es
description.content:
La Comisión de Economía y Hacienda del Congreso rechazó la disposición final segunda de la Ley de Economía Sostenible, que permitiría cerrar páginas web por vulnerar derechos de propiedad intelectual.
Tu nombre Email destino
Enviado
gentedigital.es
El PSOE se ha quedado solo defendiendo esta regulación y no ha encontrado apoyos entre los distintos grupos parlamentarios para aprobarla. Toda la oposición, incluyendo a los nacionalistas catalanes, vascos y canarios, han votado en contra y la controvertida disposición ha desaparecido del proyecto.
El siguiente paso para la Ley de Economía Sostenible (LES) será su debate en el Senado a partir del 18 de enero y allí el PSOE, si quiere insistir en la comisión de propiedad intelectual que creaba la 'ley Sinde' con competencias para solicitar el cierre de páginas web, tendrá que presentarlo de nuevo como enmienda y buscar aliados, con la diferencia de que en la Cámara Alta no es el partido mayoritario.
Tras horas de espera al ser aplazada la votación hasta que terminara el Pleno, el Congreso ha rechazado finalmente el texto de esta disposición que regulaba el cierre de webs que favorezcan las descargas de archivos protegidos por los derechos de autor.
LOS NACIONALISTAS SE DESENTIENDEN
Los nacionalistas eran la pieza clave en este debate y votación, ya que su apoyo al Gobierno podía haber dado el triunfo a los socialistas a la hora votar a favor de la LES.
No obstante, el PNV ya comunicó el martes por la mañana que no aceptaba nada que no fuera sacar de la Ley de Economía Sostenible todo lo relativo a la propiedad intelectual para hacer una nueva ley específica en condiciones que aborde cuestiones como las conexiones, el precio del ADSL o la creación de nuevos modelos de negocio. Para el nacionalista Pedro Azpiazu, la mejor manera de que desaparezcan las descargas ilegales es que al usuario no le compense realizar las descargas.
Al mediodía se descolgó también CiU al no obtener apoyo a sus propuestas en aspectos fiscales, financieros y económicos que también regula la Ley de Economía Sostenible. Según su portavoz, Josep Sánchez Llibre, no había sido posible "configurar un pacto global" y, en su defecto, CiU ha decidido votar en contra de toda la ley por ser "confusa" y "dispersa".
Durante el debate celebrado en la Comisión de Economía del Congreso, el portavoz de Cultura del Partido Popular, José María Lassalle, reiteró su oposición a la 'ley Sinde' y pidió una opción "garantista" donde se "salvaguarde" la intervención del juez en el caso de que se vulnere la propiedad intelectual.
Para los populares, esa disposición final segunda intentaba "maquillar" con un procedimiento judicial rápido la actuación de un órgano administrativo como el de la Comisión de Propiedad Intelectual.
"CAJÓN DE SASTRE"
Según la portavoz de ICV, Nuria Buenaventura, esta Ley de Economía Sostenible se ha convertido en un "cajón de sastre" y acusó al Gobierno de actuar con "urgencia" e intentar aglutinar en "un par de horas" todas las cuestiones que no ha podido debatir. "El derecho de autor es necesario pero sin entrar en contraposición con el derecho de usuario", ha alegado.
También para el portavoz de ERC, Joan Ridao, la LES es un "cajón de sastre" con un "conjunto de medidas más o menos hilvanadas" y denunció la manía del Gobierno "de ir detrás de los acontecimientos".
Y la 'ley Sinde', agregó, es "una chapuza" y un "auténtico despropósito" porque "no se pueden poner puertas al campo".
Coalición Canaria, que ostenta la Portavocía del Grupo Mixto en la Comisión de Economía, también ha tachado de "lamentable" la 'ley Sinde' porque "vulnera" los derechos fundamentales del individuo.
Al final, los socialistas lograron derrotar todas las enmiendas relativas a esa disposición final segunda, incluso las que pedían su supresión, pero cuando hubo que decidir si se mantenía o no en el proyecto, se quedó solo y la llamada 'ley Sinde' cayó desplomada.
DERROTA SIN ALTERNATIVA
Desde el PSOE, la diputada Marta Gastón lamentó la "derrota" al terminar las votaciones. "No voy a decir que nos guste perder una parte de la ley defendida por el Gobierno, pero más que derrota, que lo es, porque no hay grupo que la haya apoyado, lo que sí nos duele es que no hemos encontrado propuesta alternativa", ha reconocido a los medios de comunicación.
Por su parte, durante el debate, Gastón hizo hincapié en que la "tutela" era "efectiva" porque protege el derecho de los creadores y "ayuda al desarrollo de la industria cultural". "El Gobierno modificó su posición inicial para que no se pudiera cerrar ni una sola página web sin autorización", ha argumentado Gastón.

description.hltext_display: Christmas Light Installation Business,cashing in on christmas
description.content:
Cashing In On Christmas Review
We don't often review money making products but Cashing in on Christmas is the exception to the rule. You see, most books on making money fall short in one way or another and often lack any sort of a general business plan. This is where Cashing in on Christmas is different and the reason why it is recommended if you are looking for an honest to goodness plan for starting your own business and potentially making some good money is a short period of time.
What Cashing in on Christmas will give you is a thorough plan to start your own business taking care of the often frustrating job of hanging Christmas lights for people. Most homeowners dread having to take care of this themselves and business owners also usually lack the necessary time during the busy holiday season. If you let you mind think about this for a few minutes you can see how this could turn out to be not only a very welcome service that you can provide but also a very profitable one at that.
Included in the Cashing in on Christmas program is a thoroughly thought out and documented package that will help you to be successful in your Holiday Lighting Business very quickly. All the necessary forms that you might need for your business are included; payroll, quotes and even advertising templates are given to you with Cashing in on Christmas. Information on how to attract clients and prepare quotes as well as all the technical know-how that you are going to need to create breathtaking holiday lighting displays for both businesses and residential installations are included in this package. Cashing in on Christmas is a start to finish business in a box that has helped many people just like you to start their own profitable holiday lighting businesses. The plan in Cashing in on Christmas is perfect for those that already have a landscaping or other service businesses, such as housecleaning or car detailing and the like. Although it does help to have a customer base it is by no means absolutely necessary. In every town and city all over the world there are homeowners and businesses that want and need this service.
The best thing about Cashing in on Christmas is the amount of money that it is possible to generate over the holiday season. The potential is there to make more money over the holiday season than you might currently make the entire year. So what does this mean? Think about it… it is absolutely possible to make enough money in two months to take the rest of the year off and actually enjoy life… or work on other projects… or travel… or you can use your Cashing in on Christmas business as just a small hobby to help make ends meet. Although if you see the potential in this business you will probably wish to exploit Cashing in on Christmas to its fullest potential and take the rest of the year off.
So if you're looking for a unique and rewarding home based business that you can start and grow at your own pace… and that has been proven to be very profitable then why not check out Cashing in on Christmas? Why not work smart for a couple of months out of the year and potentially make more money than most people make in a year?
Go to the Cashing in on Christmas Homepage and find out all the details on starting your own holiday lighting business. Find out how you can potentially make more money in a few months than most people make all year.
Good Luck!

description.hltext_display: Remembering A Christmas Blessing
description.content:
I think it was 2002. That was a tough year for the Johnson family. I was between flying jobs and money was tight. Real tight. Christmas was coming and I couldn't get presents for anyone on my list. Without a job, I got to stay at home with my wife instead of being on the road all the time. But I couldn't get any sleep at night from all the pecans raining down on our tin roof! I was living in Smithville, Texas in a little rent house built in 1898. The house was surrounded with huge pecan trees that blotted out the sun, shading our house from the Texas sun. But in the fall, the leaves and pecans were a nuisance. I raked leaves daily and picked up several grocery bags full of pecans every week. Six days before Christmas, I sat on the front porch complaining to my wife of our shortage of cash. Especially heavy was my embarrassment about being unable to send out any presents. My daughter Carole bounded up the stairs and happily proclaimed that she was going to give pecans to her friends. She planned to crack the pecans, dip them in butter and sugar, roast them and then deliver them in decorative jars. Like a virus, the idea spread to my wife and me. We cracked pecans day and night, and my wife and Carole would roast them while I continued cracking. We found quart mason jars stored in our old garage. (I have no idea how old those jars were.) Soon we had a couple of dozen jars of roasted pecan halves sealed in jars with red and green ribbons tied around them. On Christmas Eve we made the rounds of Smithville, giving away all our jars. We went home and celebrated Christmas. My wife, the magician, had presents for everyone, bought with the money she'd saved over the year. I remember it as one of our best because we worked to give out the pecans. You would never believe the thank you notes and calls we got from those jars. "Best Christmas present I received this year," one said. I never saw the hand of God while he was pushing us to deliver pecans to widows and preachers, to friends and teachers. But afterward we were thankful. Our lack of cash pulled us together as a family, and God's bounty of pecans spread His love around Smithville.
D. Alan Johnson
Author of Asgaard, A Novel of Africa

description.hltext_display: Plusieurs mois de travaux pour un axe essentiel, la rue Jean-Jaurès
description.content:
lu 81 fois
Tout a commencé il y a quelques jours par l'élagage des tilleuls. Ils seront bientôt arrachés pour permettre de réhabiliter la rue.
Le réaménagement de l'avenue Jean-Jaurès a débuté le lundi 13 décembre dernier par une étape qui ne séduit certainement pas les riverains ou les amoureux de la nature. Mais nécessité fait loi, et l'abattage des arbres était indispensable.
Ce chantier exécuté par tronçon de 20 mètres pour une durée de 2 semaines annonce de nouvelles périodes de travaux.
Au droit du chantier, la circulation se fera de manière alternée et le stationnement sera également interdit.
Dans un premier temps, les arbres ont été ébranchés, et les branches stockées sur le trottoir en attendant d'être broyées Puis les troncs seront coupés.
Les services techniques tiennent à la préciser, « un diagnostic a été établi sur les arbres et sur les 77 tilleuls à couper. Il y avait 1\3 en mauvais état phytosanitaire, 1\3 en état moyen, et seulement 1\3 dans un état correct.
« Il était donc nécessaire de les couper dans la mesure où ils auraient pu gêner le nouvel aménagement. Mais que les amoureux de la nature se rassurent, ils seront remplacés par de nouvelles essences, en plus grand nombre, sur la totalité de l'avenue ».
La chaussée réduite à 5,5 mètres
Les aménagements se poursuivront par la réfection des réseaux d'eau et d'assainissement en début 2011.
Claude Brandy, adjoint chargé des travaux tient à la préciser : « Nous n'allons pas créer une révolution dans la rue, mais nous allons faire évoluer cette artère.
Outre la réfection des réseaux, nous allons créer des places de parking sur les deux côtés de la rue et conserver les trottoirs dans leurs dimensions. Ces derniers seront entièrement refaits, c'était indispensable.
50 places de stationnement seront ainsi créées et la voie sera réduite à 5,5 mètres.
Une piste cyclable sera aussi réalisée en zone propre, ce qui signifie qu'elle n'empiétera pas sur la voie. Cette piste cyclable sera poursuivie et rejoindra à terme la zone commerciale des Martines ».
Les élus ne souhaitent pas que soit renouvelée l'opération réalisée avenue Rosa Luxembourg et qui n'a pas séduit les usagers.
Cependant, pour forcer les véhicules à rouler moins vite, des plateaux surélevés seront installés à chaque carrefour.
La durée des travaux sera d'environ 10 mois et coûtera entre 800.000 et un million d'euros.
Concernant la coupe des arbres, Claude Brandy l'assure, « nous en replanterons au total 84 et nous irons jusqu'au bas de la rue. Nous ne choisirons pas des tilleuls, nous fixerons notre choix dès le début de l'année ».
Laurent Borderie
laurent.borderie@centrefrance.com

description.hltext_display: Ivory Coast crisis could spark civil war
description.content:
UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has warned that Ivory Coast could slide back into a civil war. Addressing the UN Security Council Ban accused incumbent Ivory Coast leader Laurent Gbagbo of trying to force UN peacekeepers out of the country and of blocking supplies to the troops. Gbagbo, who is continuing to claim that he won the disputed presidential election, had earlier ordered the 10,000-strong UNOCI peacekeeping force out of the country, accusing it of arming former rebel fighters now loyal to his opponent, Alassane Ouattara.
In turn, Ouattara has called for widespread public uprisings and civil disobedience from his supporters. And the UN Refugees Agency reports that thousands of women and children have begun fleeing the country's post-election violence, heading for camps in Liberia and Guinea.
Speaking on state television, Gbagbo said he would allow an international panel to review the election results. That panel would be led by an African Union envoy and include representatives from the West African bloc ECOWAS, the UN, the US, the EU, Russia and China.
Ouattara claims he won a runoff election against Gbagbo that was held on on Nov. 28; the US, the UN, the African Union and the European Union all support his claim. The incumbent, Gbagbo, has refused to step down, causing an escalating political conflagration between supporters of the two camps.
Cocoa wealth brings ease - and trouble
Observers say the election and its disputed results reflect ethnic and religious differences that have long been brewing under the surface of the relatively peaceful and prosperous Ivory Coast society.
Ivory Coast is the world's largest cocoa producer. Its thriving industry boosted the living standards there so much that it has become an immigration hub for people from other, poorer African countries, such as Mali and Burkina Faso. Some of these people shared ethnic and religious ties to those living in the largely Muslim northern part of the country. Bildunterschrift: In turn, many people in the south of the Ivory Coast have started to demand protection for their national heritage - their "Ivorian-ness." That clumsy phrase - and the racial, economic and religious questions attached to determining who can be considered to be truly from the Ivory Coast or not - has been at the center of the Ivorian political struggle since the end of the 1990s.
Ouattara's broad international support reaches back to his time as the vice director of the International Monetary Fund, from 1994 to 1999, and as a leader of the Ivory Coast government in the 1990s. International observers consider him to be an experienced diplomat and politician, who can handle himself well on the world political stage.
Candidate from the north
His family is from the north of the country, and "Ado," as the Ivorians call him, gets most of his support from the northern and central part of the country.
Ouattara wasn't allowed to run for office in the 2000 election; the country's highest court blocked his bid saying he isn't really of Ivorian heritage. Since then, the notion of "Ivorian-ness" has been an argument used to keep undesirable candidates from running for office. Bildunterschrift: That ideology holds not only for politics, but also for the armed forces. In the multicultural Ivorian society, this means about a quarter of the population does not have some of the privileges afforded to others, and is systematically discriminated against.
That discrimination also gained Ouattara support from second-generation immigrants, who are fighting for their rights to full citizenship.
Fighting over nationality questions
This ethno-political conflict is what underlies the current crisis, says political expert Gilles Yabi of the International Crisis Group. It is also the main reason for the creation of the rainbow-rebellion movement "Forces Nouvelles," says Yabi.
In 2002, the Gbagbo government attacked them, and fought from the north toward Abidjan. Yabi says the connection is significant for anyone who wants to understand the current confrontation.
"One of the most important political demands of the Forces Nouvelles during the armed conflict was the question of nationality. The question was which candidate was allowed to run at all, and whether Alassane Ouattara should be one of them. That means, from the very beginning, the armed struggle of the Forces Nouvelles was tied to Ouattara's political struggle to have his nationality recognized," Yabi said.
Candidate from the south
Laurent Gbagbo's stronghold is in the southern part of the country. He has been in power since he wrested it from then-military leader General Guei in 2000. At the time, Gbagbo was considered the great hope of the resistance movement against the one-party system.
Jeremy Soukrou is a Gbagbo adherent; he organized open debates prior to the election in order to promote Gbagbo's cause.
"We agree with and support the program of President Gbagbo. And we are ready to support him, to protect the institutions of our country, and defend his life - in a certain way, to defend the civil society in our country." Soukrou said. Bildunterschrift: Both camps are clearly ready to use violence to support their views. A militia of young men who call themselves "Young Patriots" has joined forces behind Gbagbo, under the command of the charismatic Charles Ble Goude, whom Gbagbo has named youth minister. When Goude now goes through the neighborhoods of Abidjan calling for "total freedom" for the Ivory Coast, the violence can be turned against political opponents - but it can also turn against foreigners or UN soldiers.
Benefits of joining Gbagbo
Many of these youths get involved in the hope that their support will bring them more opportunities in the future, perhaps even one of the few jobs available in the country.
"The supporters of Gbagbo get a whole array of privileges for their help," Yabi said, including money or a career push for a loyal soldier.
Gbagbo also has the Republican Guard on his side. The group is also part of the Ivorian army, and is meant to protect state institutions. Furthermore, a paramilitary elite troop called CeCOS, which operates against organized crime in Abidjan, is sometimes used by Gbagbo as a private militia.
Gbagbo, who has filled key public positions with friends and supporters, continues to find support in these ranks. But if the internatioal community isolates him and continues to pressure him, some say the base constituency could begin to fall apart.
Authors: Ute Schaefer, Sandrine Blanchard, Rob Mudge (AFP,AP) (jen)
Editor: Rob Mudge

description.hltext_display: Entrust in 'soft landing' property deal
description.content:
Irish business Entrust has signed up for space on the Daresbury Science and Innovation Campus. Entrust has taken advantage of the Hello Northwest 'soft landing' service offering free office space for new investors in the North West.
Entrust operates in the onshore and offshore wind energy sector, primarily providing planning consultancy and IT services to manufacturers and installers. Its new base means it has potential to provide for onshore planning, land acquisition, wayleaves and foreshore consents for the proposed Centrica wind energy project in the Irish Sea, off the coast of Liverpool.
Kieran Tarpey, managing director of Entrust, said: "My first impressions of the campus are extremely positive - I have already been introduced to a number of other companies, individuals and management support providers.
"The campus is clearly a world class collaboration of science, research and business and there is tremendous positive energy and 'can do' attitude throughout. Over the next year our priority is to build up a profitable planning service within the onshore wind energy sector and to get a foothold into the offshore wind sector."

description.hltext_display: Nikolaus überraschte Kinder in der Turnhalle
description.content:
Die jüngsten Sportler trauten sich mit Schnuller zum Nikolaus vor, der mit süßen Sachen überraschte.
(mm)
Münster-Mariendorf - Die SG DJK Dyckburg hat seine Mitglieder auch in diesem Jahr in der Vorweihnachtszeit zu verschiedenen Feiern eingeladen. So kamen die Aktiven ab 16 Jahre zu einer geselligen Weihnachtsfeier im Heidehof zusammen. In der letzten Woche besuchte der Nikolaus dann auch die „kleinen“ Sportler des Vereins. Rund 30 Kinder kamen mit ihren Eltern in die Turnhalle nach Mariendorf, um Geschenke vom Nikolaus entgegen zu nehmen. Als Dank wurden Übungen von den Juniorsportlern vorgeturnt.

description.hltext_display: Congress approves spending, but fight looms
description.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The Congress approved a compromise bill on Tuesday to fund the government for several months as lawmakers postponed a struggle over spending and the deficit until next year.
The bill to fund the government through March 4 gives Republicans the chance to try to push through dramatic budget cuts when they take control of the House of Representatives and have more members in the Senate early next year.
"Most of next year will simply be about demonstrating political leverage rather than working through honest, substantive differences," said Democratic Representative David Obey, who is retiring and giving up his top spot on the Appropriations Committee.
The measure now heads to President Barack Obama to sign into law.
The bill, which essentially keeps the government operating on automatic pilot, would deny Obama the budget increases he has sought to implement his signature reforms of healthcare and financial regulations.
It also would prevent pay raises for federal nonmilitary employees for two years, a measure Obama proposed to show that he is willing to take steps to pare spending after years of budget increases for everything from job creation to environmental protection.
The bill passed the House by a vote of 193 to 165 after clearing the Senate earlier in the day.
By the time the measure runs out on March 4, Republicans will have a greater ability to influence spending priorities for the remainder of the fiscal year, which ends September 30.
House Republicans have said they want to trim $100 billion in spending, but Obama and Democrats who will still control the Senate are not likely to go along, creating a recipe for confrontation and a risk of government shutdown.
"We've kicked the ball down the field a little bit, but on March the 4th the battle will be joined again," said Democratic Senator Tom Harkin.
Democrats had sought to lock in funding through the end of the fiscal year before the new crop of Republicans take office. But that approach died in the Senate last week.
Harkin warned that Republican cuts could devastate efforts to retrain unemployed workers and educate low-income children when the sluggish economy has made such programs needed more than ever.
Republican Tom Coburn, one of the Senate's foremost fiscal hawks, said lawmakers need to start making tough choices to reduce annual budget deficits that are at their highest level relative to the size of the economy since World War Two.
"Our nation has a very short time with which to reassess and reprioritize what is important in our fiscal matters," Coburn said. "The fact is, is everything's going to have to be looked at."
NO BOOST FOR FINANCIAL REGULATORS
The bill denies Obama the budget increases he had sought for the Commodity Futures Trading Commission and the Securities and Exchange Commission to ramp up regulation and oversight of Wall Street called for in the Dodd-Frank Act, which Congress passed in July.
The bill would give regulators only 30 days to review applications for offshore oil and gas drilling, rather than the 90 days sought by the administration in the wake of the massive BP oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.
It includes a minor victory for Obama, as a provision that would have prevented terrorism suspects from coming to the United States to face criminal trial has been dropped.
It would largely continue funding for other government programs at their current levels, with increases for some programs like veterans affairs.
Because Congress has failed to pass any of the 12 bills that fund government operations this year, lawmakers have resorted to repeated stopgap measures to keep federal workers on the job.
That approach has made it more difficult for the government to function on a nuts-and-bolts level, as agencies cannot hand out new contracts or move forward with other projects that would have been possible under a new budget.
For example, people applying for disability payments could face a longer wait as the Social Security Administration does not get the funding increase it had sought, some advocates worry.
(Reporting by Andy Sullivan; Editing by Vicki Allen and Philip Barbara)
(c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2010. Check for restrictions at: http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

description.hltext_display: Wachet auf, ruft uns die Stimme . . .
description.content:
Applaus gab es nach dem Konzert für die Chorleiter (v.l.): Franziska Schniprowsky, Thomas Wemhoff (Orgel). Susanne Schellong und Severin RotermundFoto:
(gbe)
Münster-handorf - „ “ Zu einem adventlichen Konzert als Benefizveranstaltung für das Hospiz Lebenshaus hatten Handorfer Chöre der katholischen und der evangelischen Gemeinde in die Pfarrkirche St. Petronilla eingeladen. Trotz der widrigen Verkehrsverhältnisse war die Kirche fast bis auf den letzten Platz besetzt und bot so den würdigen Rahmen für diesen Abend.
Neben dem Kirchenchor St. Petronilla und den „Singing Sisters“ unter der Leitung von Franziska Schniprowsky konnten sich die Besucher vor allem auch über die Darbietungen des „Impulse Chor“ aus Handorf und Gelmer unter der Leitung Susanne Schellongs und über die frischen Stimmen des Jungen Chores aus Handorf, der nun von Severin Rotermund erfolgreich geleitet wird, freuen.
Das Programm führte in einem großen Bogen von der Adventsmusik des Barock über Josef Haydns „Eja gentes“ zu Peter Janssens „Mit Maria preist den Herrn.“
Der Wechsel zwischen den Chorsätzen, Texten zur Meditation, die von Pfarrer Jürgen Streuer gesprochen wurden, dem Gemeindegesang und Orgelsoli, von Thomas Wemhoff einfühlsam interpretiert, machte den Abend zu einem vorweihnachtlichen Hörgenuss. Der lang anhaltende Applaus und das reiche Ergebnis der Türkollekte für das Lebenshaus zeigte, dass dieses Konzert bei den Besuchern noch lange Nachhall finden dürfte.

description.hltext_display: México/EEUU.- México y EEUU anuncian la creación del parque binacional más grande de la frontera
description.content:
MADRID, 22 Dic. (EUROPA PRESS) -
El presidente de México, Felipe Calderón, y el secretario del Interior de Estados Unidos, Kenneth Salazar, han anunciado este martes la creación del parque binacional más grande de su frontera común, que se asentará entre Texas --en el lado estadounidense--, Coahuila y Chihuahua.
El objetivo es fomentar el desarrollo sostenible y estimular el sector turístico de la zona, tal y como detallaron ambos dignatarios tras un encuentro en Los Pinos, la residencia oficial del presidente mexicano. El nuevo parque será atravesado por el río Grande, que a su vez sirve de frontera.
Calderón y Salazar aprovecharon para destacar la importancia de la cooperación fronteriza, informa el periódico mexicano 'El Universal'.
Según la versión oficial, comentaron los avances en la cooperación en materia de protección y mejor aprovechamiento de los recursos naturales en las dos naciones, en especial los ubicados en nuestra frontera común. Respecto a dicha cooperación, trataron el aprovechamiento eficaz de la cuenca del río Colorado, así como la vinculación entre parques nacionales y áreas protegidas de los dos países. En opinión de Calderón, este último apartado es un ejemplo de las buenas relaciones bilaterales.

description.hltext_display: Religiøse rampestreker
description.content: Modern_Love- rPålogget4251 innlegg14582 anbefalinger/* */profilMeny('usrmenu5150744',30931,'Modern_Lover');/* */Er det en trend i det nye Europa,og i det nye "vi" i Norge,at ungdoms rampestreker stadig bærer preg av å få et mere religiøst tilsnitt? Polariseringen i Norge og Europa går sin vante gang,med ekspressfart vil jeg si. "Den tradisjonsrike Bologna-avisen Il Resto del Carlino kunne den 17. desember fortelle at en 17 år gammel tyrkisk elev ved Galilei-gymnaset i den lille byen Mirandola i den nordlige Modena-provinsen ikke langt fra elven Po er blitt anmeldt til politiet fordi han bevæpnet med en syl i klasseværelset i storefri hadde truet en medelev til å gå ned på kne og be til Allah vendt mot Mekka." "Den tyrkiske 17-åringen hadde i likhet med enkelte andre elever av fremmedkulturelt opphav hatt for vane å terrorisere sine medelever, og offeret i denne saken ønsket selv ikke å forfølge den av frykt for represalier. Etter at et opptak av hendelsen var havnet på Youtube, bestemte imidlertid noen foreldre av andre tidligere plagede elever seg for å anmelde forholdet. Bologna-avisens reportasje oppgir ikke om ofrene er italienere eller andre utlendinger." "Dette området av Italia har en av landets høyeste konsentrasjoner av nordafrikanere, og voldsepisodene ved Galilei-gymnaset har vært ganske hyppige den siste tiden, noe som også har gått ut over lærere. Fenomener som tidligere er blitt observert i såvel tyske som svenske skoler, ser altså ut til å ha blitt en trend også i de mest ghettoiserte områdene i Italia." http://www.document.n...

description.hltext_display: På kornet om det nordiske selvhatet
description.content: Modern_Love- rPålogget4251 innlegg14582 anbefalinger/* */profilMeny('usrmenu5150766',30931,'Modern_Lover');/* */Usedvanlig godt innspill her om hva som har gått galt med fantasien om multikulturen,og om hvordan dette ikke kan fungere. Den nordiske selvforaktens møte med islam kan aldri gå bra,den kollektive skyldfølelsen sørger for dette. Skyldfølelsen du kan få rasiststempel av å ikke inneha. Svært nyttig lesning for forumets etnsik norske innvandrings og islamforkjempere dette,og de vil gjennom artikkelen møte sin egen "jeg" person flere ganger. "Svenska folket och dess självutnämnda företrädare i media vältrar sig i kollektiv skuld men för vad? För att vi i vårt land har tagit emot omkring en halv miljon muslimer som säger sig ha flytt från krig och förföljelse och gett dem bostäder, social välfärd, försörjning, yttrandefrihet, religionsfrihet och demokrati men just inte ställt några krav? För att vi inte är roade av islamisters politisk-religiösa extremism och ogillar tanken på att bli sprängda i luften som tack för kaffet? För att många muslimer energiskt och i enlighet med koranen segregerar sig själva från det svenska samhället och vägrar beblanda sig med otrogna? (Att ta emot våra pengar i försörjningsstöd och andra bidrag verkar däremot gå alldeles utmärkt.)" "Med dold mikrofon spelade Ekots journalister in böner och samtal med imamer i 15 olika muslimska församlingar. Flertalet imamer tog avstånd från terrorism och att döda civila människor. Men reportrarna frågade givetvis inte om detta gäller även för otrogna. En imam uttalar följande under en inspelad fredagsbön i november 2005: Gud, håll islam och muslimer högt och skydda islam Gud, förödmjuka de otrogna Gud, förödmjuka fienderna till islam Judar, amerikaner och britter och alla dem som ger dem stöd som samarbetar med dem och som är i allians med dem Gud, förstör dem alla Gud, lämna ingen av dem i livet Gud, skänk seger till mujahedin överallt Abdulkader Habib från Sveriges Unga muslimer förklarade imamens dödliga bön med okunnighet men medgav att liknande böner förekommer: Jag tror inte att det här är helt isolerat för en imam. Jag måste vara öppen och säga att det säkert är flera imamer som uttrycker sig väldigt klumpigt och fel. De måste utbildas och inte isoleras ännu mer. http://www.document.n...

description.hltext_display: Lebensweisheiten aufgetischt
description.content:
Geschichtenerzählerinnen Julia Schacht (l.) und Gerlinde Bartz begeisterten die Frauen in dem Landcafé Ostholt, während draußen der Schneesturm ein Vorankommen fast unmöglich machte.Foto:
(cro)
Münster-Handorf - Es duftet verführerisch nach frisch gebrühtem Kaffee und gebackenen Plätzchen. Kerzen sorgen für ein warmes Licht im Hofcafé Ostholt, während draußen der Schneesturm tobt. Noch hat Mechthild Ostholt alle Hände voll zu tun, denn eine Überraschung der besonderen Art wartet auf die rund 25 Frauen, die sich zu dem schon traditionellen Märchennachmittag angemeldet haben. Selbst gebackener Christstollen darf ebenso wenig auf der Kaffeetafel fehlen, wie ein kleiner Weihnachtsgruß.
„Wir machen schon seit einigen Jahren diese Märchennachmittage - und sie sind immer gut angekommen“, freute sich Ostholt, die zuerst Bedenken hatte, dass aufgrund des Wetters niemand zur Erzählstunde kommen könnte. Doch sie wurde von den Handorferinnen nicht enttäuscht: „Wir wollten die Märchenerzählerinnen erleben“, waren sich die Frauen einig.
Und auch die Erzählerinnen Julia Schacht und Gerlinde Bartz hatten ihren Spaß. „Es ist das richtige Wetter, um es sich gemütlich zu machen und in einem kleinen Kreis etwas zu erzählen“, so Bartz.
Das ließen sich die Frauen nicht zweimal sagen und genossen erst einmal den Kuchen. „Wir haben Volksmärchen zur Weihnachtszeit mitgebracht“, erklärten die beiden Märchenerzählerinnen.
Darunter waren sowohl wenig bekannte Geschichten der Gebrüder Grimm, als auch norwegische Märchen oder etwas aus Mitteldeutschland. „Märchen waren früher die einzige Möglichkeit, Lebensweisheiten weiterzugeben und nicht unbedingt nur für Kinder gedacht“, so Schacht.
Denn es werden auch Probleme wie Ungerechtigkeiten oder die Überwindung von Vorurteilen angesprochen. „Früher war es so, dass sogar in erster Linie die Erwachsenen untereinander Märchen erzählten, gerade in der kalten Jahreszeit vor dem Feuer“, berichtete die Erzählerin, die schnell die Frauen in ihren Bann zog. „Ein solcher Nachmittag soll auch die Möglichkeit geben, über das eine oder andere nachzudenken und vielleicht aus den Geschichten einen Gedankenanstoß mitzunehmen“, so Bartz.

description.hltext_display: Pet crocodile prompts legal battle
description.content:
A Queensland man is fighting to keep a pet croc that's been part of his family for almost 50 years.
Related links
A NORTH Queensland man is braced for a legal battle to keep a beloved pet croc that's been part of his family for almost 50 years.
John Casey, 49, was just two years old when Charlie joined the family as a six-inch hatchling after her mother was shot by a hunter in 1963.
His late father Alf lovingly hand reared the estuarine croc, taking her for walks in the north Queensland town of Proserpine, down the pub for a beer, to school fetes and even a ball.
"My father used to just let her walk in front of him down the street," Mr Casey told AAP on Wednesday.
"She's been in just about every pub from Rocky to Cairns. We've got photos of her propped up at a bar in Proserpine when she was about seven feet long."
These days the now three-metre croc is confined to a specially designed pen next to Mr Casey's Proserpine home.
But he fears she'll be taken away after the state government issued him with a long list of demands if he wants to keep Charlie at home.
Mr Casey says he was trying to do the right thing when he applied to have his father's permit to keep Charlie transferred into his name after his recent death.
But he says the government only issued him with a temporary, 12-month permit and Charlie will be relocated unless he meets an onerous set of demands.
He insists there's no way Charlie can get out of her existing enclosure, which is three metres high, enclosed in reinforced mesh and surrounded by concrete walls to ensure she can't dig her way out.
"That pen was made to a plan supplied by parks and wildlife," he said. "There was never a problem before, but suddenly there's one now."
He says the government seems to be concerned about a caravan park situated next to his home, about 50 metres from Charlie's pen.
"But the caravan park was built in 1985 and the pen was built in 1987. Now it's a problem?"
Climate Change and Sustainability Minister Kate Jones says she feels for Mr Casey but he must address legitimate safety concerns.
"That's why he's been granted a 12-month permit to keep Charlie but with conditions related to public safety and the crocodile's welfare," she said in a statement.
Mr Casey must show that there's a proper enclosure, that he has the capacity to catch Charlie if she gets out, and is properly looking after her health.
If that happens, authorities will consider renewing his permit when it expires in October next year, Ms Jones said.
But Mr Casey says the timeframe for some of the conditions will expire in just a few weeks and he's engaged a lawyer to take the matter to the Queensland Civil and Administrative Tribunal.
"One of the silly things they want me to do is put signs up all around that say 'Danger Crocodiles Keep Out'. Anyone in that caravan park is just going to say 'oh there's a croc, let's go and have a look'."
Mr Casey fears his beloved, "docile" Charlie will end up at a crocodile farm.
"She's always had an enclosure of her own," he said. "If they try to put her in with another croc, she'll either kill or be killed.
"I feed her, I look after her water, I look after everything in her pen. She comes when I call her name and I can actually pat her. It'll be devastating if she's taken away."

event_or_fact.property: he was trying to do the right thing when he applied to have his father's permit to keep Charlie transferred into his name after his recent death
she feels for Mr Casey but he must address legitimate safety concerns
That pen was made to a plan supplied by parks and wildlife; There was never a problem before, but suddenly there's one now.

My father used to just let her walk in front of him down the street; She's been in just about every pub from Rocky to Cairns. We've got photos of her propped up at a bar in Proserpine when she was about seven feet long.
the government seems to be concerned about a caravan park situated next to his home, about 50 metres from Charlie's pen
the timeframe for some of the conditions will expire in just a few weeks and he's engaged a lawyer to take the matter to the Queensland Civil and Administrative Tribunal
That's why he's been granted a 12-month permit to keep Charlie but with conditions related to public safety and the crocodile's welfare
If that happens, authorities will consider renewing his permit when it expires in October next year
She's always had an enclosure of her own
the government only issued him with a temporary, 12-month permit and Charlie will be relocated unless he meets an onerous set of demands

description.hltext_display: Terror=liten kunnskap om Islam?
description.content: Fussballgot3061 innlegg2393 anbefalinger/* */profilMeny('usrmenu5150679',15883,'Fussballgot');/* */Det har vært flere forskningsrapporter som har konkludert med at muslimske miljøer er med på å bekjempe radikalisering. Det er også hevdet at personene som ender opp som terrorister gjerne har liten kunnskap om Islam. Det virker logisk på meg å trekke slutningen at radikalisering er et resultat av kynisk og bevisst villedning. Trolig av temmelig små, men veldrevne organisasjoner med lite kontakt med main-stream islamske organisasjoner. "But it is the Muslim-American communities themselves who play a large role in keeping the number of radicalized members low through their own practices, according to the study. Leaders and Muslim-American organizations denounce violent acts, for instance, in messages that have weight within communities." "In addition, such communities often self-police -- confronting those who express radical ideology or support for terrorism and communicating concerns about radical individuals to authorities. Some Muslim-Americans have adopted programs for youth to help identify those who react inappropriately to controversial issues so they can undergo counseling and education, the researchers said." "Muslim-American communities have been active in preventing radicalization," said Charles Kurzman, professor of sociology at UNC, in the statement. "This is one reason that Muslim-American terrorism has resulted in fewer than three dozen of the 136,000 murders committed in the United States since 9/11." http://www.google.com...

" Ekstrem,sykelig kjønnsegregering er bare en av mange elementer som i islam ofte utløser vold,diskriminering og rasisme. Ofte blir hele familier engasjert som deltakere i volden som skal utføres. description.hltext_display: Ein Bild von mir"
Aslak Bonde vil ikke se sannheten i øynene
description.content: Yehuda9448 innlegg12683 anbefalinger/* */profilMeny('usrmenu5150395',19322,'Yehuda');/* */På Dagsnytt Atten i kveld var det tydelig at Aslak Bonde var irritert over det VG's redaktør, Olav Versto, skrev i avisen om at mange muslimer står langt tilbake i utviklingen, og at det er forstemmende hvor mange muslimer som står bak terror mot uskyldige i Vesten og i egne land (fritt gjengitt). Bonde mener at terrorisme ikke må knyttes til islam og muslimer. Snakk om å være forblindet. Hvem er det som sprenger seg selv i hundretall i sivile områder ??? er det nordmenn ??? jøder ??? Hvorfor ikke si det som det er, og kalle en spade for en spade. Den moderne tids terror, trussel og grusomme svøpe over hele det internasjonale samfunn er nettopp islamsk terror. Det er den en hel verden frykter. Det er ikke på tross av islam, men på grunn av denne kvasi-religionen at det skjer så mye terror mot uskyldige mennesker i vår tid, og at alle verdens flyplasser må ha streng kontroll til mange milliarder dollar hvert år. Det er bare få unntak at det er andre enn muslimer som står bak internasjonal terror.

description.hltext_display: Nel 2013 le monoposto saranno più lente
description.content:
Creare una monoposto che sia più lenta rispetto alle attuali: questo l’obiettivo che la Fia ha chiesto di perseguire a Patrick Head e Rory Byrne nel definire le linee guida delle vetture che correranno nel 2013.
I due tecnici stanno gettando delle basi tecniche che verranno analizzate a gennaio dalla Fota per iniziare a stabilire delle linee guida per la rivoluzione tecnica che avverrà tra due campionati.
Le monoposto dovrebbero avere ali più piccole e generare carico aerodinamico sfruttando l’effetto suolo: se cosi dovesse essere l’effetto suolo tornerebbe nel circus dopo 31 anni.
Patrik Head: “Ci è stato chiesto di definire delle specifiche che possano essere alla base di monoposto non più lente di 5 secondi al giro rispetto ad oggi. Abbiamo cercato di individuare delle linee guida che potessero raggiungere questo obiettivo. Con l’introduzione del turbo e le limitazioni di carburante, i motori saranno più efficienti ed i piloti viaggeranno alla massima potenza solo per il 50% del tempo sul giro, questo porterà anche alla riduzione del 35% dei consumi”.
L’obiettivo è quello di agevolare i sorpassi e rendere le vetture più difficili da guidare per aumentare lo spettacolo in pista.
Nel 1998 gli stravolgimenti tecnici sulle monoposto volevano ottenere gli stessi risultati…
Roberto Ferrari
Tag:nuovi regolamenti f1, patrick head, regolamenti f1 2013, Rory Byrne

description.hltext_display: BASF increases European prices for methylamine derivatives
description.content:
- With immediate effect or as existing contracts permit, BASF is increasing its European sales prices for methylamine derivatives as follows:
Dimethylaminopropylamine (DMAPA) + €100/metric ton
Dimethylethanolamine (DMEOA) + €90/metric ton
Methylethanolamine (MMEOA) + €85/metric ton
Methyldiethanolamine (MDEOA) + €85/metric ton
Dimethylformamide (DMF) + €65/metric ton
Dimethylacetamide (DMAC) + €50/metric ton
Methylamine derivatives are versatile chemical intermediates with a wide range of applications, such as agrochemicals, water treatment and personal care. They also prove valuable in the production of feed additives and organic solvents. BASF produces methylamine derivatives at its sites in Ludwigshafen, Germany; Geismar, Louisiana; Nanjing, China; and Camaçari, Brazil.
Additional information
BASF SE

description.hltext_display: P.Rico.- Al menos un muerto al estrellarse un helicóptero militar de EEUU en el norte de Puerto Rico
description.content:
SAN JUAN, 22 Dic. (EUROPA PRESS) -
Al menos una persona ha muerto al estrellarse el helicóptero de la Fuerza Aérea de Estados Unidos en el que viajaba junto a otras cinco personas que permanecen en paradero desconocido. El accidente se produjo en el municipio de Río Grande, en el norte de Puerto Rico, debido a las malas condiciones meteorológicas.
Alrededor de las 19.00 de la tarde (medianoche en la España peninsular) el aparato, un Lakota UH72, se precipitó al mar Caribe frente a las costas de Río Grande, después de haber tenido que desviarse por culpa del mal tiempo, que sería la causa del siniestro, ya que las autoridades han descartado un fallo técnico.
Horas después, los encontraron el cadáver de uno de los ocupantes del helicóptero, aunque se desconoce la suerte que han corrido sus otros cinco compañeros de viaje, por lo que continúan las tareas de búsqueda, según informó el coordinador de la Agencia Estatal para la Gestión de Emergencias y Administración de Desastres, Nino Correa.
En la nave viajaban dos fiscales de la División de Crimen Organizado del Departamento de Justicia, el subdirector de la Guardia Nacional y tres militares, todos ellos integrantes de un operativo contra el narcotráfico con el que se pretendía detener a 43 miembros de una de las redes de tráfico ilegal de drogas que operan en el país.
"Ellos iban a una misión, porque querían salvar al pueblo de Vieques", dijo el secretario de Justicia, Guillermo Somoza, quien lamentó lo ocurrido y adelantó que en las próximas horas se celebrará una rueda de prensa para dar a conocer los últimos datos del suceso, informó el diario 'Nuevo Día'.

description.hltext_display: Le communiqué final du 17ème festival mondial des étudiants insiste sur le droit de la Syrie à la récupération de son Golan occupé
description.content:
Pretoria / Les étudiants et les jeunes du monde ont affirmé leur solidarité avec la Syrie et avec son droit à la récupération de son Golan occupé jusqu'aux frontières de /4/ juin /1967/.
Le communiqué final du 17ème festival mondial des étudiants et des jeunes tenu en Afrique du Sud a affirmé la solidarité des étudiants et des jeunes du monde avec les étudiants et les jeunes de la Palestine et de l'Irak et avec la fermeté du peuple palestinien dans sa résistance à l'occupant israélien.
Ils ont condamné les pratiques raciales d'Israël et sa politique du déplacement et de la colonisation à al-Qods et dans les territoires occupés, tout en demandant la mise d'un terme à l'occupation, l'abolissement des colonies et du mur de la séparation raciale et l'établissement d'un Etat palestinien indépendant avec al-Qods-est pour capitale.
Les étudiants et les jeunes participant au festival ont également dénoncé la guerre et le blocus israélien imposé à Gaza, réclamant de briser ce blocus et d'intenter les criminels de guerre sionistes auprès de la justice.
Ils ont aussi condamné l'occupation de l'Irak et soutenu le droit du peuple irakien à la résistance, à la souveraineté, à la sécurité et à la stabilité.
Ils ont affirmé leur appui à la lutte des jeunes libanais dans le parachèvement de la libération des fermes de Chabaa et de Tilal Kafer Choba de l'occupant israélien, tout en condamnant l'agression israélienne en /2006/ contre Liban.
De même, les étudiants et les jeunes du monde participant au festival avaient organisé une marche imposante vers le site de la cérémonie de clôture, au cours de laquelle la délégation nationale syrienne des étudiants et des jeunes avait fait des présentations artistiques et folkloriques.
Dans le cadre du festival, des séminaires et des ateliers de travail ont été organisés hier et abordé nombre de sujets sur les droits des peuples à la résistance, les territoires arabes occupés, la judaïsation d'al-Qods et le déplacement de ses habitants.
Par ailleurs, un tribunal a été organisé pour juger l'impérialisme, où la délégation syrienne des étudiants et des jeunes a fait une plaidoirie sur les pratiques sauvages et terroristes de l'ennemi sioniste, soutenues par les Etats-Unis, contre les Golanais, et sur la condamnation de tous les crimes et les génocides commis par l'ennemi sioniste au Golan syrien, en Palestine et au Sud- Liban.
/122/ organisations des jeunes et des étudiants des différents pays du monde ont signé un document de solidarité avec la Syrie et ses justes causes et insisté sur leur appui aux étudiants et aux jeunes de la Syrie dans la libération de son Golan occupé.
A. Chatta / R. Bittar

description.hltext_display: Zwei Künstler vor dem Herrn
description.content:
Noch wird an der Krippe für das kommende Jahr kräftig gehämmert, aber jetzt schon haben Peter Freytag und Anton Althoff (v.l.) mit der dritten Auflage des Krippenwegs wieder alle Erwartungen übertroffen.Foto:
(cro)
Münster-Handorf - Schwer liegen die Schneehauben auf den Krippen rund um die Kirche St. Petronilla. Einige der kleinen Figuren sind schon gar nicht mehr zu sehen, während Lampen für einen idyllischen Lichterschein auf dem Kirchplatz sorgen. Doch in diesem Jahr haben Peter Freytag, Alfons Laukötter, Anton Althoff und ihre Mitstreiter rund um den Handorfer Krippenweg noch viel mehr als nur den Platz zwischen Kirche, Pfarrhaus und Pfarrzentrum gestaltet. Ein Weg führt durch den Boniburger Wald bis zur Dyckburgkirche.
„Es stehen 70 Krippen an der Kirche, dann noch einmal 24 in Dyckburg“, sagt Freytag mit Stolz in der Stimme. Was vor drei Jahren als kleine Idee begann, die Freytag von einer Reise nach Maria Laach mitbrachte, ist mittlerweile gewachsen - und noch immer sucht Freytag Mitstreiter. „Wer eine Krippe hat und sie ausstellen möchte, kann sich gerne bei uns melden.“
Dabei haben Freytag und sein Team, zu dem auch Heiner Roetering als Krippenwart, die Elektriker Hugo Bußmann und Hubert Fröhlich sowie die Landfrauen Handorf und Mitglieder der Gemeinde Mariä Himmelfahrt zählen, nie mit einem so großen Erfolg gerechnet. „Es gab bei uns auch noch keinen Vandalismus: Die Menschen haben vielleicht Respekt vor den Krippen“, vermutet Peter Freytag.
Der Grund, warum Freytag und seine Mitstreiter überhaupt einen Krippenweg ins Leben gerufen haben, ist schnell erklärt. „Für mich war Weihnachten schon als Kind etwas ganz Besonderes, das sitzt immer noch drin“, erklärt der „Gründer“ des Krippenwegs.
Auch Krippenmeister Althoff hat seinen eigenen Grund, sich stark zu engagieren: „Es gibt nichts Schöneres als die strahlenden Kinderaugen, wenn sie vor den Krippen stehen.“ Denn immer wieder höre er, dass viele Kinder in der heutigen Zeit gar keine Krippe mehr zu Hause hätten. „Und denen kann man mit einem Krippenweg eine große Freude bereiten.“
Mittlerweile hat sich der Krippenweg auch schon weit über die Grenzen Handorfs hinaus einen Namen gemacht. „Wir erhalten sogar Besuch aus Essen, Lohne oder Warendorf“, freut sich Peter Freytag. Einige der Knubben stammen aus Oberammergau und sind in der Ausstellung zu sehen.
Die Krippen bleiben bis zum 12. Januar stehen. „Aber fürs neue Jahr werden wir uns wieder etwas Neues einfallen lassen“, versprechen alle.

description.hltext_display: Holgates acquires Silver Ridge Holiday Park
description.content:
Lancashire-based Holgates has bought the Silver Ridge Holiday Park in Hale, near Milnthorpe. Holgates says it is looking to more than double the number of holiday homes at the park.
Silver Ridge currently provides 40 privately-owned holiday homes - but this could rise to 90 in 2011, says Holgates. There would also be "additional employment opportunities", the company said.
The family business last year acquired Bay View Holiday Park at Bolton le Sands, near Morecambe. It has since been subject to a 5m development programme which has added new facilities to the site including a sea-facing bar-restaurant.
Michael Holgate, who runs Holgates, said: "Cumbria as a whole has been benefitting from the stay-cation trend of recent years and we are already dealing with a record number of enquiries and bookings for 2011.
"We have also noticed the holiday season growing gradually longer each year with bookings now extending well into spring and autumn."

description.hltext_display: L'incendie est-il criminel ?
description.author: Jean Cohadon
description.content:
Les pompiers ont évacué deux habitants grâce à la grande échelle et la rue Croix-Baragnon a été bloquée toute la matinée par le travail des secours./Photos DDM, Xavier De Fenoyl
Un feu violent a éclaté hier matin peu après 4 heures dans la cour d'un immeuble de trois étages de la rue Croix-Baragnon, à Toulouse. Les pompiers ont été alertés par un habitant qui a quitté son appartement du 1er étage par la fenêtre (!) à 4h20. « Ils sont arrivés très vite et ils ont fait un super boulot », assure ce locataire. Deux autres habitants de l'immeuble ont eux pris la fuite par le toit. Ils ont été secourus par les pompiers avec une grande échelle équipée d'une nacelle. Les deux réfugiés patientaient les pieds nus et en tenue de nuit… Deux habitants ont été incommodés par les fumées et évacuées vers l'hôpital Purpan. « Par précaution, souligne un pompier. Leur étant de santé n'inspirait pas de réelle inquiétude ».
Le feu a pris sous la cage d'escalier, dans le local poubelles. À l'arrivée des premières équipes de secours du centre de secours de Lougnon, l'escalier en bois qui se trouve à l'arrière de l'immeuble dans la cour était entièrement embrassé. Les pompiers ont travaillé pour éviter que le feu se propage aux immeubles attenants notamment à travers les structures en bois qui assurent la solidité de cet immeuble « qui doit avoir environ 500 ans », selon son propriétaire.
Le feu a été maîtrisé mais les efforts des pompiers ont été longs pour bien noyer les braises qui pouvaient encore progresser dans ces grosses poutres. L'escalier entre le rez-de-chaussée et le 1er étage a été entièrement détruit. « Le reste de l'immeuble, notamment les appartements, n'a pas trop souffert à part bien sûr la fumée », souligne le propriétaire. Un marchand de tapis, installé dans un local sous l'escalier a en revanche été durement sinistré. Et un atelier de retouche a vite déménagé pour assurer son travail en cette période chargée.
« Pour moi c'est criminel, estime le propriétaire des lieux. Je ne vois pas comment le feu aurait pu partir autrement. Le problème c'est la porte. Il y a un digicode mais elle reste souvent ouverte… » La police a ouvert une enquête et des experts devront examiner le départ du feu. Et également les dégâts puisqu'une poutre maîtresse a été touchée par le feu. Hier sa fragilité inquiétait mais l'ensemble a été étayé par une société spécialisée.
« j'ai été réveillé par la chaleur ! »
« Je dormais et dans mon sommeil, j'entendais un bruit sourd, un gros bruit de cheminée. Et puis la chaleur… Je crois que c'est ça qui m'a réveillé ». Christophe Dura, le locataire du 1er étage est sorti du lit en sursaut hier vers 4 heures. « La fumée était déjà dans l'appartement. Je n'ai même pas essayé d'ouvrir la porte de mon appartement. J 'ai enfilé un jean et des baskets et je suis passé par la fenêtre ! » Le temps de descendre en s'aidant de la gouttière et ce commercial qui travaille dans la promotion immobilière a sonné chez ses voisins, affolé. « Personne n'a répondu. Les pompiers sont arrivés très vite, à peine 5 minutes après mon appel. Moi j'avais peur pour les autres locataires et je craignais que le gaz explose. Les pompiers ont été supers efficaces, bravo. Il n'y a pa de blessés, c'est le plus important. Après, comment c'est parti, je ne sais pas. mais à 4 heures , en pleine nuit, une cigarette, ça m'étonnerait. Pour moi, pas de doute, c'est criminel ! »

description.hltext_display: EBK nın Canlı Sığır İthalatında İzin Süresi Bir Yıl ...
description.content:
Et ve Balık Kurumu'na verilen sıfır gümrükle 100 bin ton damızlık olmayan canlı sığır ithalatı izni bir yıl süre ile uzatıldı. Bu karar kapsamında yapılacak ithalat için 31 Aralık 2011'e kadar ithal lisansı düzenlenecek. 2010 yılında 100 bin tonluk tarife kontenjanının 50 bin tonunu kullanan EBK, 2011'de geri kalan 50 bin tonunu kullanacak.
Et ve Balık Kurumu Genel Müdürlüğünce Kullanılmak Üzere Damızlık Olmayan Canlı Sığır İthalatında Tarife Kontenjanı Uygulanması Hakkında Karar Resmi gazetede yayımlandı. Bakanlar Kurulu Kararı ile kabul edilen karara göre, Et Balık Kurumu'na verilen ve 31 Aralık 2010'da süresi dolan sıfır gümrükle damızlık olmayan 100 bin tonluk canlı sığır ithalatında süre 31 Aralık 2011'e kadar uzatıldı. 2010 yılında 100 bin tonluk tarife kontenjanının 50 bin tonunu kullanan EBK, 2011'de geri kalan 50 bin tonunu kullanacak. TMO'ya açılan kontenjan çerçevesinde yapılacak ithalatta gümrük vergisi oranı yüzde sıfır olarak uygulanırken bunun dışında yapılacak ithalatta ise İthalat Rejimi Kararı çerçevesinde tespit edilen gümrük vergisi uygulanacak. İthal lisansı Dış Ticaret Müsteşarlığı'nca düzenlenip 31 Aralık 2011'e kadar geçerli olacak.(ANKA) (HGS/ÖMR) (Ankara Haber Ajansı) 4 dakika önce.. [2430110]

description.hltext_display: Arms treaty with Russia nears Senate approval
description.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Barack Obama's strategic nuclear arms treaty with Russia secured enough votes to clear a Republican procedural hurdle on Tuesday and headed toward approval in the Senate this week.
A motion to limit further debate on the treaty passed with 67 votes, the same number needed to secure Senate approval. A final vote on the accord was set for Wednesday after lawmakers debate a rash of last-minute amendments.
"This treaty will make America safer and restore our leadership in global efforts to stop nuclear proliferation," Senate Democratic Leader Harry Reid said.
But Senator John Kerry, who led the floor debate as chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, cautioned: "This is not over. We have to count every vote."
At least 12 Republicans have said that they will vote with Democrats to approve the pact, which would give Obama his third major victory on Capitol Hill in less than a week.
He earlier won repeal of the U.S. ban on gays serving openly in the military and passage of an $858 billion deal with Republicans to extend expiring tax cuts and spur economic growth.
The treaty, which would cut strategic atomic weapons deployed by each country to no more than 1,550 within seven years, was signed by Obama and Russian President Dmitry Medvedev in April.
It is a centerpiece of Obama's bid to "re-set" relations with Russia, which has been increasingly cooperative on issues related to U.S. national security, from curbing Iran's nuclear program to the war in Afghanistan.
Republican opponents of the accord, angered by the their inability to stop the march toward passage, charged the Obama administration had negotiated a bad treaty that let Russia limit U.S. missile defense options when the real strategic threat was not Moscow but states like North Korea and Iran.
"Nothing that he has done has convinced me that he is committed to missile defense," Senator Lindsey Graham told a news conference, saying Obama was effectively "giving the Russians a veto" over its missile defense plans.
The Senate's top two Republicans -- Minority Leader Mitch McConnell and Minority Whip Jon Kyl -- have announced they will vote against START, saying lawmakers haven't had enough time to fully consider the treaty.
But the chamber's third-ranking Republican, Lamar Alexander, joined Democrats on Tuesday in agreeing to end debate and move to approval of the pact.
"I will vote to ratify the New Start Treaty ... because it leaves our country with enough nuclear warheads to blow any attacker to kingdom come, and because the president has committed to an $85 billion, 10-year plan to make sure that those weapons work," Alexander declared in a Senate speech.
Alexander's state of Tennessee is home to one of the nuclear facilities that will receive billions of dollars in modernization funding under an agreement worked out between lawmakers and the White House.
Political analysts say Senate rejection of the treaty would be a major setback to warming ties between the Russia and the United States, giving ammunition to Russian hawks who oppose the thaw in relations with Washington.
Collapse of the pact would also inflict political damage on Medvedev, who has embraced Obama's efforts to improve relations and stepped up Russian support for U.S. efforts to rein in Iran's nuclear program.
There has been far less public or political debate over the treaty in Russia. The Russian State Duma has yet to approve the accord and Medvedev has made clear that parliament should not ratify the treaty until U.S. Senate approval is certain.
Konstantin Kosachyov, the pro-Kremlin chairman of the international affairs committee, said Russian lawmakers would carefully examine the U.S. Senate's resolution of ratification and other declarations before proceeding with their own vote, which could conceivably be held this year.
(Additional reporting by Steve Gutterman in Moscow and Richard Cowan and Donna Smith in Washington; Editing by Mohammad Zargham and Anthony Boadle)
(c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2010. Check for restrictions at: http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

description.hltext_display: China replaces top Foreign Ministry official
description.content:
BEIJING - China has replaced a top diplomat amid a trend toward greater assertiveness in handling territorial disputes and participating in global organizations.
Vice Foreign Minister Zhang Zhijun took over recently as the ministry's Communist Party secretary, state media reports said Wednesday, likely putting him in line to eventually take over from Foreign Minister Yang Jiechi. Yang was accused of being caught off guard when U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton announced at a security conference in Vietnam this year that Washington considered the peaceful resolution of South China Sea disputes as part of the American national interest.
Zhang, 57, had served almost his entire career in the party's International Liaison Department, a type of shadow Foreign Ministry focusing on contacts with foreign political parties, until he became deputy to Yang last year.
That party background may mean he has more of a say in policymaking than his predecessor, as China increasingly abandons its former low-key approach to dealing with the outside world. The country's rising economic clout amid the global economic downturn that has battered traditional powers such as the United States has emboldened Chinese leaders to demand a bigger say in global affairs such as climate change and at international organizations, including the United Nations.
China's aggressive assertion of its territorial claims in the South China and East China seas have, meanwhile, sparked a backlash from other countries in the region, drawing them closer to Washington.
The powerful People's Liberation Army is believed to be leading the calls for a tougher line in such disputes, while other Cabinet officials have emphasized quietly advancing China's interests in economic, media and cultural spheres.
China's most senior diplomat, State Counselor Dai Bingguo, is seen as balancing the different arguments, although the country's opaque political system ensures that such debates almost never make it into the public arena.
Little is known about Zhang's personal style, although his party background and relative lack of experience working abroad suggest he will closely reflect the tone set by the party leadership.
Zhang's appointment was announced on official websites, including that of the party's People's Daily newspaper, but no exact date was given.
He takes over from Wang Guangya, a courtly career diplomat who was ambassador to the U.N. from 2003-2008, during which China took advantage of the U.S. preoccupation with Iraq to quietly expand its diplomatic space.

event_or_fact.property: Washington considered the peaceful resolution of South China Sea disputes as part of the American national interest.
in policymaking than his predecessor, as China increasingly abandons its former low-key approach to dealing with the outside world

description.hltext_display: Blagnac. Quand la CGT licencie sa salariée
description.author: Jean-Luc Martinez
description.content:
Dalila présente sa lettre de licenciement qui entre dans le dossier pour les Prud'hommes./ Photo DDM
Depuis le 10 décembre, Dalila Y. est au chômage, licenciée par l'Union Locale de la CGT à Blagnac. Une situation inhabituelle pour la Confédération Générale des Travailleurs dont l'une des missions est de défendre les salariés. Les raisons invoquées dans la lettre de licenciement font réagir vivement l'intéressée qui porte l'affaire devant le conseil des Prud'hommes.
« La CGT me reproche de ne plus vouloir faire des tâches qu'elle m'avait confiées et qui sont illégales », déclare Dalila Y.. « Depuis mon arrivée à l'U. L. de Blagnac, le 1er octobre 2009, je suis envoyée régulièrement aux Prud'hommes pour défendre des salariés alors que je ne suis pas syndiquée et que cette tâche doit être faite par des bénévoles.
L'autre motif du licenciement concerne un reproche qui m'est fait de ne pas avoir pris rendez-vous à la médecine du travail, au mois de novembre, à mon retour d'un arrêt maladie suite à une opération chirurgicale. Mais il se trouve que c'est à l'employeur de contacter la médecine du travail pour une visite préalable à la reprise d'activité professionnelle ».
Confortée par les textes
Embauchée comme secrétaire par l'Union Locale de la CGT de Blagnac en Contrat d'Accompagnement à l'Emploi (CAE), Dalila Y. n'a pas de qualification mais son passage par le syndicat lui a donné de l'expérience et des connaissances en droit du travail.
Le personnel de l'antenne blagnacaise de la médecine du travail est formel. « C'est l'entreprise qui doit prendre rendez-vous avec nous dans les huit jours qui suivent la fin de l'arrêt de travail pour une visite », explique l'une des assistantes du docteur Pau. « Le salarié peut en faire la demande mais uniquement par lettre recommandée avec accusé de réception ».
Du côté du greffe du conseil des Prud'hommes, les textes donnent aussi raison à Dalila. « Une personne n'a pas de pouvoir légal pour défendre des dossiers si elle est salariée et si elle n'est pas syndiquée » rappelle M. Charlet, directeur du greffe du conseil des Prud'hommes de Toulouse.
« Je ne suis pas patron dans l'âme »…
«Pour ma première expérience en tant qu'employeur, c'est un vrai traumatisme », avoue Eric Genest, secrétaire de l'Union Locale de la CGT de Blagnac jusqu'à la dernière réunion du bureau, au cours de laquelle il a cédé sa place.
« Nous avons voulu laisser trop d'autonomie à mademoiselle Dalila Y. qui se retourne maintenant contre nous. Nous l'avions embauchée en CDD de deux ans avec la volonté de la garder en CDI et de la former le mieux possible. Pendant un an tout s'est très bien passé et elle a voulu une augmentation que nous n'avons pas pu satisfaire complètement.
Pour la médecine du travail, comme elle était secrétaire, je lui ai demandé de prendre le rendez-vous en toute confiance. Je ne suis pas patron dans l'âme ».

description.hltext_display: Thibaut cherche des bénévoles
description.content:
Thibaut, 6 ans, est un jeune autiste. /Photo DR
À 6 ans, Thibaut est atteint de troubles autistiques qui l'empêchent d'être un enfant comme les autres. Pour l'aider ses parents recherchent des bénévoles. Ils se relayeront auprès de lui, à raison de 1 heure à 1 h30 par semaine, dans la salle de jeux à son domicile dans le quartier des Sept-Deniers et appliqueront la méthode des « 3i », développée par l'association Autisme espoir vers l'école. Aucune expérience du handicap n'est nécessaire. Il suffit d'aimer les enfants, d'être gai, dynamique, positif, et de tout transformer en jeu. Pour optimiser les séances, des réunions ont lieu entre bénévoles, psychologue et parents. Renseignements auprès de sa mère au 06 11 78 32 26.
