description.hltext_display: Straks minder woonwagens in Waardenburg
description.content:
WAARDENBURG - Het woonwagenkamp in Waardenburg, het enige kampje in de gemeente Neerijnen, wordt waarschijnlijk kleiner. Er zijn nabij de Steenweg twaalf standplaatsen, enkele gezinnen die er nu wonen hebben aangegeven dat ze eventueel wel willen verhuizen naar reguliere woningen.
Ze hebben zich ingeschreven bij woningcorporaties. Waarnemend burgemeester Marianne Kallen: "We zijn daarover in overleg en dat verloopt in goede sfeer. Er is wel afgesproken dat als er een gezin vertrekt dat de standplaats dan niet opnieuw bezet mag worden." Het is overigens de laatste jaren rustig rond het woonwagenkamp.

description.hltext_display: Rusia aplaza hasta 2011 el lanzamiento de su satélite de comunicaciones 'Glonass-K'
description.content:
MADRID, 22 Dic. (EUROPA PRESS) -
Rusia ha decidido aplazar hasta 2011 el lanzamiento de un nuevo satélite de comunicaciones 'Glonass-K', ha informado este martes el Ministerio de Defensa. Este sistema iba a ser lanzado el próximo 28 de diciembre desde el Centro Espacial Plesetsk, mediante un propulsor modelo 'Soyuz-2.1.b'.
"No se han completado los preparativos para la compleja conexión de navegación de la aeronave Glonass", se lee en el comunicado del Ministerio. Este satélite emitirá cinco señales distintas de navegación, cuatro de ellas destinadas a uso militar.
El pasado 5 de diciembre, un cohete 'Proton-M' que transportaba tres unidades de este modelo perdió el rumbo y se hundió en aguas del océano Pacífico. Los técnicos atribuyen este fracaso a una serie de defectos de fabricación.
Con estos aparatos el Kremlin aspiraba a completar el Sistema Global de Navegación de Satélite. Rusia ya cuenta con un total de 26 'Glonass' en órbita, pero solo una veintena están operativos, informa RIA Novosti.
Dicha estrategia es la respuesta al Sistema de Posicionamiento Global (GPS) de Estados Unidos, y de hecho permite la misma aplicación de conocer el emplazamiento de las terminales con un margen de escasos metros.

description.hltext_display: Dalit woman gangraped for a week in UP
description.content: Lalitpur, Dec 22: Another shocking incident of gangrape reported from Uttar Pradesh on Wednesday, Dec 22. Police officials said that they received a complaint against a gang who abducted a Dalit woman and raped for nearly a week.Police officials filed an FIR against Chottelal Jha and five others for allegedly raping the women. Police said that Chottelal Jha and his aide abducted the woman on Nov 6, 2010 while she was going to her parents house in Gandhi Nagar locality.Later they took her to Mayaon village and along with four others raped her for a week. This incident came to light when the woman managed escape from their custody."The woman somehow later managed to escape from their clutches and reached her in-laws house. The couple then informed the police about the incident yesterday after which an FIR had been lodged at Kotwali police station," Superintendent of Police Akash Kulhari said.OneIndia News

event_or_fact.property: The couple then informed the police about the incident yesterday after which an FIR had been lodged at Kotwali police station

description.hltext_display: Afghan official rebukes NATO for civilian deaths
description.content:
KABUL, Afghanistan - An Afghan provincial governor says NATO needs to exert greater caution in its operations following the death of five civilians during a battle with insurgents.
The office of the governor of Helmand province said in a statement Wednesday that the five civilians killed during the clash a day earlier included three women and two children. NATO says it is investigating the deaths, which Afghan officials say occurred during a Taliban raid on an Afghan national police checkpoint.
Afghan officials have repeatedly spoken out about civilian deaths, arguing that the international forces are not being careful enough to avoid such casualties as the war nears its tenth year. Insurgents also try to use the civilian death toll as a way of rallying support for their cause.

description.hltext_display: Man and boy killed in house blaze
description.content:
A man and a young boy have died after a house fire caused by a chip pan left unattended on a cooker, emergency services said.
West Midlands Ambulance Service said both victims were confirmed dead shortly after their arrival at hospital following the blaze in the Lower Stoke area of Coventry.
An ambulance service spokesman said three ambulances and a paramedic officer were sent to the property in Hollis Road after several 999 calls.

description.hltext_display: Le cadeau de Noël des salariés d'Adixen aux intérimaires
description.author: Bertille Bayart
description.content:
C'est un cadeau de Noël en forme de prime exceptionnelle que les 550 salariés d'Adixen (Alcatel-Lucent), à Annecy, ont fait à leurs 245 collègues intérimaires.
La semaine dernière, la direction de l'entreprise - qui sera cédée au groupe allemand Pfeiffer Vacuum en fin d'année - a proposé à ses employés une prime exceptionnelle, en raison d'une année record pour le numéro quatre mondial de la pompe à vide (280 millions d'euros de chiffre d'affaires). «Les intérimaires n'avaient pas touché la prime de juin, mais il nous semblait normal qu'ils puissent bénéficier du complément de prime, en raison de leur participation aux bons résultats», résume Benoît Loquet, le DRH.
Une proposition est alors faite aux syndicats : soit l'enveloppe de 100 000 est répartie à l'ensemble du personnel (non-permanents compris) ; soit les intérimaires en sont les seuls bénéficiaires. C'est donc la deuxième solution qui fut votée, à l'unanimité, par les salariés. Les 245 intérimaires haut-savoyards d'Adixen toucheront donc uniformément 410 euros de prime, grâce à la solidarité de leurs collègues. L'histoire pourrait ne pas s'arrêter là, car Adixen évolue, selon la direction, sur «un marché en croissance».

description.hltext_display: Essendon on Inglis' cards?
description.content:
AFL club Essendon will talk to Greg Inglis this week and may recruit the former Rugby League star.
A DECISION on whether rugby league superstar Greg Inglis joins AFL club Essendon could be made this week.
Essendon coach James Hird said on Wednesday that Inglis and the Bombers would hold talks "in the next couple of days" to discuss which code he wanted to play in 2011.
Inglis, the former Melbourne Storm ace, has run into hurdles in his bid to join South Sydney as the NRL has so far refused to approve his contract to play with the Rabbitohs.
Hird said the Bombers would be interested in Inglis, who he described as "one of the best athletes in Australian sport", but he had to firstly decide whether he wanted to switch codes.
"I haven't met with Greg yet but some time in the next couple of days we'll try and catch up for a chat and we'll see what he's interested to do," Hird said.
"We'll ask him that question and if we're happy with the answer then we'll see what happens."
Although all AFL club squads have been finalised for 2011, Inglis could be squeezed onto the Bombers list and be eligible for extra promotional payments outside the salary cap.
Hird rejected the suggestion that recruiting Inglis, 23, would purely be a promotional exercise.
"Unless he can help us on the football field, we're not interested," he said.
"Our list won't be seen as a novelty no matter what we do.
"Greg Inglis is an amazing athlete, there's no doubt about that but we haven't even talked to him yet.
"He's got to make a decision whether he wants to leave the NRL and then it's up in the air as to what he does.
"It's a long way from being anywhere near happening.
"He's got to make a decision on what he wants to do with his football career, what code he wants to play and then a club like Essendon can come into the picture if he's interested in playing AFL."
Hird said he had only seen Inglis play rugby league but neither he nor any of the club's recruiters could say at this stage what he could bring to the AFL.
He said Inglis had been linked with Essendon because the Bombers made contact with his management midway through last season.
If Inglis does cross codes he would join former Queensland and Australian teammates Karmichael Hunt (Gold Coast) and Israel Folau (Greater Western Sydney).

description.hltext_display: Fel kritiek oor lughawe se hantering van krisis
description.content:
Johannesburg - Terwyl duisende mense steeds op die Heathrow-lughawe gestrand is, is daar talle vrae oor die hantering van sneeustorms deur een van die wêreld se besigste internasionale lughawens.
Duisende vliegtuie kon sedert Saterdag weens swak weersomstandighede nie opstyg of land nie. Honderde mense, onder wie Suid-Afrikaners, moes hoor hul vlugte is vir tot vyf dae vertraag, terwyl ander vrees hulle gaan nie betyds vir Kersfees by die huis wees nie.
“My kinders dink Kersfees is gekanselleer omdat Mammie nie terugkom huis toe nie. Dit breek jou hart,” het Alison Singleton, streekbestuurder van ’n Suid-Afrikaanse koeriermaatskappy, gisteraand uit Londen gesê.
Haar kinders, onderskeidelik 8, 10 en 13 jaar oud, wag sedert Saterdag op hul ma. Haar vlug behoort nou môre te vertrek.
Colin Matthews, uitvoerende direkteur van die Britse lughawensmaatskappy, BAA, het ’n onverwagse sneeustorm en die “ergste sneeuval in meer as ’n eeu” vir die probleme geblameer.
Volgens hom was die BAA “té optimisties” oor hoe vinnig hy die situasie onder beheer kan bring.
Die BAA het 100 bykomende werkers gehuur. ’n Vloot van 28 sneeuploeë, sneeublasers en voertuie wat ys smelt, is gereed gehou.
Dié maatskappy het die laaste paar dae onder fel kritiek deurgeloop vir die manier waarop hy die ysige weerstoestande hanteer het.
Vandag sal die vyfde dag wees dat mense op die vloer of tydelike kampbedjies in gange by die lughawe moet slaap terwyl hulle wanhopig op nuus oor hul vlugte wag.
“Ek is jammer om soveel duisende mense se Kersplanne te vernietig. Dis hartverskeurend om mense se hartseer stories te hoor,” het Matthews aan BBC Radio gesê.
- Volg Nuus24 op Twitter.
- Die Burger

description.hltext_display: Jouets : la fin de l'eldorado chinois
description.author: Keren Lentschner
description.content:
La pénurie de main-d'uvre très bon marché dans l'«atelier du monde» oblige les industriels à revoir leur modèle.La relative amélioration des conditions sociales en Chine ces derniers mois a bien failli pénaliser les achats de jouets pour Noël. La rareté de la main-d'uvre très bon marché, dans l'«atelier du monde», où sont fabriqués les trois quarts des jouets vendus sur la planète, a en effet à la fois allongé les délais de production et accru les coûts des industriels. «Certaines usines ont eu des problèmes de recrutement, explique Jean-Michel Grun­berg, PDG de La Grande Récré, leader de la distribution de jouets en France. D'autres avaient limité leur capacité de production en raison de l'incertitude liée à la crise. Finalement, sur 2010, il y a eu un mois de décalage dans nos livraisons.»
Toutefois, pas de quoi alarmer les distributeurs spécialisés, qui disposent de stocks importants. Ni les principaux fabricants, qui ont pris l'habitude d'anticiper ces aléas. «Cette année, dans notre planning, nous avions prévu deux mois d'avance sur l'embarquement des produits, indique Stéphane Azoulai, vice-président de Lansay. Cela nous a permis de ne pas avoir de retard.»
L'industrie du jouet fut l'une des premières à s'installer en Chine, avant même le high-tech et le textile. Les usines, qui emploient de nombreux saisonniers, sont situées essentiellement dans la province du Guangdong, dans le sud du pays. «Après le Nouvel An chinois, de nombreux ouvriers, originaires du Nord ou de l'Ouest, ne reviennent pas à leur poste, explique Stéphane Azoulai. Ils ne sont plus prêts à quitter leurs familles pour travailler dans n'importe quelles conditions. Pour les garder, c'est devenu une question de prix.» Depuis trois ans environ, les salaires augmentent au rythme de 10 % à 15 % par an. «La Chine n'est plus un eldorado pour ceux qui recherchent des prix très bas», résume Jean-Michel Grunberg.
Pour le moment, la plupart des fabricants ont absorbé cette hausse, qui se conjugue à celle des cours des matières premières, en particulier du pétrole. Mais l'équation économique se complique. Lansay sera ainsi contraint de demander aux distributeurs une augmentation de ses prix de 4 % en 2011.
Relocalisations
Certains ont préféré réduire leur dépendance à l'égard de l'empire du Milieu. En Asie, la Thaïlande et le Vietnam en ont profité. «Nous n'excluons pas d'y aller, notamment pour les produits qui requièrent beaucoup de main-d'uvre, comme les peluches», estime Pascal Chaillou, le fondateur de Yaki, une jeune PME. «Depuis trois ans, nous achetons beaucoup moins en Chine, davantage en Europe, ce qui facilite les réassortiments grâce à des délais plus courts», déclare Jackie Pellieux, président de JouéClub. Depuis cinq ans, Jemini, fabricant français de jouets, a rapatrié dans la Sarthe la production de son mobilier pour enfants. Smoby l'a fait dans le Jura pour une partie de ses jouets. «Nous n'hésiterons pas à le faire pour d'autres produits si c'est économiquement intéressant, indique le PDG de Jemini, Thierry Bertoux. Aujourd'hui, on en est loin.»
La Chine reste en effet incontournable. «Elle a beaucoup évolué dans la qualité de son outil de production, la qualification de sa main-d'uvre et sa capacité à mettre en uvre des normes de qualité», déclare Jean-Claude Grunberg. «Il existe une vraie plate-forme de savoir-faire sur l'électronique dans le sud de la Chine», ajoute Pascal Chaillou.
Concernant la qualité et la sécurité des produits, de nombreux scandales ont contraint les fabricants chinois à redoubler d'efforts. Les inspections qualité se sont multipliées. «Il y a encore trois ans, il arrivait que certains jouets ne passent pas les tests de qualité, reconnaît Jean-Laurent Picard, responsable du département qualité d'un grand distributeur français en Chine. Le secteur s'est assaini au point que ce n'est presque plus le cas aujourd'hui, à condition de mettre en place une politique d'achats responsable.»

description.hltext_display: Hallado muerto en Badajoz un exconcejal implicado en abusos
description.content:
Un exconcejal de Izquierda Unida de Arroyo de San Serván, una población de la provincia de Badajoz de poco más de 4.000 habitantes, apareció ayer tarde muerto en su domicilio, con un disparo en la cabeza, horas después de salir en libertad con cargos tras haber sido detenido en una operación relacionada con la explotación sexual de una menor. Daniel Cangas, de 55 años, residía en la misma calle donde vivían siete ciudadanos rumanos detenidos por retener a una niña de 14 años de Madrid, cuya desaparición denunciaron sus padres, a la que presuntamente obligaban a ejercer la prostitución.
La delegada del Gobierno en Extremadura, Carmen Pereira, explicó ayer, horas antes de conocerse la muerte del exedil, que en la operación habían sido arrestadas 12 personas (entre ellas cinco españoles), que la víctima ya se había reunido con su familia en la capital de España y que el caso permanecía abierto y bajo secreto de sumario.
Las detenciones se iniciaron a partir de la iniciativa de un policía local que tuvo conocimiento de la denuncia de la familia de la niña, interpuesta en septiembre en una comisaría de Madrid. En ella se decía que existían "sospechas fundadas" de que la menor se hallaba en el pueblo.
Tras comprobar que se encontraba en una casa en la que vivían hacinados una treintena de ciudadanos rumanos, y que uno de ellos pasaba por ser el novio de la menor, la Guardia Civil acudió a la casa a liberarla. "Estaba muy débil, delgada y asustada", indicó el agente local. Junto a quienes la retenían fueron detenidos algunos de los clientes de la red, acusados de haber requerido los servicios sexuales de la menor a cambio de dinero. La niña, que al parecer procede de una familia acomodada, llegó hasta Arroyo de San Serván de la mano de un joven rumano de 22 años "esbelto y atractivo" del que se habría enamorado, según han relatado vecinos de la población.

description.hltext_display: L'hésitation est de mise sur le CAC40
description.author: Mathilde Golla
description.content:
L'indice vedette de la place de Paris qui a bien progressé au cours des deux dernières séances est indécis en début de séance, dans l'attente des statistiques américaines sur la croissance. Hermès et LVMH devraient être entourés.Le CAC40 marque une pause ce mercredi au lendemain de deux séances de hausse consécutive et avance très légèrement à 3928,49 points. Les inquiétudes sur les dettes et les avertissements de Moody's sur la Grèce et l'Irlande pourraient peser sur les décisions d'investissement. L à l'inverse des Bourses asiatiques qui ont achevé la séance en repli. Les regards seront tournés ce mercredi vers les Etats-Unis qui publieront leur chiffre de croissance pour le troisième trimestre cet après-midi.
L'indice Nikkei de la terminé la journée de mercredi sur un repli de 0,23%, les investisseurs, déçus par les statistiques du commerce extérieur japonais et précautionneux avant un jour férié, ayant choisi d'empocher des bénéfices, selon des courtiers.
Les publications statistiques seront nombreuses ce mercredi. Outre, le PIB américain sur le troisième trimestre, les investisseurs s'intéresseront aux reventes de logements. En Grande-Bretagne, les chiffre de la croissance sur le troisième trimestre seront également dévoilés ainsi que la balance des paiements et les minutes de la banque d'Angleterre. Au moment ou , les chiffre de l'endettement sur 2010 tombent. Sans surprise, . Ainsi, la dette nette publique de l'État américain a augmenté de plus de 2.000 milliards de dollars sur l'année fiscale 2010. Même constat pour le Royaume-Uni: le déficit public du pays s'est creusé plus que prévu en novembre pour s'établir à 16,8 milliards de livres (19,8 milliards d'euros) sur un mois, soit 2 milliards de plus qu'en novembre 2009. Les endettements allemands et français atteignent des records.
Du côté des valeurs, Veolia prend la tête du classement avec un gain de 0,8%. Le groupe de service aux collectivités a signé un contrat de plus d'un milliard d'euros de chiffre d'affaires sur un an pour l'exploitation de trois liaisons régionales en Bavière, confirmant ainsi une information de La Tribune. Ce contrat est le plus important de Veolia Transport en Allemagne.
Total est également bien orienté avec un gain de 0,4%. Le groupe pétrolier a annoncé son intention de faire son entrée sur le marché brésilien de la canne à sucre via son partenaire Amyris dans le but de produire une série de produits biochimiques. En s'associant avec des entreprises brésiliennes, Total souhaite pouvoir revendiquer 5% à 10% de la production de la canne à sucre au Brésil d'ici 2020.
LVMH se replie légérement. Le groupe a indiqué qu'il détient plus de 20% d'Hermès (+3,4%) à la suite d'achats sur le marché et hors du marché, poursuivant sa montée dans le capital du groupe, tout en réaffirmant ne pas envisager de prendre le contrôle ou de lancer une OPA.
Par ailleurs, l'américain Genzyme serait, selon le Wall Street Journal, désormais davantage disposé à discuter avec le groupe Sanofi-Aventis (+0,2% à 49,3 euros). Le laboratoire américain affirmait jusqu'à présent son hostilité à toutes négociations tant que Sanofi n'aurait pas relevé son offre, jugée insuffisante.
Le comité d'entreprise d'EDF (0,1% à 31,9 euros) va essuyer près de 90 millions d'euros de pertes cette année et s'impose un plan de rigueur sans précédent pour rétablir ses finances, selon Les Echos.
Hors CAC40, Ingenico (-2,8% à 26,7 euros), qui a rejeté dimanche une offre sur l'intégralité de la société, a fait savoir mardi soir qu'iet ne menait aucune discussion sur son capital.
LIRE AUSSI : » Ls'effrite en fin de séance

description.hltext_display: Borealis upgrades at Porvoo polyethylene plant support Borstar PE product development
description.content:
- The Borealis Supervisory Board approved a EUR 17 million investment to upgrade one of its polyethylene plants in Porvoo, Finland. The project includes a new ethylene compressor as well as an upgrade of the monomer purification including all necessary auxiliary equipment. Mechanical completion is expected for autumn 2012.
The result of the Porvoo PE2 plant upgrade will be a 15 kilotonnes per year increase from the current total 240,000 tonnes per year polyethylene production capacity. The new turbo compressor will require less maintenance and the new equipment will contribute to improving the operational reliability of the plant.
The Porvoo PE2 plant is used as Borealis’ full scale demonstration unit for the upscaling of new Borstar PE technology and introduction of new products. The new ethylene purification train will have an important role in this process as it helps to avoid impurities via the ethylene feed into the process, improving both reliability during the production process and quality of the final products.
"This investment is yet another milestone in Borealis’ strategy to improve its operational excellence and innovation capability,” says His Excellency, Khadem Al Qubaisi, Chairman of Borealis’ Supervisory Board and Managing Director of IPIC (Abu Dhabi based International Petroleum Investment Company). "It underlines the important role that Borealis’ .

description.hltext_display: Tributes paid to young boys found dead in Trawsfynydd house
description.content:
Police at the Trawsfynydd house where the bodies of a woman and two children were found
TWO young boys found dead in their bedrooms were murdered, a senior detective said last night.
The bodies of Philip Stevens, five, and his brother Isaak, two, were found after police officers forced their way into the house in Trawsfynydd.
Their mum, Melanie Stevens, 36, was found hanging in the bedroom.
Detective Chief Inspector John Hanson said Ms Stevens’ death is not being treated as suspicious.
Officers were sent to Ty Capel in Trawsfynydd at around 8pm on Sunday after calls from frantic family members unable to get into the house.
Mr Hanson said: "We are conducting forensic examination of the home address in Trawsfynydd and are keen to establish what has happened at the address not just on Saturday and Sunday but in the weeks leading up to the incident.
"The two boys were murdered having been found suffocated at the address. The mother was found hanging in the bedroom.”
He said police were not looking for anyone else in connection with the deaths.
He added family liaison officers are working closely with other family members and contact has been made with victim support groups.
Yesterday flowers were laid outside the house where the family had lived for about 18 months as villagers tried to come to terms with the tragedy.
One said: "This is dreadful. Death is tragic at any time of year but being Christmas makes it more poignant.
"Rest in peace little ones, and mother too.”
Philip, known as Pip, attended primary school at Ysgol Edmwnd Prys three miles away in Gellilydan and was well liked by other pupils.
Isaak, called Zak by his family, would often be carried by his mum in a harness around the village.
Ms Stevens’ ex-husband, Peter Akister, 41, who lives in Penrhyndeudraeth, said: "This is just a terrible thing. My main concern now is for the children who have been left behind without a mother.”
The couple, who married in 1996, had three children – Rebekah, 16, Adam, 14 and Ryan, 12, before they split up and divorced.
The father of the two dead children has not been identified but is believed to live in the Midlands.
Ms Stevens, who was brought up in Blaenau Ffestiniog and went to secondary schools in the former slate quarrying town and Harlech, had lived in the Wolverhampton area until early last year when she and her young children moved to Trawsfynydd.
Writing on a social networking website Vicky Anthony, who was at Ysgol Ardudwy, Harlech with Ms Stevens, said simply: "RIP Melanie and your two children.”
Another school friend, Sarah Laura Jones, said: "She was always smiling.”
Adding her comments another friend, Awen Tudor, said: "Such a shame.”
Sarah Crowley said: "I remember Melanie. We used to go to the Sundancer (nightclub in Barmouth) together. How very sad.”
North west Wales coroner, Dewi Pritchard Jones said inquests would be opened and adjourned to a later date as soon as possible.

description.hltext_display: Seúl quiere investigar junto a Pekín el hundimiento de un pesquero chino
description.content:
SEÚL, 22 Dic. (EUROPA PRESS) - quiere investigar junto a China las causas del hundimiento, la semana pasada, de un pesquero chino frente a la costa sur de la península, informa la agencia estatal surcoreana Yonhap. "Esperamos investigar el caso conjuntamente con el Gobierno chino", informa una fuente anónima del Ejecutivo surcoreano, en línea con lo ya transmitido por el Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores.
En el accidente murió un pescador chino, mientras que el otro continúa desaparecido. El barco, de 63 toneladas de peso, volcó y se hundió a unos 115 kilómetros de la ciudad portuaria de Gunsan, después de chocar con un buque guardacostas de , que pesa 3.000 toneladas.
El Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores chino culpó este martes a Seúl, al que reclama compensaciones, pide que castigue a los responsables y tome medidas para garantizar que no vuelva a suceder un incidente similar. ya ha expresado su pésame por lo ocurrido, pero insiste en que el pesquero había entrado ilegalmente en su área económica exclusiva. Asimismo, mantiene que los pescadores reaccionaron con agresividad cuando los guardacostas trataron de subir a su embarcación. De hecho, hasta cuatro agentes tendrían fracturas en los brazos. La fuente consultada asegura que su Gobierno tiene pruebas de que el pesquero chocó contra la patrullera.
"Estamos intentando dar las explicaciones suficientes" a China, añade este funcionario.
Otro miembro del Ejecutivo, en cambio, ha querido subrayar que el Sur seguirá aplicando de forma estricta la legislación sobre pesca en sus aguas, aunque matiza que Seúl intentará trabajar junto a Pekín para investigar lo ocurrido la semana pasada.

description.hltext_display: Bruselas tacha de "inaceptable" el caos europeo por el temporal
description.content:
La Comisión Europea dijo ayer basta. El caos desatado en los aeropuertos de media Europa por el temporal de nieve "es inaceptable y no debería volver a ocurrir", sentenció el comisario de Transportes, Siim Kallas, en un contundente comunicado en el que anunció asimismo que en los próximos días pedirá "explicaciones" a los representantes de aeropuertos europeos. No solo eso. "Estos últimos años nos han demostrado que la nieve en Europa Occidental no es una circunstancia excepcional", por lo que es exigible una "mejor preparación" ante situaciones como esta, afirmó Kallas. De lo contrario, la Comisión está dispuesta a tomar medidas legislativas para asegurar "un servicio mínimo" en los aeropuertos.
HEATHROW Mientras, el Reino Unido, Francia y Alemania vivían otra jornada de caos en los transportes, con miles de pasajeros a la espera de poder alcanzar su destino. Un millar de vuelos fueron cancelados en toda Europa, según Eurocontrol. El aeropuerto londinense de Heathrow, el más concurrido del mundo, solo pudo atender un tercio de los programados, y acumuló retrasos de más de seis horas. Una de sus dos pistas permaneció nuevamente cerrada hasta media tarde, a pesar de que no nieva en Londres desde el sábado. Las Navidades se echan encima y los viajeros bloqueados en Londres no ven el final de la pesadilla. La situación se ve agravada por las esperas a la intemperie, la falta de ayuda material para comida o alojamiento y la escasez de información.
El primer ministro británico, David Cameron, se declaró "frustrado" por una situación de la que se trata de culpar a BAA, la gestora del aeropuerto de Heathrow, filial de la española Ferrovial. El Gobierno mantuvo ayer "intensas discusiones" con los directivos de BAA a fin de normalizar la situación lo antes posible. Unos y otros prometen investigar los fallos de los últimos días, una vez pase la crisis.
En Alemania, la paciencia se agota. Tras cinco días acumulando retrasos y cancelaciones en aeropuertos y estaciones de tren, la opinión pública comienza a pedir explicaciones, informa Rubén Gómez del Barrio. También la oposición ha salido a la palestra: los socialdemócratas y Los Verdes criticaron duramente la actuación del Gobierno y la inexistencia de un protocolo eficiente de emergencias, y se preguntaron cómo una empresa tan fuerte como Deutsche Bahn no ha podido hacer frente a los estragos causados por el temporal en los ferrocarriles.
También los medios, hasta ahora meros comentaristas de la situación meteorológica, empiezan a preguntarse cómo otros países superan estos temporales sin mayores problemas. Y con su respuesta, más previsión y más inversiones, apuntan al Ejecutivo federal, que por ahora da la callada por respuesta.
Puestos a buscar culpables, Fraport, la gestora del aeropuerto de Frankfurt, no ha dudado en señalar al servicio meteorológico por sus errores en las previsiones. Según la gestora, para ayer había anunciado lluvias y no la nevada que cayó sobre sus instalaciones y que obligó a cerrar por unas horas el tráfico aéreo y cancelar un día más otros 400 vuelos.
DISCULPAS DE AIR FRANCE El director ejecutivo de Air France-KLM, Pierre-Henri Gourgeon, tuvo que pedir disculpas ayer a los pasajeros de su compañía que habían tenido que volver a dormir en el suelo del aeropuerto parisino Charles de Gaulle por "no haber encontrado suficientes habitaciones" de hotel en la zona. Fue el inicio de un reconocimiento de responsabilidades, también exigido por la ministra de Ecología e Infraestructuras, Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet, quien acusó a las compañías aéreas de falta de información, informa Vicenç Batalla.

description.hltext_display: LOIS HENRY: Oildale woman home for Christmas, with a little help
description.content:
Sometimes good things do happen to good people.
And Barbara Ray is one of the few truly good people I've met in my life. So I was happy to learn she was finally able to move back into her home just in time for Christmas.
Ray, 78, was burned out of the cozy Oildale house back in April when her PG&E power line snapped and the live wire ignited her roof, burning up the back half of the house and severely damaging the rest.
Over the next four months, the giant utility ignored her repeated telephone messages and requests for help even though a Kern County Fire Department report showed the fire was clearly PG&E's fault. Just before the fire, Ray also had needed to cancel her home insurance to save money to patch a leaky roof. So she had no way to repair the house she and her husband built in 1951.
She was stuck.
She moved into a spare room at her granddaughter's house, gladly accepted donated clothes and any help from neighbors and friends and resolutely set about cleaning the house one room at a time.
In July, her situation was featured in the newspaper and, suddenly, PG&E returned her calls and provided paperwork for a claim, which she filed for $98,000.
The utility paid the full amount (getting off abominably cheap if you ask me) and Ray got busy rebuilding.
It was an extensive job.
Not only was the fire damage worse in some cases than she and contractor James Miller initially thought, bringing it up to code was a major chore.
But Miller, with help from subcontractors, friends, relatives and a big assist from Home Depot, was able to stretch the budget.
In many cases, the subcontractors worked at cost, some worked free, others donated supplies and Home Depot gave Miller great deals on just about everything he needed, he said. "And Barb worked her (rear) off," he said. "I put in probably 55 to 60 hours a week and she was here every single day with me. "The only time she left was to run errands or pick up her grandkids and she'd be right back to baby sit and keep working." Where she could make do with her old stuff, she did, including repainting the scorched doors of her fridge rather than buy a new one because it still worked.
With all that scrimping, she had hoped to have some money left over for a small car or pick up truck. But Miller said Tuesday there wouldn't be enough. "That's OK," Ray shrugged. "My old truck still runs." I'm pretty sure Jimmy Carter was president when that truck was built and, frankly, he's aged better. But Barbara refused to dwell on the negative, instead showing me around her new/old home and marveling at how nice it all looked. The family's plans are to have Christmas dinner at her granddaughter's house (which flooded in the recent rains).
But Ray told me she might go ahead and cook a turkey anyway. "And sit here in my own house and just look at it," she chuckled. Absolutely! Welcome home, Barbara.
Opinions expressed in this column are those of Lois Henry, not The Bakersfield Californian. Her column appears Wednesdays and Sundays. Comment at www.bakersfield.com, call her at 395-7373 or e-mail @bakersfield.com

description.hltext_display: AFL will support girl and players
description.content:
The teenage girl at the centre of the nude photo scandal will be given support, the AFL boss says.
THE teenager at the centre of the AFL naked photo scandal continued to broadcast her side of the story over the internet on Wednesday, but has so far failed to deliver on her threat to post more incriminating pictures of footballers.
With aspects of the increasingly unseemly episode due to be aired in court hearings in Melbourne on Thursday, the 17-year-old spoke at length about the photographs and her future intentions in a video allegedly transmitted from a Gold Coast apartment.
The girl posted photographs of St Kilda AFL captain Nick Riewoldt, Zac Dawson and Nick Dal Santo on her Facebook site on Monday, claiming she had taken the snaps while with the players in a Melbourne hotel room.
Riewoldt has angrily denied the claim, saying the pictures were taken by fellow player Sam Gilbert 12 months ago in a Miami hotel room.
Gilbert says the girl lifted the photographs from his computer without his knowledge.
Legal action he has launched against the girl will be the subject of procedural hearings in the Federal Court on Thursday.
Already, the court has ordered her to refrain from publishing photos of Riewoldt and his teammates.
The girl says she has made the photographs public to take revenge on the St Kilda club, the players involved and the AFL because they failed to treat properly her claims she had become pregnant to a St Kilda player.
AFL chief Andrew Demetriou on Wednesday offered to continue counselling support to the 17-year-old.
Mr Demetriou said the league had met with the girl about 20 times since April and offered her counselling.
He said he knew the teenager was going to release the photographs after media organisations and Riewoldt's manager informed him she had made approaches and offered the images.
"We will continue to offer support to this young girl because that's what our program is about ... And we'll continue to offer support to Nick Riewoldt and the other players involved," he said.
Mr Demetriou told Fairfax Radio he believed the incident was not a poor reflection on Riewoldt.
"I have great faith in Nick Riewoldt as an individual. I have great faith in him as a footballer.
"Hopefully, we can put this behind us."
Mr Demetriou said he believed Riewoldt's version of events, because it was backed up in affidavits filed with the Federal Court on Monday.
The affidavits were filed as part of an injunction application to stop Facebook and the teenager posting the photographs which already have gone viral on the internet.
Riewoldt's manager, Ricky Nixon, alleged in his affidavit that the teenager fronted his office on September 6 and said she had stolen naked photographs of his client and Nick Dal Santo.
"She then proceeded to show me the naked photo of Nick Riewoldt which also featured Zac Dawson," the affidavit said.
"I asked her (in) words to the effect of: `How did you get this photo?'," his affidavit said.
Nixon alleged the teenager explained she had stolen the photo from Gilbert's laptop and emailed it to herself.
He alleged the 17-year-old showed up to his office intoxicated three days later and offered him the Riewoldt picture for $20,000.
In his affidavit, Gilbert says he took the photographs on the September 2009 trip and kept them on his laptop.
He alleged the teenager and her friend used his laptop at his house in February this year, but he did not know the girl had looked at the photos.
Gilbert said he discovered the images were stolen when Nixon contacted him in November.
"I was really shocked that she had stolen the photos," the affidavit said.
"She never sought my permission to take the photos from my laptop or email them to her email account."
Gilbert claims he suffered loss and damages including to his reputation after the photographs were posted by the teenager on

description.content: HE’S known for his fight, but even though AM Brynle Williams is undergoing his fiercest battle, he’s still targeting a New Year return to the Assembly.

description.hltext_display: 2011: prohibido fumar
description.content:
La última reserva de los fumadores en Europa, España, está a punto de desaparecer. El Congreso aprobó ayer por mayoría la reforma de la ley del tabaco que prohibirá fumar en bares, restaurantes y cualquier espacio público cerrado. De esta forma, España habrá pasado en poco más de dos décadas de permitir fumar en todos los sitios, incluidos hospitales y aulas de centros educativos, a tener desde el próximo 2 de enero una de las legislaciones más restrictivas de Europa, que prohibirá el tabaco en espacios como los parques infantiles, los patios de los institutos y los entornos de los hospitales.
La ley, que destierra los pitillos de los bares, desató una fuerte oposición de los hosteleros, que entienden que la prohibición vaciará los locales de ocio y estrangulará unos negocios ya muy golpeados por la crisis. Pero el argumento ha sido rechazado por el Gobierno y la mayoría de los partidos --con la excepción del PP--, que consideran la proscripción del tabaco una cuestión de salud pública que evitará miles de muertes. La ministra de Sanidad, Leire Pajín, que se ha encontrado la ley hecha tras casi dos años de trabajo desde que el Ministerio de Sanidad insinuara cambios en la norma, recordó ayer que en España se producen más de 50.000 muertes al año por tabaquismo, de las que unas 3.000 son de fumadores pasivos.
LEY INCUMPLIDA La ley anterior, del 2005, prohibió fumar en centros de trabajo y otros espacios públicos. Sin embargo, se permitió mantener el hábito en bares de menos de 100 m2, y en los locales de mayor tamaño se autorizaron áreas para fumadores. Pero la norma, como reconocieron ayer los portavoces parlamentarios, era ampliamente incumplida. Muy pocos hosteleros adaptaron sus espacios y, sin embargo, dejaban fumar a los clientes. En comunidades autónomas como Madrid, oficialmente ningún bar, discoteca o restaurante ha sido multado por saltarse la legislación durante este periodo. La ley no prevé indemnizar a los hosteleros más gastaron en habilitar sus locales.
La Federación Española de Hostelería siguió insistiendo ayer en que la nueva ley acarreará la pérdida de unos 140.000 empleos, debido al descenso de ingresos del sector en un país de tradición fumadora y con una oferta turística que explota el ocio.
Pero el Ejecutivo lo rebatió y aseguró que el impacto en la hostelería será limitado. "La experiencia de otros países muestra lo contrario. Decir que irá menos gente a los locales es como decir que dejando fumar los bares se llenarán de clientes. El 70% de los españoles no son fumadores. Los locales sin humo permitirán el acceso de niños y de la tercera edad. Toca el tiempo de convivir sin humo en los lugares cerrados. Es una ley necesaria que hace historia", dijo Pajín. Hasta el PP, que se quedó solo en el Senado defendiendo los cubículos para fumadores en todos los locales --alineado con la hostelería y las tabaqueras--, plegó velas ayer y votó con el PSOE y otros grupos, salvo en la enmienda que logró introducir en el Senado --con apoyo de CiU-- para permitir zonas de fumadores en casinos, bingos y salas de juego, y que también fue derrotada. "El texto final es una solución razonable", comentó el portavoz del PP Santiago Cervera, exconsejero de Sanidad de Navarra.
IMPLICACIÓN AUTONÓMICA El cumplimiento de la ley será el principal caballo de batalla a partir del 2 de enero, a pesar de las palabras del portavoz del PP y del llamamiento a la implicación y corresponsabilidad de las comunidades autónomas --encargadas de su cumplimiento-- formulado por la portavoz del PSOE Pilar Grande y la ministra Pajín.

Tiny Minority of Extremists Update: "1 in 3 Brit Muslims [sic] students back 'killing for Islam', 40 percent want Sharia law: Wikileaks," from Asian News International , December 22: The whistleblower website 'Wikileaks' has revealed the outcome of a 2009 poll in the secret US diplomatic cables, saying that 32 percent of Muslim students in 30 universities across the UK believe killing in the name of religion is justified, while 40 percent want Muslims in the country to be under the Sharia law. description.hltext_display: Los vecinos piden más protección en las zonas próximas a Gaza
description.content:
JERUSALÉN, 22 Dic. (EUROPA PRESS) - Los vecinos de Hof Ashkelon (centro de Israel), han denunciado que no están lo suficientemente protegidos de los ataques con misiles caseros lanzados desde la cercana . Este mismo martes resultó herida una niña al caer uno de estos proyectiles sobre una guardería.
El presidente del consejo de Ashkelon, Yair Farjun, asegura que las 12 guarderías de esta circunscripción están protegidas solo parcialmente. "En otras palabras: los tejados están reforzados, pero las paredes no", precisó.
Farjun relató que estos centros fueron reformados hace tres años, en el marco de una oleada de ataques, pero ahora se estima que la reforma no fue lo suficientemente amplia como para garantizar íntegramente la seguridad.
Israel estableció en febrero de 2008 el objetivo de que todas las guarderías a menos de 4,5 kilómetros de Gaza estén completamente protegidas para 2011, "pero en realidad hoy hay muchas guarderías que no lo están", lamentó Farjun. Los vecinos de la zona, en cambio, son partidarios de recibir protección del sistema de defensa antimisiles llamado 'Cúpula de Acero', que todavía no está instalado.
El todavía jefe del Estado Mayor, Gabi Ashkenazi, ha querido matizar que este sistema "no es una respuesta perfecta". "La realidad es que la es frágil y volátil y no tenemos garantías de que la situación no vaya a deteriorarse", admitió el martes. Por el momento, el Gobierno y las fuerzas hebreas no han decidido el emplazamiento de la 'Cúpula de Acero'.
El Tribunal Superior de Justicia, entretanto, ha anunciado que estudiará la petición presentada por los vecinos de la zona para que dicho sistema sea desplegado cerca de sus comunidades. Los residentes aseguran que si no se cumple dicha condición, el Gobierno estará desatendiendo la decisión que le llevó a idear dicho mecanismo y miles de civiles quedarán expuestos a los ataques de la insurgencia gazací.

description.hltext_display: HBO to air 'Pee-wee Herman Show'
description.content:
Dec. 22, 2010 (United Press International) -- HBO is taping a performance of "The Pee-wee Herman Show" on Broadway with plans to air it next year, The Wrap reported.
The stage comedy will premiere on the pay cable network three decades after actor Paul Reubens introduced the character in an HBO special, The Wrap noted Tuesday.
Reubens played the character onstage, in the films "Pee-wee's Big Adventure" and "Big Top Pee-wee," and on the children's television show "Pee-wee's Playhouse," but he stopped appearing as his alter ego after being arrested for indecent exposure in Florida in 1991.
He revived the child-like character with the too-short trousers and high-pitched voice, and starred in "The Pee-wee Herman Show" at the Nokia (NYSE:NOK) Theater in Los Angeles in January and February. The show opened on Broadway in October and is expected to run through Jan. 2.
(Source: UPI ) (Source: Quotemedia)

description.hltext_display: Loretta Jones
description.content:
The Bismarck Tribune runs two types of obituaries. A paid and a free version.
A paid obituary is $9 per column inch. It can include just about anything, including a photo. There is also a $5 setup fee and for this the family receives 10 copies of the newspaper. Please include a billing address and a phone number in case there are questions.
(For example: when accounting measures the column and it's eight inches, they take this times $9 plus the $5 fee. So the total cost would be $77).
If you would like to run the obituary more than once, the fees are as follows: second run, $4 per inch; and third run, $3 per inch.
A free obituary would include the person's name, age, hometown, if they are formerly from this area, when and where they died, when and where services and burial are (even if they are past) and a list of the immediate family survivors which includes spouse, parents, brothers, sisters, children, grandparents, and where they are from, and the number of grandchildren and great-grandchildren; but would not list in-laws or other relatives.
Please e-mail us back or call 250-8240 or 1-888-313-2240 with your preference.
If you want the paid obituary, we can call with the exact amount after publication. E-mail address is obits@bismarcktribune.com. Photos should be attached as jpeg files.
Deadline each day is 4:30 p.m. central time for free or paid obituaries and 5 p.m. central time for notices.

description.hltext_display: Aker Solutions wins contract for gasification and liquefaction plant in US
description.content:
10 - Medicine Bow Fuel & Power LLC has awarded Aker Solutions the Front End Engineering and Design (FEED) package for its Medicine Bow Industrial Gasification & Liquefaction Plant located near the town of Medicine Bow, Wyoming, USA.
Aker Solutions successfully completed a Pre-FEED study for the project in July 2010. Since then Aker Solutions has worked under a letter of intent to provide services relating to design review, licensor support as well as additional Pre-EPC engineering and design. "We look forward to our continued relationship with Medicine Bow Fuel & Power," said Glyn Rodgers, vice president and general manager, Aker Solutions. "It is exciting to see this project, the first of its kind in the United States and only the second one anywhere in the world, progress to the next stage."
The facility will produce liquid transport fuels and is due to come on line in 2015. When complete, the plant will be capable of converting coal into up to 21,000 barrels per day (BPD) of gasoline and LPG liquid fuels.
"This is a very significant step for the Medicine Bow Project," said Robert Kelly, the Chairman of DKRW Advanced Fuels LLC, the owner of the Medicine Bow Project. "The end result of this will be a final design and turn-key estimate which we will use to finance and build the project."

description.hltext_display: Local man, 74, indicted on molestation charge involving 3-year-old girl
description.author: Lauren Pack
description.content:
HAMILTON A Hamilton senior citizen has been indicted by a Butler County grand jury for allegedly molesting a 3-year-old girl he knew.
Winford F. Guthrie, 74, of Vine Street, was indicted Tuesday on one count of gross sexual imposition. He is accused of touching the child inappropriately.
The incident occurred Nov. 17 as the childs mother and grandmother collected food at Mercy Franciscan at St. Raphael on High Street.� The child was hungry and Guthrie offered to buy her lunch, according to the mother, who testified last month at a hearing in Hamilton Municipal Court.
The mother said that after Guthrie returned with the girl, he was near the cars rear seats, looking for his ring.
She said her daughter told her that Guthrie had touched her inappropriately, but she didnt know whether to believe the child. She said Guthrie� dropped them off at Kroger on Ohio 4, where she examined her daughter. She said she found a silver ring in her daughters underwear. She called police and took her daughter to the hospital.
According to Hamilton police, Guthrie admitted during questioning to touching the child.

description.hltext_display: Danskar rekordnegativa till euron
description.content:
Danskarna har aldrig varit så negativa till euron som nu, enligt Danske Banks kvartalsvisa opinionsmätningar. På ett kvartal har gapet mellan nej och ja vuxit från 5 till 13 procentenheter.
Nu säger 42 procent av danskarna ja eller kanske ja till att införa EU-valutan, medan 55 procent säger nej.
Mätningen gjordes under de två första veckorna i december.

description.hltext_display: 栃木・大田原で民家全焼 焼け跡から遺体
Домашний матч сборной Пакистана на КД снова перенесён
description.content: Как сообщает пресс-служба федерации тенниса Пакистана, домашний матч сборной Пакистана против Гонконга будет перенесён в столицу команды гостей. "Международная теннисная федерация приняла решение перенести этот поединок в Гонконг, поскольку представитель федерации Йан Тодд не был удовлетворён мерами безопасности, организованными для игроков обеих команд. Нам очень жаль, но у нас нет другого выбора. Мы должны подчиниться указаниям ITF", — сообщил секретарь федерации тенниса Пакистана Мумтаз Юсаф в интервью Express Tribune. Стоит отметить, что ранее многие игроки ATP-тура не соглашались участвовать в соревнованиях в Пакистане из соображений безопасности, а команда Новой Зеландии в Кубке Дэвиса отказалась отправляться в неспокойную страну и выиграла поединок у себя на родине.

description.hltext_display: 'Spider-Man' performances to resume
description.content:
(Source: United Press International)Performances of Broadway's "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" are to resume two days after a cast member was injured, a spokesman for the musical said.
The show is to go on Wednesday night, the New York Post reported.
The Tuesday night and Wednesday afternoon performances of "Spider-Man" were canceled after an actor playing the titular web slinger was hurt while doing an aerial stunt Monday night.
"OSHA, Actors Equity and the New York State Department of Labor have met with the 'Spider-Man' company today to discuss additional safety protocols," Rick Miramontez, a spokesman for the show, said in a statement issued to the Post Tuesday. "It was agreed that these measures would be enacted immediately."
The newspaper said the new safety measures were not detailed in the statement.
Director Julie Taymor's $65 million musical features complicated aerial stunts, as well as a rock 'n' roll soundtrack by U2's Bono and The Edge. It recently began previews after being delayed several times due to technical snafus and financial problems. Several other actors reportedly have also been hurt in the mounting of the ambitious project.
A service of YellowBrix, Inc.

event_or_fact.property: Spider-Man' company today to discuss additional safety protocols; It was agreed that these measures would be enacted immediately.

entity.property: New York State Department of Labor

description.hltext_display: El Rey saudí abandona el hospital de Nueva York
description.content:
RIAD, 22 Dic. (Reuters/EP) - El Rey Abdulá de Arabia Saudí ha abandonado el hospital de Nueva York en que fue intervenido de la columna vertebral y su salud es "buena", según informó este miércoles la agencia de noticias del Reino, SPA.
"El Rey Abdulá salió del Hospital Presbiteriano el martes por la tarde y Dios le ha concedido buena salud", indicó la Saudi Press Agency. "Se ha trasladado a su lugar de residencia en Nueva York para recuperarse y continuar con la terapia médica", añadió, sin precisar cuándo regresará a Arabia Saudí.
El monarca fue sometido a principios de este mes a una operación quirúrgica para estabilizar una vértebra en su médula espinal. El Rey, cuya edad oscila entre los 86 y los 87 años, había sido operado anteriormente en noviembre, también en Nueva York, a causa de un coágulo de sangre que había complicado sus problemas discales.
El príncipe heredero Sultán, cuya salud también está delicada, se ha visto obligado a regresar a Palacio para gobernar el país mientras se recupera el monarca. El Rey Abdulá, sexto monarca de la dinastía que gobierna Arabia Saudí, accedió al trono en 2005.

description.hltext_display: Frontline services at risk as Flintshire council tries to save £12m
description.content:
FLINTSHIRE Council chiefs have warned they need to save £12 million in the next financial year, as economic pressures tighten.
Chief exeutive Colin Everett told the authority’s executive committee it was ‘impossible to safeguard all frontline services’ at a meeting yesterday and said the council could not longer afford to run all of its assets.
And although the authority has already identified about £9 million of efficiencies, it still needs to save at least another £2 million to balance the books in 2011/12.
Mr Everett said: "We have been working extremely productively with the Welsh Assembly Government to protect public services as far as possible in a very difficult time.
"We cannot shield frontline services in their entirety – it’s impossible to make £12 million of savings and protect all of them.”
Services at risk include smaller libraries and school support services. The council’s social services department is also facing heavy cuts due to the loss of specific grants.
Consultations with trade unions are already underway over employees whose jobs could be at risk as a direct result of funding cuts and Cllr Helen Brown, executive member for housing, said she feared more people would become homeless.
She added: "I’ll say this until I’m blue in the face. We need to be aware of what could happen.”
Flintshire is set to get its final budget settlement for the next financial year from the Welsh Assembly on February 2 and officers say no cuts have yet been finalised.
Mr Everett said: "Many people value the services we are looking to change and we realise that.
"We need people to look at the bigger picture. Compared to some other councils in Wales and particularly England, our situation is much more manageable.”
After the meeting, Cllr Bernie Attridge, deputy leader of the opposition, criticised the council for including the building of a new headquarters in its future spending programme – at a cost of £20m.
He said: "It is scandalous that spending £20m on a new build at County Hall is even being talked about when the council is considering closing libraries and taking services away from our most vulnerable people.”
But Mr Everett said the project was ‘merely aspirational’ and there were no plans to move it forward at any time in the near future.

description.hltext_display: 東松山市長に１２００万円返還請求命令 不正入札めぐり さいたま地裁
Delores Raab
description.content:
The Bismarck Tribune runs two types of obituaries. A paid and a free version.
A paid obituary is $9 per column inch. It can include just about anything, including a photo. There is also a $5 setup fee and for this the family receives 10 copies of the newspaper. Please include a billing address and a phone number in case there are questions.
(For example: when accounting measures the column and it's eight inches, they take this times $9 plus the $5 fee. So the total cost would be $77).
If you would like to run the obituary more than once, the fees are as follows: second run, $4 per inch; and third run, $3 per inch.
A free obituary would include the person's name, age, hometown, if they are formerly from this area, when and where they died, when and where services and burial are (even if they are past) and a list of the immediate family survivors which includes spouse, parents, brothers, sisters, children, grandparents, and where they are from, and the number of grandchildren and great-grandchildren; but would not list in-laws or other relatives.
Please e-mail us back or call 250-8240 or 1-888-313-2240 with your preference.
If you want the paid obituary, we can call with the exact amount after publication. E-mail address is obits@bismarcktribune.com. Photos should be attached as jpeg files.
Deadline each day is 4:30 p.m. central time for free or paid obituaries and 5 p.m. central time for notices.

description.hltext_display: Japanische Forscher züchten "zwitschernde Maus"
description.content:
© AFP/Universität Osaka /
Japanische Forscher haben durch Gen-Mutationen eine Maus gezüchtet, die zwitschert wie ein Vogel. Wie die Forscher von der Universität Osaka erklärten, erhoffen sie sich von dem Experiment Erkenntnisse zu den Ursprüngen der menschlichen Sprache. Die Maus entstand in einem Projekt, bei dem genetisch modifizierte Mäuse verwendet werden, die dazu neigen, ihr Erbgut falsch zu reproduzieren und damit zu mutieren.
"Eigentlich hatte ich Mäuse mit verändertem äußerer Form erwartet", sagte der Projektleiter Arikuni Uchimura der Nachrichtenagentur AFP. Doch eines Tages hätten sie unter den Neugeborenen eine zwitschernde Maus entdeckt. Die Eigenschaft sei zwar zufällig entstanden, würde nun jedoch von Generation zu Generation weitergegeben. Das Labor habe nun mehr als hundert "zwitschernde Mäuse" für die weitere Forschung, sagte Uchimura.
Studien von Singvögeln hätten in anderen Ländern ergeben, dass diese verschiedene Klangelemente benutzten, die ähnlich wie Wörter zu Brocken zusammengefügt würden, sagte Uchimura. Aus diesen würden dann "Lieder" erzeugt, die gewissen sprachlichen Regeln folgen. Mäuse seien jedoch viel besser als Vögel zu studieren, da sie in ihren Hirnstrukturen Menschen weitaus ähnlicher seien als Vögel, sagte Uchimura.
"Wir beobachten nun, wie eine Maus, die neue Töne ausstößt, normale Mäuse beeinflusst ... in anderen Worten, ob diese Töne soziale Bedeutung haben", sagte Uchimura. Angesichts der Tatsache, dass mutierte Mäuse lauter zwitschern, wenn sie sich in ungewohnter Umgebung befinden oder wenn männliche zu weiblichen Tieren gesetzt werden, ist es nach Ansicht Uchimuras möglich, dass ihr Zwitschern "eine Art Ausdruck ihrer Emotionen oder ihrer körperlichen Situation ist".
© 2010 AFP

description.hltext_display: Avanceret dansk luksus-Android-mobil åbner for salget
description.author: Morten K. Thomsen
description.content:
Endnu er det ikke muligt at få leveret en avanceret mobiltelfon fra danske Lumigon, der med deres Android-baserede T1-model (i sort og hvid) er klar til at udfordre smartphonemarkedet.
Men selskabet har åbnet deres webshop, så det nu er muligt at bestille en Lumigon T1, og dermed også afsløret prislejet for de nye telefoner, der fra Lumigons hjemmeside sælges uden abonnement. Uden moms vil en T1 koste 499 euro, eller hvad der svarer til godt 3700 kroner. Med moms kommer prisen op på godt 4640 kroner.
Siden lanceringen af den nye mobil har der været forholdsvist stille omkring telefonen, der ifølge de første meldinger kunne blive tilgængelig for enkelte kunder inden julehandlen, men som ifølge hjemmesiden nu først vil blive leveret i løbet af første kvartal 2011.
Lumigon T1 har blandt andet mulighed for at agere fjernbetjening til et fjernsyn eller et musikanlæg og er udstyret med HDMI, som det også er tilfældet med Nokias N8. Den har ICE lydmodul fra Bang & Olufsen for lækker lyd. Den berøringsfølsomme skærm på 3,5” og har multitouch som eksempelvis Apples iPhone.
Fakta:
Lumigon T1
Styresystem: Android 2.2
Processor: Freescale i.MX515
Skærm: 3.5" Multitouch
Kamera: 5 Megapixel
Diverse: Wi-Fi, GPS, Accelerometer, 3G, universel fjernbetjening, HDMI 720p

description.hltext_display: Gasexplosion: Lebenslange Haft
Cookie swap spans four decades
description.content:
Dec. 22, 2010 (United Press International) -- A group of seven New Jersey women said the annual Christmas cookie swap they started after college is now in its 40th year.
The women, who range in age from 52 to 63, said the group started when Chris Herbert invited four friends from the New Jersey Teachers College to get together and trade cookies and at one point the group swelled to 12 women, but has since waned as some moved away, The (Newark, N.J.) Star-Ledger reported Tuesday.
Herbert said seven women remain in the group, which meets at her Cranford home each year to talk about their families, the teaching business and trade cookies.
"At our age, we don't have 40 more to go, unless we're real lucky," said Adrienne Norris of Plainfield. "It almost feels like it's going to be winding down sometime soon. We'll be in the nursing home, you know, and we'll be having a cookie party in the nursing home."
(Source: UPI ) (Source: Quotemedia)

description.hltext_display: Oppositionelle Demonstranten in Weißrussland verurteilt
description.content:
Polizisten nehmen einen Demonstranten in Minsk fest
© AFP / Ksenya Avimova
Wegen ihrer Teilnahme an den Protesten gegen die Präsidentschaftswahl in Weißrussland müssen hunderte Demonstranten Weihnachten und teils auch den Jahreswechsel hinter Gittern verbringen. Nach Angaben der Polizei wurden mehr als 580 Menschen zu Haftstrafen zwischen fünf und 15 Tagen verurteilt - ob sie danach freikommen, ist unklar. Von Seiten der EU und der UNO sowie auch aus den USA kam heftige Kritik an dem Vorgehen. Mehrere Festgenommene seien freigelassen worden, sagte der Polizeichef der Hauptstadt Minsk, Leonid Farmagej.
Infografik: Weißrussland
© AFP /
Ein Sprecher der Polizei von Minsk sagte, es gebe keine Garantie dafür, dass die Demonstranten nach 15 Tagen das Gefängnis verlassen könnten. Die Verwicklung jedes Einzelnen in die Proteste werde überprüft. "Wir haben genügend Fotos und Videos." Den Angaben von Farmagej zufolge drohen einigen Verurteilten zusätzlich Strafen von bis zu 15 Jahren, da wegen "massiver Störung der öffentlichen Ordnung" gegen sie ermittelt werde.
Die weißrussischen Behörden waren am Sonntag und am Montag hart gegen Regierungskritiker vorgegangen und hatten im Zuge der Proteste gegen das Ergebnis der Präsidentschaftswahl mehr als 600 Menschen festgenommen, darunter sieben der neun Oppositionskandidaten. Zwei von ihnen, Rigor Kastusew und Dmitri Uss, wurden indes freigelassen, dürfen Minsk jedoch nicht verlassen. Nach Angaben der Wahlkommission entschied der seit 1994 regierende Staatschef Alexander Lukaschenko mit knapp 80 Prozent der Stimmen die Wahl für sich.
Unter den Verurteilten sind mindestens vier Journalisten. Nach Angaben des weißrussischen Journalistenverbands wurden im Zuge der Proteste insgesamt mindestens 25 Reporter festgenommen, darunter die AFP-Journalistin Maria Antonova, die mittlerweile aber wieder freikam.
Das weißrussische Justizministerium drohte mit einem Verbot derjenigen Parteien und Bewegungen, die an den Protesten teilnahmen. Lukaschenko selbst sagte am Montag in einer im Fernsehen übertragenen Pressekonferenz, das Land werde "keine sinnlose, konfuse Demokratie" mehr sein. "Ich warne euch", sagte er an die Adresse der Oppositionellen, "Ihr habt euch mit dem Falschen angelegt".
© 2010 AFP

description.hltext_display: Robbery at mid Wales building society
description.content:
DETECTIVES in mid Wales are hunting robbers who stole cash from a building society late on Monday evening.
Police at Newtown were alerted to the robbery at the Nationwide Building Society in the High Street, Newtown shortly after 10pm.
A Dyfed Powys Police spokeswoman said: "Shortly after 10pm two men wearing reflective jackets attacked security staff making a delivery to the premises and smashed the front door with a sledge hammer.Š
"Access was gained to the ATM machine and a large amount of cash was taken.Š
"The offenders quickly left the scene and got into a vehicle before driving away at speed.”
No one was injured in the incident.
Yesterday morning an area on the town’s High St was cordoned off as forensic experts swept the scene.
Uniformed officers were making door to door enquiries in the area and are studying footage taken from CCTV cameras in the area.
Dyfed Powys Police have also issued an appeal for anyone with information about the incident to contact detectives.
"Police would like to speak to any person who was in the High St area at the time or who saw any suspicious activity,” the spokeswoman added.
ANYONE with information about the incident should contact Newtown CID on 0845 330 2000 or Crimestoppers Cymru, anonymously and in confidence, on 0800 555 111.

description.hltext_display: Die neue Woll-Lust
Judge allows one of two brothers in $1M pot case out on bond
description.author: Lauren Pack
description.content:
HAMILTON One of two brothers charged in connection with a marijuana-growing operation valued at $1 million and located in a Liberty Twp. house is out of jail on bond.
A Bay Luong, 46, of Monroe and Phuc Ky Luong, 50, of California, were in court Tuesday; their cases were continued until Jan. 11, when Butler County Common Pleas Judge Charles Pater is expected to set a trial date.
Pater granted the request of defense attorneys Tamara Sack and Jim Cooney to have a drivers license confiscated by police returned to A Bay Luong so he can work. The younger brother is free on $100,000 bond while Phuc Ky Luong remains in the Butler County Jail in lieu of $200,000 bond.
Sack said A Bay Luong will be laying tile at job sites in Ohio and Northern Kentucky, which was approved by Pater.
The men were arrested Oct. 27 after a neighbor reported a strong chemical odor coming from 5782 Sunrise View Circle, and authorities said they discovered more than 1,000 marijuana plants growing throughout the two-story house.

description.hltext_display: Sơ tán khẩn cấp ở trụ sở chính Liên Hợp Quốc vì mùi lạ
description.content:
10 giờ sáng 21 - 12, các nhà ngoại giao tham dự các cuộc họp của Hội đồng Bảo an Liên hợp quốc và Đại hội đồng Liên hợp quốc tại trụ sở chính của tổ chức ở New York, Mỹ đã phải sơ tán khẩn cấp vì một mùi "lạ đáng ngờ" xuất hiện trong khuôn viên này.
Nhà ngoại giao các nước đã phải sơ tán sang các toà nhà khác nhau trong khuôn viên Liên Hợp Quốc cạnh sông Đông thuộc quận trung tâm Manhattan của thành phố New York, Mỹ. Tuy nhiên, chỉ 90 phút sau, họ được thông báo trở lại phòng họp và tiếp tục các cuộc họp của Hội đồng Bảo an và Đại hội đồng Liên Hợp Quốc.
Người phát ngôn Liên Hợp Quốc Farhan Haq cho biết, các cơ quan chức năng của Mỹ và Liên Hợp Quốc xác định mùi lạ đáng ngờ không phải mùi gây hại hoặc nguy cơ khủng bố.
Các nhà điều tra cho rằng, mùi lạ có thể bắt nguồn từ rò rỉ hỗn hợp giữa khí sulfur và khí metan từ tầng hầm tòa nhà Ban Thư ký Liên hợp quốc. Nước triều sông Đông dâng cao kết hợp với nước thải trong khu vực và trong khuôn viên Liên hợp quốc đã tạo ra mùi khó chịu này.
Sự cố này xảy ra ngay trước khi bắt đầu cuộc đối thoại giữa 150 thanh thiếu niên trên thế giới và các đại sứ của 15 nước thành viên Liên hợp quốc.
Theo Thông Tấn Xã Việt Nam

description.hltext_display: Piden más protección en las cercanías de Gaza
description.content:
JERUSALÉN, 22 Dic. (EUROPA PRESS) - Los vecinos de Hof Ashkelon (centro de Israel), han denunciado que no están lo suficientemente protegidos de los ataques con misiles caseros lanzados desde la cercana . Este mismo martes resultó herida una niña al caer uno de estos proyectiles sobre una guardería.
El presidente del consejo de Ashkelon, Yair Farjun, asegura que las 12 guarderías de esta circunscripción están protegidas solo parcialmente. "En otras palabras: los tejados están reforzados, pero las paredes no", precisó.
Farjun relató que estos centros fueron reformados hace tres años, en el marco de una oleada de ataques, pero ahora se estima que la reforma no fue lo suficientemente amplia como para garantizar íntegramente la seguridad.
Israel estableció en febrero de 2008 el objetivo de que todas las guarderías a menos de 4,5 kilómetros de Gaza estén completamente protegidas para 2011, "pero en realidad hoy hay muchas guarderías que no lo están", lamentó Farjun. Los vecinos de la zona, en cambio, son partidarios de recibir protección del sistema de defensa antimisiles llamado 'Cúpula de Acero', que todavía no está instalado.
El todavía jefe del Estado Mayor, Gabi Ashkenazi, ha querido matizar que este sistema "no es una respuesta perfecta". "La realidad es que la es frágil y volátil y no tenemos garantías de que la situación no vaya a deteriorarse", admitió el martes. Por el momento, el Gobierno y las fuerzas hebreas no han decidido el emplazamiento de la 'Cúpula de Acero'.
El Tribunal Superior de Justicia, entretanto, ha anunciado que estudiará la petición presentada por los vecinos de la zona para que dicho sistema sea desplegado cerca de sus comunidades. Los residentes aseguran que si no se cumple dicha condición, el Gobierno estará desatendiendo la decisión que le llevó a idear dicho mecanismo y miles de civiles quedarán expuestos a los ataques de la insurgencia gazací.

description.hltext_display: Leonard Peters
description.content:
The Bismarck Tribune runs two types of obituaries. A paid and a free version.
A paid obituary is $9 per column inch. It can include just about anything, including a photo. There is also a $5 setup fee and for this the family receives 10 copies of the newspaper. Please include a billing address and a phone number in case there are questions.
(For example: when accounting measures the column and it's eight inches, they take this times $9 plus the $5 fee. So the total cost would be $77).
If you would like to run the obituary more than once, the fees are as follows: second run, $4 per inch; and third run, $3 per inch.
A free obituary would include the person's name, age, hometown, if they are formerly from this area, when and where they died, when and where services and burial are (even if they are past) and a list of the immediate family survivors which includes spouse, parents, brothers, sisters, children, grandparents, and where they are from, and the number of grandchildren and great-grandchildren; but would not list in-laws or other relatives.
Please e-mail us back or call 250-8240 or 1-888-313-2240 with your preference.
If you want the paid obituary, we can call with the exact amount after publication. E-mail address is obits@bismarcktribune.com. Photos should be attached as jpeg files.
Deadline each day is 4:30 p.m. central time for free or paid obituaries and 5 p.m. central time for notices.

description.hltext_display: BGH prüft Urteil gegen Wegberg-Arzt
Incendian en Sestao un vehículo utilizado para la comisión de delitos
description.author: elmundo.es
description.content:
Las llamas han calcinado el coche, que figuraba como sustraído
También han afectado a otros tres turismos aparcados en las inmediaciones
El lugar ha sido utilizado en otras ocasiones para el mismo cometido
Efe | Sestao
Desconocidos han incendiado esta noche en Sestao (Vizcaya) un vehículo que se había utilizado previamente para la comisión de actos delictivos, según ha informado el departamento vasco de Interior.
Las llamas han calcinado este coche, que figuraba como sustraído, y han afectado a otros tres turismos que estaban aparcados en las inmediaciones.
Este suceso ocurrió a las diez de la noche en la calle Marcos Grijalbo del citado municipio, una zona que ya ha sido utilizada en otras ocasiones por delincuentes comunes para deshacerse de coches, según la misma fuente.

description.hltext_display: FedEx offers new option for China exports to US
description.content:
FedEx has further enhanced its same-day international shipping services from Eastern China to the US with pick-up times up to two hours later, Monday through Friday.
Customers in 25 Eastern China cities can now arrange for shipments destined for the U.S. to be picked up as late as 6pm[. The service enhancement provides customers with increased flexibility.
The latest service enhancement builds on the improvements Eastern China experienced from the launch of 777 freighter in January of this year, which flies direct from Shanghai to the FedEx hub in Memphis, Tennessee. The 777F has increased FedEx services capabilities through its fuel and operational efficiencies.
Meanwhile, FedEx has deployed a Boeing 777 freighter to service the direct connection from Hong Kong to the FedEx Europe hub in Paris, France, reported Manila Bulletin.
The 777F offers a payload improvement of 50,000 lbs per week compared to the MD-11 previously used.
âThe new aircraft and additional capacity enhances FedEx connectivity between the two regions. This latest deployment reflects how we continue to listen and respond to our customers' shipping needs,ââ said David Cunningham, president, FedEx Express Asia Pacific. âIt also positions FedEx well for an anticipated increase in trade as the European economy gradually recovers.ââ
FedEx launched its direct service from Hong Kong to its European hub at Charles de Gaulle airport in Paris in April 2010. The service allowed customers to enjoy overnight delivery from Hong Kong to key cities in major European markets, including Austria, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Great Britain, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, The Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden and Switzerland.
With the deployment of the 777F on the Hong Kong-Paris service, FedEx has now put into operation five 777F services from Asia. The first 777F service was introduced in January connecting Shanghai with Memphis. The Hong Kong-Memphis 777F service was launched in late March, followed by Singapore-Osaka-Memphis in July and Shenzhen-Memphis in November.

description.hltext_display: Schwarzpulverpaket in leerem U-Bahnwaggon in Rom entdeckt
description.content:
Sprengsatz konnte laut Bürgermeister nicht explodieren
Sprengsatz in leerem U-Bahnwaggon in Rom entdeckt
© AFP / Alberto Pizzoli
In einem leeren U-Bahn-Waggon in Rom ist ein verdächtiges Paket mit Schwarzpulver entdeckt worden, das nach Erkenntnissen der Behörden allerdings nicht hätte explodieren können. Das Paket sei in einem Schuhkarton an einer Endhaltestelle gefunden worden, teilten die städtischen Behörden mit. "Es scheint, dass die Apparatur nicht hätte explodieren können", sagte Bürgermeister Gianni Alemanno. © AFP / Alberto Pizzoli
Eine Untersuchung von Sprengstoffspezialisten habe ergeben, dass der "rudimentäre Mechanismus" in dem Karton keine Explosion hätte auslösen können, sagte Alemanno. Der Sprecher der Stadtverwaltung, Giampaolo Polizzaro, ergänzte, ein Teil des Zünders habe gefehlt. In dem Karton seien zwei mit Elektrokabeln verbundene Röhren gewesen, die mit Schwarzpulver gefüllt gewesen seien. Der Behördensprecher berichtigte damit seine vorherige Angabe, der Karton habe einen funktionsfähigen Sprengsatz enthalten. Seinen Angaben zufolge sollen Ermittler die Bilder von Überwachungskameras entlang der Linie B auswerten, um herauszufinden, wer den Karton in dem Bahnwaggon abgestellt habe.
Wie der Verkehrsbetrieb Atac mitteilte, hatte ein Mitarbeiter den verdächtigen Karton unter einem Sitz in einem Waggon der Linie B gefunden, nachdem alle Fahrgäste ausgestiegen seien. Der Zug, in dem die Entdeckung gemacht wurde, befand sich laut Behördenangaben auf einem Abstellplatz an der Endhaltestelle Rebibbia im Nordwesten Roms. Der Zug sei isoliert, der U-Bahnverkehr aber nicht unterbrochen worden, sagte der Behördensprecher. Bürgermeister Alemanno lobte die schnelle Reaktion der Sicherheitskräfte.
Die italienische Nachrichtenagentur Ansa meldete, der Schuhkarton habe zwei 20 Zentimeter lange Röhren mit einem pyrotechnischem Pulver enthalten, wie es für Feuerwerkskörper verwendet werde. Das Paket sei von dem Bereich, in dem sich Passagiere aufhielten, etwa 300 bis 400 Meter entfernt gewesen, berichtet die Zeitung "Corriere della Sera" unter Berufung auf Polizeibeamte.
Nach gewaltsamen Ausschreitungen bei Protesten von Regierungskritikern vergangene Wochen waren die Sicherheitsvorkehrungen in Rom verschärft worden. Am Mittwoch sollen weitere Demonstrationen stattfinden.

description.hltext_display: Israel complains to UN over Gaza rockets
description.content:
JERUSALEM (AFP) - Israel has called on the Security Council to issue a "clear and resolute" message against rockets fired into its territory from the Gaza Strip, in a letter to the United Nations body that was made public on Wednesday.
The December 21 letter, made public by Israel's foreign ministry, comes amid rising tensions on Israel's border with the coastal enclave.
On Tuesday, Israel launched a series of airstrikes against what it said were tunnels, training sites and weapons facilities in the Gaza Strip, in response to a salvo of mortar shells on Monday and rocket fire on Tuesday morning.
A Kassem rocket landed just metres (yards) away from a kindergarten in a southern Israeli kibbutz, wounding a teenage girl.
"The incidents of the past several days are part of an escalation of terrorist attacks emanating from Gaza that target Israeli civilians, towns, and military personnel," said the letter signed by Meron Reuben, Israel's UN ambassador.
"Israel holds the de facto authority in the Gaza Strip completely responsible for all of these incidents, which are carried out in clear violation of international law. In response to such attacks, Israel has exercised and will continue to exercise its right to self-defence."
The letter is addressed to US ambassador to the UN Susan Rice, the current chair of the Security Council, and UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.
It says three rockets and 18 mortars have been fired into parts of southern Israel from Gaza since December 19 alone.
"The Security Council, the Secretary-General, and the international community must send a clear and resolute message that these attacks are unacceptable," Reuben wrote.
"In addition, the Security Council must give appropriate attention to the smuggling of arms into Gaza, which continues to fuel violence and instability in our region."
On Tuesday, Israeli army chief Lieutenant General Gabi Ashkenazi warned that the relative calm that has prevailed since Israel's devastating Gaza offensive at the end of 2008 could quickly end.
"The situation is tense and fragile and could easily deteriorate, particularly if a rocket lands in a populated area," he told a parliamentary committee.
Between December 2008 and January 2009, Israel launched Operation Cast Lead, in response to hundreds of rockets fired from Gaza into the Jewish state.
The war cost the lives of 1,400 Palestinians, mostly civilians, and 13 Israelis, 10 of them soldiers.
Since then, the number of rocket attacks has dropped considerably, but the army says more than 200 rockets or shells have been fired this year.
